description: Ryoko-Sha is a samurai with distinct and unique skills. His understanding of strategy and tactics has allowed him to channel Ki to control the ebb and flow of battle. He is of utmost importance to the Takashi family, his Temporal Barriers are relied upon to keep family members safe.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Security Squad – "Tomb Cleaners"
description:
The Afrikakorps is finally back to where it belongs! Below the sands of Babylon lay many untold secrets, that demand brave men to search for. And these need protection from whatever they might find: that's when the Security Grenadiers come in. They are perfectly equipped to deal with what's below.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: ColourCards
description:
ColourCards (also known as ColoCards and ColourCallCards) is a game system. It consists of a deck of 100 unique coloured cards which are used to play many different games which are quick to learn and play.

The cards use five 'colours’: Red, Blue, Green, Black and White. Each card has three ‘aspects’: Word, Text and Background. The Word is the name of one of the five colours, the Text of that word is written in one of the colours, and the Background of the card is in a different colour. Three different colours may feature in a card's aspects, but if the background or text is the same colour as the word, the card will only have two colours.

There are many different games that can be played with ColourCards. These include ColourCall (spot which colour appears the most among a set of cards), ColourCount (write down how many times each colour appears among a set of cards), ColourSeek (deduce the aspects of a hidden card), ColourSet (find 2 cards with 5 colours), ColourPairs (find 2 cards with matching colours), ColourFind (a memory game of finding matching cards), ColourPerudo (a bluffing and guessing game where players challenge each other until only one remains), ColourFamilies (a cooperative game of making 'families' of 5 related cards), ColourCry (race against each other to put matches cards on top of each other to empty your hand), ColourSnap (a 2-player game of collecting your opponent's cards), ColourSpeed (quickly say the colour of the writing - based on the Stroop test).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Game System, Memory, Party Game

name: Flight Round the World
description: 4 player race game flying around a map of the world. The objective is to fly your plane between connected cities on a map of the world being first to the final stop.

name: The JRPG Tabletop Adventure Game
description:
This takes the elements of a JRPG and puts them into an epic co-op tabletop adventure game. Players explore on a mini-map, grinding away as they search for the set-piece encounters - large battles that make or break the players.

The game is set up in Acts, with each act being represented as a box of map tiles and encounters. Each act is meant to be played in a single sitting (1.5-2 hours), and then strung together into an epic 3-act story, concluding with a massive boss fight. That boss is defined by the earlier 3-acts and since the game features lots of different acts, there is lots of replay value.

During the game, players use a bag of tokens that represents their characters "stats." When players use various abilities, instead of rolling dice to check for success, they will draw tokens from their bag and check the various icons and runes to see if they succeed. As players level-up, they will swap in ever-more-impressive tokens.

These token bags are also used by the heroes' enemies. Get set on fire? Put a fire token in your bag and you'll be on-fire until you draw it out. Get poisoned? Put 3 Poison tokens into your bag taking damage each time one comes out until you find a heal poison potion, etc...

To win the game, players must battle through 3 acts and then a mega boss.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Dust Tactics: PanzerKampfLäufer  IV-F – “JagdLoki”
description: The PanzerKampfLäufer IV-F “JagdLoki” is the latest Flak (anti-aircraft) walker in service in the Axis army. The very first vehicles are currently being field tested by the Neue Deutsche Afrikakorps Panzer units. Should these tests be successful (and they seem to be) the "JagdLoki" might soon be found all over the planet. Mounting four 3,7 cm guns this walker can send a hail of explosive shells in the air, literally shredding any airplane to pieces. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Schützenpanzerläufer VI-G – "Stummel"
description:
The Sonderkraftfahrzeug 202/3 schwer Schützenpanzerläufer VI-G Stummel (Special Purpose Vehicle 203/3, Heavy Infantry Fighting Vehicle VI-G Stummel) is the latest evolution in Axis troop transport. Replacing the famed Sd.Kfz. 251/9 half-track, with which it shared the nickname ‘Stummel’ (Stump) for its short gun, this new vehicle takes it all to the next level by adding walker technology and the capability to carry a full section of infantry as well as a powerful gun. It can carry six soldiers inside its passenger compartment and another six between the hull and the Schürzen armored skirts.

The value of mechanized infantry has been proven numerous times since the war started. It is even more valuable in the desert environment in which the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps fights - no one wants to cross a desert on foot!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Team Yankee: Volksarmee – East Germans in World War III
description:
Volksarmee is a 32-page hardbook expansion to the Team Yankee tabletop miniatures wargame introducing the East Germans as the first non-Soviet Warsaw Pact army lists. The new army lists include a T-72M Panzer Bataillon, T-55 AM2 Panzer Bataillon, BMP Mot-Schützen Bataillon, and BTR-60 Mot-Schützen Bataillon.

While the East Germans use much of the same equipment as their Soviet comrades, there are some differences. The expansion introduces new equipment including the T-72M tank, T-55 AM2 tank, BTR-60 IFV, SA-9 Gaskin SAM, and Spandrel AT. The new equipment, as well as East German infantry, are being released as miniatures box sets with East German and Soviet data cards as appropriate. East German data cards for existing Soviet miniatures are included with the expansion.

The book also includes a fictional history of the East German units during WWIII, painting guides, and scenarios. It can be purchased as a physical hardback book or as a digital download in the Flames of War Digital app for Android and IOS systems. A copy of the Team Yankee rule book is required to play the game.

name: Dust 1947: Fallschirm RSO Laserkanone
description: The Raupenschlepper Ost mit Laserkanone is a dedicated antitank vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. It is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Oh Nuts!
description:
OH NUTS! is an exciting and humorous game that is perfect for friends and family. It is both fun for kids (ages 6+) and engaging for adults! Strategy, a sense of humor, and a bit of scheming is all it takes for loads of fun and laughter.

Each deck comes with 108 cards, and the total game time is anywhere from about 10-30 minutes. The goal of the game is simple. Be the first to collect 4 of the same kind of nut and move them from your nut "surplus" (cards in your hand) to your winter "stash" (cards you play on the table). Easy right? Ahhhh, but you need to watch out! The sly fox, ravenous raccoon, sneaky squirrel and stinky skunk are all after your nuts too, and players might play one of these cards on their turn to take a nut from you (or your stash) OR make you lose your turn by switching the direction of play!

--description from the publisher:

name: Genso Suikoden Card Stories Trading Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Genso Suikoden Card Stories is a collectible trading card game based on the Japanese role playing video game series, Genso Suikoden. The card game used characters encompassing virtually all of the main numbered titles in the video games with the exception of Suikoden V which did not appear in the cards at all. All of the cards as well as the rules are in Japanese only as the game has never been made available outside of Japan.

The game is a trading card game in which players draw cards from their respective decks and take turns playing cards onto the field. Each player uses a deck containing 50 cards. Before the game begins the players agree on a set number of VP (Victory Points) needed to win the game, the rule book suggesting 5 VP being the standard amount to win. Much like many other card games the game can also be won if the player's opponent cannot draw any more cards from their deck.

Players prepare their 50 card deck before the game and once prepared and turn order established, begin the game. Player's place Mission cards and attempt to fulfill the card's qualifications in order to acquire the VP gifted by the card, as marked on the card itself. The opposing player can also attempt to fulfill the cards qualifications, winning the VP for themselves.

Besides this, players can also attempt to construct Facilities cards. They are built in much the same way as Mission cards are played but do not provide VP. If the player succeeds in building the Facilities card they played, they gain the bonus granted by that card. If the opposing player wins, however, the Facilities card is considered to have been destroyed and no bonus is granted to either player. Character cards are used to either attack mission cards to earn the VP or to either build or destroy facilities depending on who played the Facilities card.

Play continues in this manner, with control passing between each player at the end of each turn until one player meets one of the victory conditions listed above.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Math, Video Game Theme

name: The Battle of Midway 1942 AD: Independence Day
description:
Independence Day Scenario : the following variant rules, and the accompanying counters, posit the Japanese launched their offensive a month later (July 3rd through 5th). Both sides would've been able to reinforce the forces used here, but would they have made a difference? Play the game with variants and find out!

Bonus scenario offered by Turning Point Simulation (for TPS's subscribers)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Mounted Samurai
description:
Following the murder of her husband, the widow Takeda Naoko dons the armour of a samurai and rides out to seek vengeance, all the while clinging desperately to the path of honour.

The rules for cavalry in the game are very simple (presented on the recruitment cards in this set), but adding even just one or two to your force changes things dramatically. The extra movement multiplied by 3 actions for your hero means you can get your most powerful model exactly where you need him (or her). And an all cavalry force is very interesting to play!

The onna bugeisha character (female samurai) comes with skill cards to show her sense of honour, family pride, and a haughty attitude to the low-born, plus a particularly interesting quest where you have to interrogate enemy samurai once they are vanquished to discover a secret. The idea is that she is tracking down her husband’s murderer. Could it be the ronin Tadashi?

Contains:

18 unique cards - including The Side of Right and Powerful Charge
1 metal character model - Onna Bugeisha Takeda Naoko
5 plastic mounted figures
5 metal 'neat bare' heads
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Starfire: Sky Marshal #2
description: This supplement to Starfire 3rd Edition was the first publication from the Starfire Design Studio (SDS). Its rules presage the changes that the SDS introduced in 3rd Edition Revised. The most important features are a set of rules for combining the unique tech system from the Akelda Dawn expansion with the traditional tech system (for both tactical and strategic/campaign games), and new rules for the campaign system (Imperial Starfire), including an abstracted Commercial Freighter Network (CFN).
categories: Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Atsushi and Shinobu
description:
The ronin of the Shiho remain a thorn in the Takashis' side. Without a fixed army the Takashi have found it almost impossible to hunt down and destroy the remaining rebels in the field, these cowed dogs hide in the woods and hills of the Dragon's lands. The solution has been somewhat answered in the excellent tracking and scouting skills of Atsushi, a former Satou family retainer now sworn to the Takashi. With his faithful hound Shinobu, rooting out those hiding in the dark, eager to savage any at the utterance of a single word from his master.

Blister contains two models, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Lady Oka
description:
Lady Oka is as deadly as she is beautiful. Raised in the luxury of Ryu she is a great power in the court and has learned to use the weapons gifted to her just as expertly as those crafted of polished steel and lacquered wooded in the dojo. A nimble and dexterous warrior she wields the traditional weapon of a lady of the samurai caste, with a natural ease and elegance. She moves across the battlefield with the poise and grace of a dancer, avoiding blows and missiles as if they were not even there.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Excavate!
description:
Excavate! is a game for 2-4 players. Each player takes on the role of a unique archeologist assigned to a fossil-rich pit that was recently discovered. Players will use their tactics to manipulate the board and attempt to create the most highly Acclaimed museum. As players continue the game, the play area will be changing as the players dig through the cards and find the sets needed to benefit them the most. The gameplay is about 30-45 minutes, and because of the simple rules, children as young as 8 years old can play it and be a competitor. However, this game offers a deep strategy level so even adults can compete. Easy to play, and very little luck is provided.

Overview of gameplay: players will take 5 actions each turn. These actions can be any of the following: dig, move, display or sell. When a player takes a dig action, they take one of two adjacent cards to the piece and flip it face up on the other pile. Any fave up cards can be interacted wroth by a player on their turn. They can display it in their museum, sell it for money, or simply ignore it. As players display various sets of fossils, they will increase in the number of Acclaim points. The player wit the most Acclaim points wins Excavate!
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Good Thing Bad Thing
description:
How well do you really know your friends? Have fun finding out!

Good Thing Bad Thing is a turn-based voting game with a bit of an edge. Each player has five Opinion Cards in their hand (Fantastic Thing, Good Thing, Who Cares, Bad Thing, and Terrible Thing). These cards are exactly the same for each player, and will be used to express how the players feel about certain topics in the Illustration Deck.

On your turn, as the active player, you will draw the top card from the Illustration Deck, and place it, face up, next to the Illustration Deck. Once the top Illustration Card has been revealed, you must decide which one of your five Opinion Cards best represents how you feel about the Illustration Card revealed. Whichever card you choose, place it secretly, face down, on the table in front of you.

Next, the inactive players attempt to decide which Opinion Card you chose to play, by selecting one of their five Opinion Cards, and placing it face down in front of them. Once all of the players have selected their “vote” and have placed their chosen Opinion Cards face down on the table, all of the chosen cards are revealed for scoring.

If no other players chose your opinion correctly, no one earns points. If at least one other player chose your opinion correctly, as the active player, you gain one point. If at least half of the other players chose correctly, you get two points. And if all of the other players chose correctly, you earn three points, as the active player. Inactive players who chose correctly gain one point.Using the Score Track, and the Player Tokens you and the inactive players adjust your scores accordingly.

Once scoring is complete, your turn is over, and play continues to the player on your left. This clockwise turn progression continues until one or more players reach 16 points. The first player(s) to reach 16 points wins the game. If the active player is involved in a tie for victory, they always win. Otherwise victory is shared.

name: Dernier Episode
description:
Dernier Episode ("Last Issue"), a retired superhero story telling game where the players invent their own superhero, then tell stories on how they caught supervilains in their young days.

Create the incredible story of your own superhero and retell his or her greatest fights against a multitude of supervillains! Invent crazy adventures by picking random tokens and contest your opponents’ stories to make fun of their heroes!

At the start of a game, each players are given 2 origins and 2 superpowers. They each choose a combo of 1 origin, and 1 superpower. They then one by one present their superhero to the other players by name, origin and superpower. It can either be very detailed, or simply naming the cards. This gives a feel about the game to new players.

Then supervillains are displayed face up on the table. On his turn, a player chooses a supervillain, and starts telling the story of how his superhero stopped him from accomplishing one of the two machiavellic plans displayed on the supervillain card.
He puts his hands in the tokens bag, and pulls out randomly a number of tokens equal to the supervillain difficulty level. (1 to 3) and throws them on the table and turns the hourglass. These token have random pictures on them, and the player must tell the story of how his superheroe stopped the supervillain mentionning his superpower, and his story must include all the randomly selected tokens. Other players may play one of their special tokens to add an additionnal random token to the story if they feel it's going to be too easy, and after the player finishes his story, they can also play special token to contest his story by either telling that it's the other players superhero who really did the job, and that this players version was not the truth, or that the superhero was beated by the supervillain and lost his encounter. To do so, they turn over the tokens to reveal new pictures, and tell their stories.

After that, player vote for the best story, and the winning player gets the supervillain card. If the supervillain won, the cards goes back at the center of the table, and is available to be picked again by the players.

Once a player has gathered a given number of supervillains (depending on the number of players), he picks 3 cards from the retirement deck, and chooses one to play with one last story with the same rules above, but adding how this adventure ended his life a sa super hero and went into retirement.

Once a player retires, every other players also tell one last story the same way, then we count the difficulty values of the supervillains taken by each players. The one with the highest score wins.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game

name: Questions 2 Outrageous
description:
From the website

Questions 2 Outrageous is a game for anyone looking to have a blast and learn more about friends, family or random guests!

Each round, two players pair up and answer 5 questions selecting the question category for each. All questions only have two possible answers, “you” or “me”. A third player draws one card at a time and asks the paired players the outrageous question. The paired players cannot discuss, signal or communicate in any way before answering. The third player counts them down (3, 2, 1) and the paired players reveal their answers at the same time. If the two paired players’ answers agree, each player receives 1 point but if they disagree then they do not receive any points. After 5 questions, two new players pair up and answer 5 new questions. The player with the most points after all unique pairs have played wins the game!

Categories provide specified questions based on the gender and relationship of the paired players. Questions have been divided into the following categories:
Men: For when two guys are paired
Ladies: For when two ladies are paired
Couples: For when the pair is in a relationship
Random: For all types of pairs

name: Werewolf vs. Vampire
description:
We are currently running a developer diary on Facebook. If you want to read about it here, please vote in the forum.

Werewolf vs. Vampire is a tactical game that brings these creatures to life through their unique abilities.
Plan ahead by building paths through this unknown world. But watch out, your opponent is trying to block you just as much as you are trying to block them!

This game was born from wanting to create something both my girlfriend and my son could play and enjoy, while developing their tactical skills.
So, both beginners and advanced students of tactics and strategy can play to win!
Will you play as the crafty Vampire? Or the vicious Werewolf?

The game supports 2-3 players with the playable clans of Werewolf, Vampire and Hunter.

The story of Werewolf vs. Vampires immerses you into the dark realm of these creatures.
Choose from playing as the Vampire seeking to retrieve the potion that will save their race, or the Werewolf who's tracking down the Vampire.
As the Vampire you'll be able to transform into a bat and cast powerful illusions.
As the Werewolf, you can use your savage bite as well as supernatural speed to gain the advantage.

Each game in Werewolf vs. Vampire is different. There are almost unlimited ways a game plays out, while maintaining the theme of the setting.
A bit of luck makes the game great for casual gamers, while the skill system will challenge tactical maniacs time and time again.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Fantasy, Maze, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Four Corners
description: Four Corners is a casual abstract game for two to four players. Be the first player to collect rings from all four corners of the board and return home in the center of the board. But you can only move in the directions the die roll allows. Four Corners is a race against your opponents that is suitable for the entire family.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Odd-Y
description:
Odd-Y is a connection game played on a hexagonal grid containing an odd number of sides of equal length (thus, an equilateral triangular board, or an equilateral pentagonal board, or an equilateral heptagonal board, etc.).



RulesOn each turn a player plays a single stone to an empty cell on the board; once placed, stones do not move. Corner cells belong to both of the sides that they join.

The Pie Rule applies: after the first stone is placed on the board, the second player can choose either to play a stone of his/her color, or swap colors with the first player.

A player wins by connecting a set of three sides of which the following is true: a triangle drawn of straight lines connecting the mid-points of each of the three sides contains the gameboard's midpoint (i.e., has the gameboard's midpoint inside its borders).

Draws are impossible in Odd-Y. For each way of completely filling an Odd-Y board with stones, there will always be one -- and only one -- winning group of stones.



CommentsWhen played on a triangular board, Odd-Y is also known as 3-Y. Likewise: 5-Y on a pentagonal board, 7-Y on a heptagonal board, etc. Note too that 3-Y is equivalent to The Game of Y designed by Ea Ea. Thus, Odd-Y is a generalization of The Game of Y. Ea Ea himself discovered 5-Y on a pentagonal board, which he called "Star Y" (stating the win condition as one wins by connecting three sides, not all of which are adjacent). Odd-Y generalizes 3-Y and 5-Y further, to any hexagonal grid board with an odd numbered of sides.

name: Bushido: Taka & Wrath
description:
The orphan cuts a miserable figure; many unwary strangers have rushed to the aid of the seemingly vulnerable and needy little girl. Those that do, more often than not, fail to survive their act of charity. Wrath materialises as if from thin air, channelling its rage, it’s very essence into destroying the adversaries of the Cult.
Blister contains two miniatures, two 30mm bases and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: TKG ARENA: Monster Mayhem
description:
The Elemental Kings need more than generals, they need heroes … to die for their cause.

This game requires the following components from TKG ARENA: The Elemental Kings & TKG ARENA: Brethren of Chaos.

MONSTER DECK: 1
STANDARD DECK (DECK): 1 for each player.
LIFE: 20 for each player (default)

Monsters from the MONSTER DECK can be sourced from TKG ARENA: Brethren of Chaos, this expansion itself or a mix from both games.

The objective of this game scenario is to survive an onslaught from a group of monsters randomly configured and represented by a MONSTER DECK in a cooperative manner.

Players start the game by drawing the top card from their shuffled DECK and the highest number starts first. The drawn top card goes back to the bottom of the DECK. Henceforth, each player takes turns to be the starting player for each cycle of attacks against the monsters in a clockwise manner. Players draw 5 cards from their STANDARD DECK as CURRENT HAND.

During each turn, a specified number of monster cards are drawn from the MONSTER DECK and each player may attack them according to the rules as described in TKG ARENA: The Elemental Kings. All attacks played automatically hits unless they are SOLO attacks that are LOWER than a game variable called the Strike Rate.

The Strike Rate refers to the minimum FACE VALUE of each solo card that needs to be used to remove a monster with 1 LIFE. Other categories of ATTACK HAND will automatically remove monsters according to the damage they deal. E.g. playing a TWINS can remove a monster with 2 LIFE or less automatically regardless of its FACE VALUE. Players may accumulate the damage of their attacks on 1 target but may not accumulate cards from multiple parties to form an ATTACK HAND.

Likewise, all attacks from any surviving monsters will hit automatically and the sum of all damage (based on the POWER of the monster) will be distributed evenly across all players (rounded up). E.g. 5 damage scored against 4 players means each player will suffer 2 damage. Players lose half (round down to the lower of) their remaining LIFE if they deck out and reshuffle for a new DECK. For every 10 POWER worth of monsters a player removes, his/her Strike Rate goes up by 1. When the Strike Rate is 10 for any player, SOLO attacks become ineffective.

The CHARGE BAR can be deployed for this game by increasing the deploying player’s initial Strike Rate by 1, and once deployed lasts till the end of the game. All spell effects and monster special abilities (printed for TKG ARENA: Brethren of Chaos) are not used.

The game ends when all the monsters are killed or when all the players are eliminated. The player who eliminates the most monsters in terms of LIFE wins. When there is a tie, the accumulated POWER of the monsters removed will be considered and the higher accumulated POWER wins.

Other than this new semi-cooperative mode of play, TKG ARENA: Monster Mayhem offers an additional new set of 32 monsters to complement the existing 60 monsters found in TKG ARENA: Brethren of Chaos.

Let the mayhem begin!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Word Burp!
description: Word Burp! is a fast paced word party game that rewards the fastest players each round. During each round 2 to 4 letters are randomly selected, one at a time, from a pool of letters. They are then placed, face up, in reverse order, within clear view of all players. Players are in a race to say a word that contains the letters in the order shown while meeting the requirements of that round (which are chosen randomly).
categories: Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: PrettyPro Game
description:
A little blush, some lip color, and eyeshadow can perk up even an exhausted look and fill the wearer with confidence and social energy. Yet, makeup can be a complicated thing. Youtube is filled with Internet celebrities who give expert advice, magazines roll out new style guides practically monthly, and everyone has a different face, meaning something that works for one person might not work so well for the next. To give younger girls an introduction to makeup, as well as a few deeper lessons about true beauty, Decker Sisters presents Pretty Pro: The Exciting Makeover Race Game.

To play, each player picks a character from the four playing pieces: Lauren, Izzy, Lexie, and Zoe. These characters come with profile cards that give a little background to them. These do not have any affect on the gameplay; they just allow players to get a little more into the game by picking their favorites. Each has a favorite color, pet, and hobby. They also give tips, both in fashion (“accessorize with scarves”), beauty (“always wear sunscreen when outside”), and internal beauty, described as a PrettyHeart quality (“always have a positive attitude”).

Pretty Pro is a straightforward game suitable for younger players. On a turn, a player rolls the dice and moves her or his character to a new square on the board. The goal is to land on each square necessary for the six components of a makeover: Lipstick, Blush, Eyeshadow, Brows, Earrings, and the PrettyHeart Tiara, which denotes inner beauty. The board also features stylish cities, where players draw cards. Some are good, such as “You are always kind with your words and never say anything hurtful. Find the PrettyHeart Tiara.” Others are not so good, “You went to bed very late last night. Now you feel grouchy and look tired. Lose your next turn.”

Facemask card. Players might be unlucky in landing on a Beauty Block square and missing out on something they need or gain the Facemask, which stops players from adding any new makeup. When a player lands on Beauty Block, she or he may move it to a new space, potentially keeping another player from getting the final square needed to win.

Perhaps the best part of Pretty Pro is the coloring sheets. The set comes with colored pencils and a pad for each character, and extras may be printed off the website. Through the game, whenever a player lands on a space she needs, the player may color in the makeup on the character’s face. This is a great introduction into style, seeing what colors work, what is not enough, and what might be too much.

Pretty Pro is a game for two to four players aged six and up. It is a moderately long game, taking twenty to thirty minutes to play, depending on how quick and lucky the players are. With its randomized dice-rolling play and fun coloring sheets, younger players will enjoy it the most as they eagerly assemble the parts of their makeovers.

Which make-up artist will win the game? Players use strategy, skill and luck as they race their friends to create the perfect look, but soon learn that inner beauty is needed before any makeover is complete. Game cards reward kindness and cover fun topics including beauty and fashion tips. Hurry to be the first to capture the PrettyHeart Tiara and finish the face to win this exciting makeover race!
Ages 6+, 2-4 players, 15-20 minute play time, reading not required to play.
Contents: Game board, 52 card deck, coloring pencils, facemask, beauty block, PrettyHeart Tiara, set of 4 make-up sketch pads, set of fun info cards, character playing pieces, stands, dice, instructions.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: East India Companies
description:
East India Companies is a competitive deck-builder where you take control of your shipping empire. Your fleet of white-winged sailing ships are the collateral you utilize to develop and build your strategy, ensuring your victory against your merchant competitors. Maritime portraitures of the 17th through 19th centuries give this deck builder a historic feel, and allow for a more intuitive notion of card/effect as play progresses.

Playing in similar fashion to Dominion, each player begins the game with a starter deck of ships (currency) and waterfront property (victory points). Leveraging their Fleet cards, players determine the best cards and combos from 15 stacks of 25 available with which to best build up victory points until such time as one of several end game scenarios are triggered. After a medium learning curve, a four player game should progress over the course of about 75 minutes. Some game mechanics do allow for player vs. player attacks, but will depend on what stacks the randomizer brings onto the table.

The goal of the game is to have the most waterfront property and Trade Routes in your deck once the final round is played. Any player may trigger the end game condition, but may want to consider what their opponents have been doing over the course of the game.

name: Jaque Quince
description:
Jaque Quince: Simple rules and short strategic duels inspired by Bauhaus

The objective of the game is to play in such a way that your opponent cannot respond to the opening play.
Jaque Quince has 3 different suits. Each suit has a reference value with respect to the other suits (i.e., every suit is bigger than another suit). Each suit has 5 cards, and the bigger number cards have greater value. Aces are higher than 3, 4, and 5, but they are lower than 2. As there are 3 suits each with 5 cards, there are a total of 15 cards.

Each player start's each hand of the match with 7 cards. The remaining card remains hidden to both players. One player opens a round with a card which must be responded to by a card with the same suit. If suit respond cannot be made, then must be responded by the same number. The player which played the greater value card opens next round. If responding player does not have either same suit or number then the opening player is granted points according to how long the hand was (i.e. the number of the round played).

Jaque Quince was part of the 3rd Annual 18 Card Microgame Contest in 2016 and is planned to be published in some microgames compilations during 2017.

name: Trono Oscuro
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Pretenders
description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a new recruit of the Super Hero Guild, an organization of beings with special powers dedicated to protecting all of humanity from Super Villains. On your first day, you have been assigned to patrol a distant cave alongside other new recruits - It was supposed to be an easy mission. Alas , the moment your patrol enters the cave, the very entrance collapses in on itself, trapping everyone.

Suddenly, you hear someone cry out and everyone turns to look at a dead recruit. The enemy has infiltrated your ranks! Before he kills the entire patrol, you must somehow stop him. To make matters worse, you do not know what powers these other new faces possess. Attacking someone without fully understanding their powers could very well get you killed instead. Time is also running out for everyone. If the standoff lasts too long, food and air will be depleted and that's certainly not a good thing!

Welcome to The Pretenders.

Highlights

1) The game does not require a narrator (everyone plays!) nor does it run on a digital 'app' and no, it doesn't play for 1 game day (or night) only. It is a complete game that plays out across many days!

2) Players CAN defend themselves (phew for all the alpha/strong players who always get killed on the first 'voting' simply because they play the game well and other players fear them) Instead, there is a limited amount of 'defending cards' players can utilize to protect themselves. Gone are the days of helplessly getting killed without reason or a chance to defend.

3) Something else is also gone in this game, and we sure don't miss it. The days when you only have ONE single ability and you can only do that same thing again and again. In this game, you are powerful beings who have an entire arsenal of powers at your disposal. Imagine that - a whole range of powers that you can use! And each character has a different set of skills!

4) There is another result besides the good guys winning or the bad guys winning - it is entirely possible that EVERYONE LOSES! You are all stuck in a cave, with lack of food and air. If it plays out too long, everyone dies!! (except the robot dude who doesn't breathe)

5) Even after elimination, players play as Rescue Crew from outside of the cave and can still influence the outcome for their 'team' by deciding what items to throw into the cave as the days go by.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Action Queue, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Desert Struggle
description:
Description from the publisher:

Desert Struggle (DS) is a stand-alone game in the War Storm series. Recreates the events of those days and allows the players to reproduce the most famous battles on the Africa Front at a tactical level. Players take command of either the Allied or Axis forces (or can play solitaire) in the tactical battles of each scenario.

DS while utilizing "Paths to Hell" base rules, incorporates new and adapted rules and additions for this new front. The WSS promises many hours of fierce fighting between the infantry, tanks, artillery and aircraft belonging to the armies enveloped in this conflict. Just a few of the additions include:
Sand Storm
Battalion officers
Recon rules
Flamethrower tanks
Motorcycle recon
Rocky ground
Gully
And many other desert special terrains
One 8'5 x 11" chart with many overlays

DS has a moderate complexity with good solitaire suitability. The system emphasizes the role of officers. Officers can activate units, coordinate with other officers and their units, call for artillery support, air support, smoke screens, influence moral checks, coordinate assaults, and much more. Rules for special actions.

Based on the principle of simultaneous execution, or simply "WE GO", a hybrid system of turns and "real time". The players must activate unit leaders to perform many actions (fire, assault, move, coordinate, etc). A turn ends when both players have completed all their activations. The scale is platoon level with units representing groups of between 30 and 40 soldiers, weapons units represents groups of 3-4 weapons and their accompanying crews (20-25 soldiers), and the AFvs-Transports representing groups of 3 to 5 vehicles and their corresponding crews. Scenarios are divided into turns representing about 12-15 minutes of action.

Turns are divided into the following phases: Command Phase, Initiative Phase, Activation Phase and Marker Removal Phase

The game uses isomorphic mapboards, each of which are aligned to any edge of equal length on any other mopboard. This allows for an almost unlimited number of combinations to create any terrain situation, including player designed scenarios. Each map hex represents a distance of approximately 150 to 200 metres.

name: Butchers vs Orcs!
description:
Butchers vs Orcs! is a two player roll and move game. The theme of the game is based on in-character rivalry between the Butchers Guild and the Imperial Orcs within the Live-Role Playing world of Empire by Profound Decisions.

Players roll dice to move their pieces (representing the Butchers and the Orcs respectively) in opposite directions along a track on the board, trying to get their own pieces from their opponent's base to the safety of their own base. Pieces are moved and taken if landed upon in a similar way to backgammon, however two key enhancements give it more depth than classic backgammon. Firstly, the middle section of the track is a dangerous no-man's-land where pieces cannot protect each other, forcing players to judge when best to risk making a run for it. Secondly, each player has a leader which is at greater risk than other pieces, encouraging players to play tactically to protect their leaders and get them to safety.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Glasgow
description:
User summary
Glasgow is an abstract game using glass tiles, for 3 players only. Some rules are adopted from Go, like placement restrictions and the Ko rule (hence the name Glass + Go = Glasgow). The designer feels the new rules make the game acceptable to advanced players.

The glass tiles are placed on a 6 x 6 grid. All tiles should be adjacent to other tiles orthogonally.
Up to 2 tiles of same color may be adjacent to each other; no blocks of 3 tiles may be made.

Whenever a tile is surrounded, the owner of the most surrounding tiles captures it. This scores the player 3 points. At the end of the game, each tile left on the 6 x 6 outer rim counts as 1 negative point.

The game ends when nobody can place any more tiles. Each player adds up their captured tiles, subtracts the tiles left on the outer rim, to get their final score. Most points wins.

The graphic design for the game was done by Decoct Design.

Publisher's summary
Glasgow（グラスゴー）はガラスタイルを使った3人専用アブストラクトです。

囲碁のルールにある着手禁止点やコウなどのルールを採用しました。

そこにマジョリティとバーストを混ぜた玄人向けの作品になったと思います。

タイルは６×６のエリアに置きます。
必ず他のタイルに接するように置かなければなりません。
同じ色のタイルは最大で２個までしか隣り合うことができません。

タイルの周囲４マス（２個連続したものなら６マス）が埋まるとマジョリティトップが内側のタイルを獲得します。
これは１枚１点となります。

また６×６の外周のマスは最終的に１枚マイナス１点になります。

全てのプレイヤーがタイルを置けなくなったらゲーム終了です。
獲得タイルから外周に置いたタイルの枚数を引いたものが得点となります。

name: Wizards Aren't Gentlemen
description:
Description from the publisher:

Wizards Aren't Gentlemen harks back to a bygone age where masters of magical might, their feckless apprentices and their wily minions play their part in stories of arcane rivalries and eldritch farce. Feud for control of an army of fiends and goblins, seek to be the first to wake the Nameless Tortoise of Peng, and visit other planes in your search for arcane might.

Wizards Aren't Gentlemen is a storytelling card game designed to be played over the course of a single session, without needing any prior preparation. With the improvised storytelling of a roleplaying game and the pick-up-and-play nature of a card game, you can jump right into things and tell a great story together over the space of a few hours.

The deck includes 5 characters: the naive and heroic Apprentice, the wily and demonic Bound Servant, the ancient and wise Hermit, the hardened and perceptive Inquisitor, and the reckless and dangerous Fringe Occultist. Players each pick a character and customise them by choosing ability cards, relationships with the other characters, and cosmetic details (name, appearance, personality etc). Then the group drafts Goals and Assets for each character - these are the objectives they're trying to achieve, and the resources they have to try to do that.

Play then starts, with each player taking a turn to play through a short scene of their character working towards their goal while the other characters help, interfere, or push their own agendas. Within scenes, characters can activate special abilities to do things like revealing an incredibly expensive possession, providing another character with a refreshing cocktail, or fixing someone with an imperious gaze that forces them to reveal their secrets. These are all paid for with a limited pool of tokens, meaning players must carefully plan when they use their abilities to guide the story in their preferred direction.

As characters make progress on their goals they accumulate special tokens they can cash in for an all-or-nothing attempt to complete the goal. Once someone has completed all their goals, the game wraps up with an epilogue showing how things worked out for each character.

User Note: this item also has an RPG item entry: Wizards Aren't Gentlemen
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Spellfire: Booster Pack, Set 7 – The Underdark
description: December 1995 - Originally, this was planned as the Spelljammer booster, but got changed when TSR could not buy back the rights to the game (it can still be seen in the first two chase cards of the set). This booster gave us another world (or pseudo-world, depending on how you look at it) to add to the universe of Spellfire. This booster was mainly focused on attacking, and it did a good job of it! This gave us the Underdark world (which is still argued whether it should truly be considered a world or just a characteristic), Quest spells (cleric spells castable only by champions of adjusted level 13+), and some of the funniest chase sets around (which was finally back to be 25 cards). Landmark Cards: Under_____ realms; The Triumverate realms; Drow Justice (#21); Hornung's Guess (#37); Mindkiller (#56); The Unnamed, Avatar of Gruumsh (#64); The Avatar Shar (#72); Ellorelloran (#93); Ring of Gaxx (c#4); The Deep (c#5); The Sword and Helm of Garion (c#21); and Broken Arrow (c#24).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: This Is Not a Test: Kickstart the Wasteland
description:
Kickstart the Wasteland is an exclusive PDF provided to backers of the This is Not a Test KickStarter.

This supplement provides two new multi-player scenarios ('Staking a Claim' and 'Worms of the Wastes') and a solo scenarios ('Rad Zombies must Die, Again!") in addition to rules for Remnant warbands, Johnny Atomic (the Johnny Atomic miniature was released in the KickStarter campaign) and statistics for six different robots and ten new monsters.

name: Heimatkunde
description: The whole title: "Würfelspiel "Heimatkunde" Hamburg - Altona". This vintage board game is about traveling in one of the biggest city of Germany - Hamburg. Players are taking cards and follow the instructions written on them. The first player who reach his final destination, wins the game.

name: Bushido: Rat Swarm
description: The large rat swarm proves the old saying of safety in numbers, where one rat falls another rises to take its place. The normally self-serving animals unite as one entity to bite and tear at opponents of the Cult. Armour does little to protect against the swarming mass of a plague of rats and samurai have been seen swamped while hacking numerous rats to pieces.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Wraith
description: A Samurais' honor is his life. Those foolish few to betray the ancient code are cursed. Trapped and tormented by their weakness they linger on, becoming twisted mockeries of their former selves. These evil spirits are a fearsome and tireless servants of Yurei.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Wanyudo
description:
Some say the Wanyudo are a curse of those that would break the tenants of Michi. I punishment for the Samurai who fail in their duty to their ancestors and a hex of the lands they survey. What is known is that these Wanyudo are the very vision of hell itself. Rampaging across the land, those brave enough to oppose the evil Yokai must endure the wicked flames that dance out from the flaming inferno charring flesh and melting metal, cooking the would be heroes alive.

Although thank fully rare, like all the Yokai of legend sitings are spoken of with greater frequency all over the Jwar Isles, further fuelling the unrest in the land. Some say that if the peasants of the land give up the lands lord the curse of the Wanyudo will move on.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dreamcatcher
description:
In Dreamcatcher it is up to you to compete with your fellow gods of the Dream World to protect the minds of mortal man. Through luck, skill and the help of your dream power will you be able to acquire nightmares otherwise bound for the human realm.

Every round new nightmares are made available to bet on using your finite amount of dream power cards combined with action cards. Based on player order, rarity of nightmares currently available and who is running ahead multiple strategies, and a bit of luck, are needed to come out victorious.

Dreamcatcher is a fast paced bluffing deduction card game for 2-6 players.

name: Ortus Regni: Winchester
description:
2-4 player, Ortus Regni variantmap

Before London was the center of England, before Canterbury was the seat of the English Church… Winchester was the capital of the Anglo-Saxon Kingdom of Wessex and its cathedral was the resting place for many of the first English kings. This is not an era of great urban centers, indeed, but Winchester rises above the other Burhs and fortified towns of the shires. It is the center of both political games and literacy, and hosts much of the pageantry of the kingdom.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political

name: Galatune: Fan Expansion
description: The Fan Expansion Pack DOUBLES the number of characters in your deck by adding 15 new characters inspired by our Kickstarter fans! Each fan character is competitively balanced and ready to integrate into your Galatune Starter Deck, putting new gameplay options and battle strategies at your finger tips.

name: Rec-League Quidditch
description:
Rec-League Quidditch is an exciting quidditch-themed tile-placement game with some elements of skill-building and risk analysis for two players. During the game, each player will control three characters on a team. These characters will compete for control of the quidditch pitch, using the quaffle, bludger, and snitch to score points, as well as continually improving their strength, speed, and skill to win the match.

Each round is played by placing the character tiles in a line on the pitch, in between tiles representing the three quidditch balls. The location on the line,as well as the particular ball that each character is adjacent to will determine the possible action they can take for the round. Once all characters have been placed, they are activated by either using adjacent ball tiles to score points, or using them to build up their strength, speed, or skill.

Furthermore, one character on each team will be the designated seeker, and will be hunting down the snitch. Catching the snitch will take not only skill, but a little luck as well, so players would be wise to make sure they time their attempts to catch the snitch when it would only be to their advantage, and not their opponent's.

Catching the snitch awards a team 50 points, and the game is over after the round ends in which either the snitch is caught, or one team has scored at least 150 points total. The winner is the team with the most points at the end.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Stat Check Resolution, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Challenge Golden Bell OX Quiz game
description:
Proceed to the voice of the challenger Golden Bell TV host.
challenge mode and single mode support.

The game consists of three rounds in total.
Each round is made up of OX quiz.

Round 1: All Participation Quiz
Round 2: Individual Quiz
Round 3: Speed Quiz

The purpose of the game is to match the golden bell quiz. The 50th quiz.

At the end of Question 49, the person with the highest score challenges the Golden Bell Quiz.

There is no middle drop.
The winner of the Golden Bell quiz will win.

name: All Quiet on the Potomac
description:
From the publisher's website:

"All Quiet on the Potomac" is our Eastern Theater scenario supplement. This massive PDF covers every major battle fought in the east, from 1861-1865. Each historical scenario has been carefully researched, including color maps and Orders of Battle for the armies.

Scenario List

First Manassas, July 1861
Seven Pines, May 1862
Gaines Mill, June 1862
Glendale, June 1862
Malvern Hill, July 1862
Second Manassas, August 1862
Antietam, September 1862
Fredericksburg, December 1862
Chancellorsville, May 1863
Gettysburg, July 1863
The Wilderness, May 1864
Spotsylvania, May 1864
Drewry's Bluff, May 1864
Cold Harbor, June 1864
Third Winchester, September 1864
Cedar Creek, October 1864
Sailor's Creek, April 1865
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: #hashtags
description:
The objective is to create a tweet/response for the selected #hashtag.
For example, if the chosen #hashtag by the round leader is '#useless' players write something that is useless, such as 'Grandmas bra' or 'My husband's handyman skills'.
Your response can be anything, as long as it relates to the #hashtag; Tell the truth or make something up; Be creative, witty and funny.
Players get one point for each response they match with the correct author, and two points are awarded by the round leader to the player whose response they like best.
The game ends either when all players have been round leader, or after a predetermined number of rounds. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: StrongSword
description:
StrongSword is a slightly quirky but simple-to-learn set of rules designed for playing tabletop fantasy wargames.

Many fantasy wargames place in your command of a huge army divided into tactical units or just a handful of models acting independently of one another. StrongSword places you at the head of a mob of ferocious frothing fighters, be that a large or small mob of them!

The style of play is quite straightforward, but the real challenge is working out how to use the simple rules to command your warriors in battle as effectively as possible. This is because, although all of your models act independently from one another, your whole force is guided by the single tactic or ‘Battle Stance’ you set each turn.

Your Battle Stance is a simple order that’s either shouted by leaders over the tumult of battle, indicated by flag waving, horn blowing, or similar battlefield communication. It tells each of your warriors how to act this turn – maybe they’ll be ordered to be defensive, or aggressive, stand back to catch their breath, or go completely nutty and charge at the nearest living enemy.

The key focus of commanding your warband in this arena of mob warfare is that you must choose the single Battle Stance that strengthens to your current situation – you can’t go giving differing, complex orders to different warriors under your command because you’re too busy fighting and simply don’t have that luxury of time. Instead, shout your commands as loudly as you’re able to and let your warriors do their best!

Combat and morale is kept pretty simple, as are the spells you can cast. This means that the game is driven by your Battle Stance choices, which presents players with the feeling of really commanding a smallish group of warriors on a low-tech battlefield.

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Parademon Invasion Force
description: This expansion introduces Parademons to the DC Universe Miniature Game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.

name: Italia 1917-1918: A Farewell to Arms
description:
Italia 1918 - A Farewell to Arms is an operational wargame which simulates the fierce fighting which pitted the troops of the Entente (Italy, France, Great-Britain and USA) against those of the Central Powers (Austria-Hungary and Germany) during the period between the Battle of Caporetto (Oct 1917) and the Villa Giusti Armistice (Nov 1918).

Two A1 maps, printed front and back, are included. The “global” one covers the terrain between the Adige River and Trieste, to allow the players to simulate the whole campaign from Caporetto onwards. The “zoom” map, with enlarged hexes, covers the terrain from Adige to the Adriatic sea in order to concentrate on the main combat zone after the Italian retreat: the Piave River, the Monte Grappa Massif, the Asiago Plateau and the Trento area & for the second one the zone of the Austro-German offensive on the Isonzo that has been immortalised under the name of the battle of Caporetto.

The 2 ½ countersheets include a complete OB for all the belligerents, from tenacious Italian “Alpini” to the redoutable German “Alpenkorps”, along with Austrian “Kaiserjäger”, Hungarian “Honvéd” divisions or French “Chasseurs des Alpes”.

Basic rules allow the players to tackle 6 variously sized scenarios, from 1 to 6 hours of play, using either a part of the board, or the map in its entirety. 5 of the scenarios are designed to be played on the ‘zoom’ map, in order to take maximum advantage of the improved play experience provided by the larger hexes.
In chronological order, the scenarios are:

“Thunder at Caporetto” (4 turns/ portion of the “global” map) covers the offensive of von Below’s XIV. Armee, which caused the collapse of the Italian IIa Armata and set in motion the retreat to the Piave.
“1st Piave: the stopping battle” (3 turns / all of the “zoom” map) simulates the last attacks launched jointly by AH and German units, before the Germans were withdrawn to the Western Front. These assaults were only contained by the fierce resistance of the Italian army on the Monte Grappa-Piave line, the last obstacle before the Venetian plain.
“Radetzky: Conrad’s last gamble” (1 turn/ half of the “zoom” map) is a 1 turn scenario covering the offensive launched in the Asiago region in June 1918 by the former Imperial Chief of Staff Conrad von Hötzendorf, an offensive that was stopped by the joint efforts of Italian, French and British troops. This is the game’s introductory scenario.
“Albrecht: Boroevic’s missed opportunity” (3 turns/ half of the “zoom” map) simulates the offensive launched by Army Group Boroevic on the Piave at the same time as “Radetzky”.
“2nd Piave: The Battle of the Solstice” combines “Albrecht” and “Radetzky” in a big 4 turn long scenario using the whole of the “zoom” map.
“3rd Piave: Revenge at Vittorio” (4 turns/ whole “zoom” map) simulates the final Entente offensive which is now known as Battle of Vittorio-Veneto.



Advanced rules allow the players to simulate the whole campaign; they introduce the reconstruction of destroyed units, the management of strategic reserves and the use of random events cards (50 for each side) with various effects and evocative titles such as “Rommel”, “Hemingway” or “I ragazzi del 99” (“The boys of 99”), for example.
The campaign game is played on the “global” map, beginning with the Caporetto offensive and lasts 23 to 36 turns.


Optional rules will allow players to explore several “what-if” possibilities.
For those who do not know the system, the basic rules of Somme 1918 can be consulted while waiting for the online rules of Italia 1918, which will be similar but with some adaptations and novelties.
• Boxed game
• 2 A1 double-sided maps
• 1 A1 single-sided map
• 700 counters
• Rules booklet in english
• 24 pages campaign rules booklet in english
• 1 set of 100 event cards
• 2 A3 double-sided player aids [ Allied screen, Central powers screen ]
• 3 A4 single-sided player aids [ Strategic reserves for both sides & other tracks ]
• 4 A4 double-sided player aids [ Scenario setups ]
• 2 A4 single-sided player aids [ Reinforcements & Terrains ]
• 4 dice

(from Nuts Publishing website)

name: Kickin' Your Caterpillar
description:
This a set collection / take that card game for players of all ages where each player tries to get enough pieces to build their caterpillar all the while, using other cards to prevent their opponents from finishing their caterpillars.

The goal is to build your caterpillar by collecting and playing A Head piece, a Tail piece and four body pieces before the other players.

Components
This game deck is made up of 7 Head cards, 28 Body cards, 7 Tail cards, 20 Red attack cards, and 6 Green defense cards.

To complete your caterpillar you need to have in play in front of you, one Head, four Body segments, and one Tail segment. If you have those six cards in play in front of you, you win.

Other players will try to force you to discard pieces, or even take pieces from you for their own caterpillar.

name: Wasted Youth
description:
Wasted Youth is a satirical look at the things we obsessed over when we were young, possibly still do for some of us. Have you ever gotten so caught up in collecting comic books that your forgot they are supposed to be read. Have you ever bought a toy but never touched it once because it has to stay mint on card. Then Wasted Youth is about you.

Wasted youth is a simple collection mechanic. Each player tries arrange collections and empty their hand first. The twist are the event cards. Event cards let you steal other players scored collections, set them back to square one or just twist them up in general.

name: 発見！ねこロジー (Hakken! Nekology)
description:
Discovered! Cat Roji(発見！ねこロジー)

The hidden covers of the cats will start!
You should not be distracted by mice once again.
Read the other's psychology and find hidden cats!
The cat who did not find anyone until the end won!

■ Hide the cat before starting the game

Each player receives a total of seven hands, including one "cat"
Let's sort in any order.
The initial placement is the strategy's point of where to put "cat" at first.
The game starts when sorting is over!

■ What to do on the turn is "① Search for cats" ⇒ "② effect of card effect" ⇒ "③ escape cat"

① Search for cats
Please draw 1 card from the hand of the player next to the left.
Let's think carefully where the other concealed the cat.

② Handle the effect of the drawn card
Put the card you drew into the far left of your hand and activate the effect.
There are six kinds of card effects, such as "Footprints" handing the rightmost hand and "Tatari" that my hands end immediately.

③ Escape the cat
Finally, move any one of your hands to the far left of your hand.
Is the moved card a "cat"? Is it?

■ Let's hide until the end

The player who found "cat" drops out of the game.
The player who did not find "cat" until the end will be the winner!

■ Easy card games without tables required

There is no deck or deck, and it has become a game that will advance with your hand alone.
You do not need to use a table, and because the playing time is short, you can enjoy it anytime and anywhere!

· 28 cards
· 1 instruction sheet
publishers: Full House Games (フルハウスゲームズ)

name: Alle meine Tiere
description:
Discover, assign and count domestic animals.
It's a tiptoi game for very young players (3 year olds).

Where does the fox live? And what does the hedgehog really love to eat? How well do you know about horses, cats ...?
With the game "All My Animals" and the tiptoi device you will learn a lot about domestic animals, their habitats, their animal children, and you can playfully get to know more about numbers.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Puzzle, Trivia

name: Team Yankee: Iron Maiden
description:
The British are coming! With its usual professionalism, the British Army had prepared for war. Now, as the Soviet Army flooded across the border into West Germany, it was ready and waiting. Scorpion and Scimitar light tanks skirmished with the Soviet forward detachments as the Chieftain armoured regiments waited. The infantry held the towns and woods, forcing the enemy into killing zones. If anything broke through, the airmobile troops in their Lynx helicopters would hold them. The British Army is ready.

Iron Maiden provides players with Army lists for the “Death or Glory Boys’” Chieftain Armoured Squadron, the Irish Guards’ Mechanised Company, the Gordon Highlanders’ Airmobile Company, and the Queen’s Dragoon Guards’ Medium Recce Squadron, as well as history of the British Army of the Rhine, painting guides and scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Chemikum
description:
Chemikum is a journey of discovery into the world of elements.

For 2-6 players from 10 to 99 years. Playing time: 4 players approx. 40 min.

Chemikum - a communication game that aims to inspire children and young people for chemistry. With fun, joy and happiness, step by step knowledge points are collected to reach the Bachelor or Master's degree.

Chemikum is a very simple board game that integrated the periodic table of the elements.

In a unique mix of knowledge and advice game, up to 6 players fight to get points for a bachelor's degree. In another round, the Master's degree can be earned.

The two-sided printed schedule offers 2 difficulty levels:
PSE with long name (lighter) or PSE only with short description of the elements. CHEMIKUM also provides the incentive, for all levels of knowledge, to take the opportunity to discover the chemistry, together with the possibility of compiling the difficulty level by selecting the question cards themselves.

In four card categories, a wide range of chemistry is presented:

PASSWORD:
Difficult to pronounce chemical compounds (for correct pronouncement one gets points), which are briefly explained on the map;

ACTION:
simple way to collect points or lose, there is reward and with luck you can get closer to the target field

PSE-KNOWLEDGE:
This question category is linked to the PSE indoor playfield

ALLTAGS-WISSEN-CHEMIE:
Questions about the chemistry. Many have contributed to this question category: children, adults, grandpa and grandma. It makes us aware that the chemistry of our everyday life is an integral part of life.

name: Clash of Kings
description:
Players aim to crown their king as emperor by reaching the throne (the central square) within the palace (the central 9 squares on a 9x9 board) or by killing all the rival kings.

Simple to learn as most pieces move like in chess but very different to play as four armies quickly clash on a crowded battlefield, sacrificing pieces to clear the way for their king to reach the throne.

With three or four players, multi-player rivalry adds interest and complexity as alliances are made and broken. The two-player variant is more strategic, with each player playing two allied armies, moving pieces from each of their armies on alternate turns.

A version of this game called 'Battle for Anvil' was created for playing in the Live Action Role Playing world of Empire.

name: Flip the Script
description:
Flip the Script is a creative party game that has you outdoing Hollywood, pitching movies your friends want to see.

Players have to come up with a pitch for a new movie, armed only with a random selection of actor, genre, and theme cards.

You will quickly be arguing over whose pitch will be a big box-office hit, and whose will never see the big screen.

The game includes 200 actor cards, 100 genre cards and 100 theme cards.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Kill Hitler
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players set in the period 1940-45. Players represent various elements of the German Resistance trying to assassinate Hitler.

Through card play players strive to be the first player to assassinate Hitler.

Players share a common deck comprising 6 card types:
Method (Plot Card. Weapons used in an attempt)
Conspirator (Plot Card. Key Personnel involved)
Venue (Plot Card. Exact Building or Location the Fuhrer is currently in)
Locale (Plot Card. City or Region the Fuhrer is currently in)
Save (Events that Prevent an assassination)
Action (Events with Special effects)

To set-up the deck is shuffled and each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards.
Players take turns with each turn having 5 phases:
1. Fate Phase
- Draw 1 card from the deck and put it in your hand.
2. Plot Phase
- You may put 1 or more plot cards into play face up in front of you.
- A Complete Plot consists of 1 of each of the 4 different types of Plot Cards: Method, Conspirator, Venue, Locale.
3. Foil Phase
- Any opponent may play (discard) 1 or more save cards.
A save card causes the target indicated plot card to be discarded. You may immediately play a plot card from your hand to replace the card eliminated by the save card.
4. Kill Phase
- If you have complete plot in play, roll 1 die for each of the 4 plot cards. (This is called the assassination attempt).
For each odd number you roll, discard 1 plot card. If all the rolls are even, the attempt is a success, you have killed Hitler, and you win the game.
5. End Phase
- Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards.

If Hitler is not killed after the players have gone through the deck twice then Hitler survives, the German Resistance is crushed, and all the players lose.

name: Star Wars Spin
description:
A star wars dexterity game. It contains 20 miniatures of star wars with a special round base, called Rollinz.
It has two mode of plays. In the first one players take turns spinning their miniatures in the circular board in the back of the box and the most points win. It can also be played solitaire against your own high score.
On the second one players try to hit the minis of other players. If they hit them then the other player lost that mini, but if they dont hit anything, then they lost the mini used in the shoot, so the game is quickly over (every round are mini lost)

name: EQUAL
description:
EQUAL is a quick mathematical challenge between 2 players using just a standard deck of cards (and 2 dice).

By combining cards, players attempt to form a calculation to equal, or get the closest possible to, a randomly generated target number.
Drawing additional cards may help but, the more cards a player takes, the more they have to give to their opponent.

The rules are just a single page.

EQUAL was an entry in the 2017 Two-Player Print and Play Game Design Contest

name: Peixes
description:
The water is dirty in the center of the lake complex. So, the fishes must find their way to the other lakes in the extremities of the lake complex. There, they will have pure water and a peaceful time.

Each player controls a quantity of fishes. He must change the spaces on the board to create a way straight to a clean lake. As more tiles the way have, as more it changes the lake itself.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Konflikt '47: Resurgence
description: The first supplement for the Konflikt '47 Weird World War II wargames rules, this volume presents a range of new material for the game, including: - New army list: The Japanese make their presence known on the battlefields of Konflikt '47. - New units: Options for troops and technology that can be added to the armies presented in the rulebook. - Special characters: Field the best of the best, elite men and women who may singlehandedly be the crucial element between victory and defeat. - New background: The history of the world of Konflikt '47 is detailed in more depth. - New rules: All-new means of waging war, including material previously published online.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Balanced Life in a Cruel, Cruel World
description:
This is a roll-and-move game reminiscent of Careers, but focused on finding a perfect balance among eight Values: Affection; Respect; Skill; Enlightenment; Influence; Wealth; Well-being; and Responsibility. The rules include a Leader's Guide for using the game in classrooms.

The board consists of an outer loop of 32 spaces and eight inward loops of 7 spaces each, one loop for each of the Values. When landing or passing by the entry to a loop, a player may choose to enter that loop.

Inner and outer tracks both have blue "Enhancement" and red "Deprivation" spaces, with the outer ring half and half, and the inner loops all 5:2 positive. The outer loop also has spaces where players take either "Circumstance" cards or "Cruel, Cruel World" cards, as well as Transaction Post spaces where players can trade points with each other. Both sets of cards have good and bad outcomes, and most result in "universal" point gains or losses, where the player may choose which value to change.

Each player has a thick scoreboard with pegs that all start at zero for each Value. The pegs move +/-1 for blue and red spaces on the outer ring, and +/-2 in the loops. The winner is the first player to achieve a balanced life by having the pegs in all eight values on his board line up vertically on the plus side of the scoreboard (all at +1, all at +2 or all at +3).

name: Guild Ball: The Mortician's Guild – The Master of Puppets
description:
Description from the publisher:

“When you play them, you have to surrender control. You can’t simply do what you want. You’ve got to force them to let you do it. Sounds easy? It’s not.”
- Greyscales, Fishermen’s Guild

Obulus' veins course with dark power. Feared as much he is hated, he's as foul as a living cadaver. Enslaving minds to obey his undying will, opponents are but meek instruments for victory. No one can escape his cruel grasp.

Obulus' team of Morticians leave their opponents mourning in a wake of disruptive manipulation. Menacing and unforgiving, the Morticians actively dismantle their opponent’s strategies. Coaches who want to outsmart and exploit their opponents will live for the Mortician’s Guild.

Laborers of death, this set includes a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Obulus, Dirge, Silence, Cosset, Ghast, Graves.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Potential
description:
Potential is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.

Move your charged particles (represented by dice) around the board, attempting to strategically transfer charge between your own particles, or steal it from your opponent's particles, by jumping over other particles!

Particles that have been drained of charge (by being jumped when at 1 charge) or overcharged (by jumping when already at 6 charge) are removed from the board.

The winner is the last player to still have particles on the board.

Potential is currently available as a free print and play, the files for which can be found on this page.

name: Ember: Mage Nights
description:
Description from the publisher:

Can you be the Archmage’s favourite by conjuring the most powerful mythical creatures? Use their unique abilities to bolster your magical powers or hinder your enemies in this game of luck, strategy, magic, and creatures of legend.

Ember: Mage Nights sees a reprint of the wizard playing cards (in order for Ember to be a complete and playable game once more) and also includes thirteen Spell cards that offer even more replayability. With all new luck-mitigating rules and ever more game-play additions, this may be the final expansion for Ember, but for the players, the quest is only just beginning!

WIZARD CARDS: The Wizard Cards are a reprint of the original core game Wizard cards in a brand new box. These cards are completely reworked to make them crystal clear and to remove any of the vagaries that surrounded some of the original cards.

THE SPELLS: Mage Nights contains thirteen brand new spell cards that go in the Draw Deck and allow you to either use those powers as wild cards in conjuring, or to perform spells like the mighty Fireball, or to heal damage done to your creatures with Cure Light Wounds.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Panzer Grenadier: Na Forsai Cosanta
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Ireland eventually mobilized two divisions and two brigades, deployed along the border with Northern Ireland to resist a British invasion and along the island’s southern coast to fight off an attack by Britain or Germany. The Army eventually reached a strength of 38,000 and saw no action during World War II, thought tens of thousands of Irish men and women volunteered to fight the Nazis in the British armed forces.

Na Forsai Cosanta lets you send the Irish into battle anyway, in a small set of scenarios depicting a German airborne assault on the Emerald Isle. The Irish are tough, but they’re not very well-armed. The St. Patrick's Day 2016 Golden Journal includes 24 new laser-cut, mounted pieces depicting Irish troops and leaders in their traditional kelly green. It’s a good-looking set. Plus you get scenarios for their use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Rotfather: Contrabando
description:
The Rotfather: Contrabando (contraband) is a game in The Rotfather Universe, where rats, cockroaches, frogs and spiders live in an underground society, resembling the 40's NY.

This is a cooperative game with an infiltrated saboteur with strong presence of deduction. Players initially receive a random pack of cards that contains a character card and a set of four specific cards. One of them will be the Detective (saboteur) and the others will be Smugglers. In at most 6 rounds, players must then exchange their cards, in order to complete a set of five cards their character needs. They also can buy new ones from the central pile. The goal of the Smugglers is that some of them collects their 5 needed cards. The number of players that need to reach this goal varies by the number of participants.
