The objective of the Detective is to prevent this number of opponents from fulfilling their goals, for example by holding cards they need or by pushing foward unnecessary cards. In addition, the Detective may terminate the game earlier by stopping the match at any time when calling out and arresting the player he believes to be the character Al Kane.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Black Market Bonanza
description:
We’ve all heard stories of the great heroes and legends that span the worlds of fantasy, raiding dungeons, toppling strongholds, and slaying malicious monsters. We’ve all sat and listened to the tales of evil warlords and sorcerers raising armies and rancorous beasts to do their biddings. Now’s your chance to be the very source of all these stories! Jump behind the seller’s table. Rife through all the alchemical, magical, and sharp bits and goodies that make up the very foundation of the worlds of fantasy! And match them all up with the tricky characters that are willing to buy ‘em for your good ole fashion gold!

Black Market Bonanza is a living card game where Players select their special Seller Character Card and draw their own Seller's Table worth of Contraband Items to sell to Customers for precious gold coin counters. In the Contraband Deck, Players will find unique Contraband Items, some with special abilities, and tricky Sleight Of Hand Cards that be used for your own benefit or at the expense of your opponents! In the Market Deck, Players will draw the coveted Customer Encounters, the fun and random Market Events, or the dreaded Guard Encounter Cards! Beware of being thrown into Lockdown! Can't play the game much if you're stuck in a cell! All things in the Market Deck depend on your Seller's Skill Checks and lucky dice rolls, so be sure to choose your Seller wisely!

Your ultimate goal is to be the first Player to get to 10 Gold! So get those coins clanking into stacks, get all your items sold, and be the first to take control in Black Market Bonanza!

name: 5150: Platoon Leader
description:
Description from the publisher:

5150: Star Army – Platoon Leader is the bridge between the man to man combat of 5150: Star Army and battalion level 5150: Battalion Commander. Platoon Leader is a stand-alone game compatible with both.

THE WARS HAVE BEEN GOING ON FOR YEARS.

The Gaea Prime Empire is still hungry and still has many enemies, including a new one – the Zhuh-Zhuh. The Bug menace is at its worst and everyday there are reports of Hishen gains, closer and closer to the Home World. Darkness is coming and the body count is growing.

I like to think we’ve got them where we want them.

You’re a Platoon Leader in command of three Squads. You can lead Gaea Prime soldiers, Hishen clones, Grath creatures, Zhuh-Zhuh “monkey boys”; heck even bone crunching Bugs, it’s all up to you.

Although we’ve increased the size of your games, we’ve kept the detail from 5150: Star Army while streamlining the mechanics. Now you can play with more figures in less time.

We’ve expanded the Campaign Rules, not made them harder. We’ve built upon those found in 5150: Star Army to now include the option to fight from planet to planet. In short, more fun, less work.

Inside you'll find:

Rules to easily handle a full platoon for infantry and their support weapons.
A pre-generated campaign linking your Missions, yet still allowing you to play one-off battles when desired.
A planetary conquest campaign.
A system that rewards your successes and punishes your failures.
New Aliens to fight, plus the old Hishen and Bug standbys.
A color sheet of printable top-down counters for Hishen, Grath, Symons, and Star Army troops. Two full Platoons!


Like all THW games Platoon Leader can be played solo or same-side, against the game mechanics or head-to-head against your friends.

name: Das kopflose Dinner: Im Irrenhaus
description:
There is a fire in a public psychiatric institution. Rescuers risk their lives. The patients are standing confused and freezing on the street. None of them realizes that they escaped death.

It is up to the players to find the murderer. Every player gets a role. One player is the murder and the others players have to find him/her. The players try to find hintzs by interviewing the other players to solve the case.

name: Railway Rivals Map AG: Argentina
description:
A new map that can be used with Railway Rivals or Dampfross. This map was especially designed for the first Railway Rivals championships in Birmingham, 1994. It was mainly sold at conventions.

It covers the country of Argentina, with one hex representing roughly 60 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map AL: South East Australia
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers Australia from Adelaide to the eastern coast and from Bourke to the southern coast, one hex representing approximately 33 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map BA: Bavaria
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the whole country of Bavaria, with approximately one hex representing 10 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map BN: Belgium & Netherlands
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the countries of Belgium and the Netherlands, with one hex representing approximately 10 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map BU: Bulgaria
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the country of Bulgaria, with one hex representing approximately 12 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map BW: Baden-Württemberg
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the German region of Baden-Württemberg, with one hex representing approximately 7 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map CN: California and Nevada
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the States of California and Nevada, with one hex representing approximately 28 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map CO: Chesapeake and Ohio
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers the area between the Rivers Ohio and Rappahannock with one hex representing approximately 13 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map CR: North and South Carolina
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers North and South Carolina, with one hex representing approximately 17 kilometers.
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Railway Rivals Map CS: Central Scotland
description:

name: Go bravely for the masquerade, Cinderella. Board game special edition
description: Players play the main role of Cinderella, came to this gorgeous masquerade, in order to win the eyes of the crowd and won the dance prince or princess's honor, and start a dance challenge with other opponents!

name: The Contender: Heavy Lies the Crown Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

15 cards using real quotes from politicians on both sides of the aisle during President Donald Trump's first 100 days in office. Featuring cards inspired by Trump, Former FBI Director James Comey, Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, Vladimir Putin, and Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson.

name: The Contender: Television & Movie President Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Quotes from famous television and movie presidents including Air Force One, West Wing, House of Cards, 24, Veep, Battlestar Galactica and Dr. Strangelove.

And one extra one from Dave, who wasn't a president but rather a willing patsy in a conspiracy to replace the president with a presidential impersonator.

11 Argument cards in total.

name: The Contender: Battle for Las Vegas Debate Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

From the dunes of the desert comes a showdown that will mercifully signal the final furlough of the 2016 election. This 12-card expansion will include quotes from Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton taken from their debate on October 19th in Las Vegas.

BONUS! Three cards added! Including two topic cards! Now 15 total including "I'll keep you in suspense", "Such a nasty woman" and "We have some bad hombres here."

name: The Contender: "Battle for St. Louis" Debate Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the televised argument so nice they did it twice! Actually, there will be three of them. But all of these cards will come from the rematch of the most watched debate of all time. Will Donald Trump sniff out a better performance? Can Hillary Clinton shimmy her way to victory?

Either way, all the memorable barbs, gaffes, and insults will be memorialized in this 12 card expansion! 11 argument cards and 1 topic card.

WARNING! Contains one extra EXPLICIT Card.

name: The Contender: "Battle for New York" Debate Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

All of the best lines from the September 26th Presidential Debate between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton. 12 cards including one topic card.

name: The Contender: "All I Do Is Win" Victory Speech Mini Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Jimmy Carter, Richard Nixon, George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, George H.W. Bush, Ronald Reagan and more!

Includes a quote from President Elect Donald Trump comparing his future Chief of Staff to a horse. Because... well... #2106 I guess.

name: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales
description:
Description from the publisher:

Jack Sparrow... um, Captain Jack Sparrow is back in business! Along with other pirates he hunts for the mythical Trident of Poseidon, which controls all the seas of the Earth. But to succeed, pirates have to join forces with sworn enemies. Will the legendary pirates manage with it?

Players are taking card from the characters deck and have to collect the group of different pirates together (duplicates are resetting). Then ships cards are taken. The next step is convince the opponent to attack the fleet. Loot is dispensing by the leader of the attack, so everyone should think wisely - agree or not to attack. The winner is the richest player.

name: Hind & Seek
description:
Hind & Seek is a ruleset all about asymmetrical warfare and is aimed at company to battalion sized games, in 6mm or 3mm scale. Larger scales can be used just as easily, from 10mm and 15mm, up to 1/72 scale.

These rules are based on the real-life accounts of actual combatants, largely from the books The Bear Went over the Mountain and The Other Side of the Mountain. Care has been taken to make the game feel like a Soviet-Afghan wargame; The Soviets may be able to take lots of tanks and helicopters, but when the enemy is ambushing from hidden positions on high ground, the tanks wont be able to target them and the helicopters wont even know where they are. Tanks will need to back off from areas of high ground in order to get a shot and helicopters will have to spot the hidden ambushers, or rely on information from the ground in order to work out where the Dushman (Enemy) are.

In the end this game is all about asymmetrical warfare and providing the feel and tactics of the period. The game naturally encourages real-life tactics and unit organizations (although example soviet organizations are also provided) and each faction has its own unique tactical choices and challenges to overcome.

Rules are provided for Infantry (both regular squads and specialist teams like spotters and heavy weapon teams), vehicles (from the humble transport truck to the various BTRs, BMPs, BMD and heavier armor of the soviets.) and helicopters. Vehicle and anti-vehicle rules have been streamlined to be as simple as possible and allow the focus to be on infantry. Rules for suppression, morale and infantry quality are all part of the package. Helicopters and vehicles can transport troops and helicopters can land and take off in-game, or be called in by spotters, provided there are enemy targets around...

Games take anywhere from an hour and a half to 2 hours for larger games and a variety of markers are provided with the rules for ease of play. A 6' X 4' or 4' X 4' table is recommended.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Cubist: Cards Expansion Pack
description: This is an 18 card pack that is a combination of the three existing mini expansions that were previously released for this game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Dragonstone
description:
Enter to the World of Epic Fantasy! A role playing board game in a fantastic world of heroic adventure and magic with dozens of miniatures! Led Heroes to the victory against evil Necromancer and his monsters minions. You have the change to save the Kingdom upgrading your weapons and magic skills. Players can choose a unique character between 8 hero Classes or the Powerful. Evil Necromancer controlling the monsters. Heroes must take the magical Artifact of Dragonstone back to the Tree of Life.

Players with their characters are moved into the board by throwing dice or using magic and facing monsters that either come out randomly in the game or the player who plays the evil necromancer is summon it as he gathers strength in each round that passes .

Players will have to deal with the monsters that give them treasures to upgrade their equipment with newer stronger items, until they are strong enough to confront the Necromancer.
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Castle-Mate
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Castle-Mate Game Cards are incorporated into the normal game of chess (World Chess Federation, FIDE, rules apply). White, without taking a card, makes the ﬁrst move. Black has the option to make a regular chess move, or take a card.

Take a card and let the fun begin.

With every turn, the players have an option to make a regulation chess move or take a card. If the King is in check, the player cannot take a card and must use the turn, to move the King to safety. A player can use any of the cards, he or she currently possesses, to aid in the King’s safety.

The Castle-Mate cards are designed to appeal to Chess Players of any age and skill. The level of sophistication is really determined by the skill of the players. However, Castle-Mate adds an unpredictable element to the game: “Luck of the Draw”.

Selection of a particular card, at any given moment, can dramatically alter the outcome of the game. As in the regular game, Check-mate wins. Resignations, Stalemates and Draws are applicable, as stated by World Chess Federation rules. You can also win by drawing speciﬁc cards at the right moment.

name: It's A Squirrel's Life
description:
Description from the publisher:

Inspired by his experience of once rescuing a tree squirrel, Randy Hecht, an aerospace engineer from Southern California invented this educational board game, and co-founded the company Moxy Roxy, Inc. to pay homage to his furry friend named “Roxy.” Roxy has built her nests around Randy’s backyard, given birth to several litters of babies, and pays him regular visits.

Take a live journey through the eyes of a tree squirrel. We have all seen these cute creatures in the wild and our backyards, yet few know much about them. Finally, for the first time a board game has been created to simulate the life of a typical tree squirrel from nest born, to adulthood, and ultimately parenthood.

Full of humanizing and amusing nuances, both children and adults will enjoy many hours of fun and entertainment. With cleverly designed game rules, it also helps kids develop important social, math and negotiation skills that will benefit both their personal and professional lives for years to come.

The general objective of the game is to gather a certain number of food pieces (i.e. acorns, strawberries and pumpkins), as well as obtain five tail rings signifying squirrel life milestone achievements. The first squirrel/player to accomplish this wins.
The minimum number of food pieces that needs to be acquired are:

10 acorns
10 strawberries
10 pumpkins


The milestone achievements that are represented by five tail rings are:

2 nests (2 green tail rings)
2 litters of babies (2 pink tail rings)
1 hospital trip (1 yellow tail ring)


Generally there is no special order of events except that your squirrel must have at least one nest before having babies. The yellow tail ring signifies that you made at least one hospital trip and proof that you received a rabies vaccination.

The food pieces for our Classic Version are made of cardboard, and for our Deluxe Version PVC injection molded.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gameception: We Have To Go Deeper!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Gameception: We Have To Go Deeper! is the first 15 card expansion to Gameception that delves further into the Games within Games. (Within Games!). With 5 extra Gameception cards to be shuffled in with the base game, and 10 cards to be dealt out at the start of the day and can be played all day alongside Gameception, the shenanigans never stop.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Fire of Eidolon: Name Your Heroes BGG Promo Pack
description:
This 13-card pack contains one copy of each of the twelve Heroes from the Fire of Eidolon board game, with a blank space for the name so you can write in your own!

Also includes 1 promo Difficulty Level "Glitch" and Achievement-Tracker Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Froggy Fractions
description:
Once upon a time
Get cracking with croaking frogs in FROGGY FRACTIONS card game. A lot is at stake in the frog world. The winner gets to choose the coziest corner of the pond.
Join hands with these smart frogs in this fractions-strategy game. Be aware that other frogs will not make it easy for you. So get croaking!

Math Skills
• Reducing fraction to simplest form
• Identification of fractions
• Fraction operations
• Equivalent fractions

Other skills
• Strategic thinking
• Spatial recall
• Group dynamics
• Cognitive and Developmental skills

Practice jump
12 times over class. Kids will practice more equivalent fractions in 1 game play then in the entire text book in 1 year.
At Logic Roots, we are passionate about Math and work with the vision of Reinventing how kids practice Math through gamification of its concepts. Our Board Games, Card Games and Apps are widely used by top schools and homeschooling parents to help their boys and girls fall in love with Math. These games are best used for Learning, Education and gifting purposes for children.

Target group
Grade 4 and above || 9 years and above

How to play
Up to 5 players can enjoy FROGGY FRACTIONS at the same time. Shuffle and give 4 cards to each player. Keep 1 card face up and start playing. Your objective is to make the equivalent-4 set of cards before anyone else does. The game has been designed to give you more fun and more fractions practice in 1 game than in the entire math text book in 1 full year!

Contents of the box
• 40 thick and glossy cards
• 1 instruction book
• 4 Write and Wipe logic slates
• 4 Sketch Pens
• 1 Game themed wall poster

name: Intro Package: Hanau
description:
Includes two counter sheets, one 17 x 22 inch map and a series rule book.

Introduction to OSG's Library of Napoleonic Battles Series, a subset of the components found in Napoleon at Leipzig pertaining specifically to the battle of Hanau.

name: Steepseers
description: Steepseers is a resource gathering tabletop game for 1 - 4 players where each player becomes one of the last Steepseers, an oracle able to read fortunes through brewing tea, and must work to deliver visions in order to help the public believe in them again. With the help of a specialty tea house and a friendly Steam Spirit, players will gather and steep the ingredients needed to trigger visions and earn Belief - just don't forget what's in your teapot! Steep your way to victory by collecting the most Belief before time runs out through utilizing powerful vision card abilities, rolling resource dice, and harnessing the powers of your Steam Spirit.

name: Schusski
description:
User summary

Object of the Game

To complete the course in the shortest time possible by taking from the move pack as few cards as possible. Any number of people may play but this is an against the clock race and each player races in turn with normally only one skier on the course at any one time.

Preparation

Set up the board, draw for order of play by cutting the shuffled pack of move cards and the highest card takes the first turn. The Slalom is a two-legged race where the fastest time on aggregate is the winner and the second leg is run in reverse order to the first.

Start of the Game

Shuffle the move and start cards and take the top start card and then 14 move cards. Any number from 0 to 9 of these 14 move cards may be discarded by playing them face downwards and incurring a small penalty of additions to the time of 0.01 secs for each card discarded. This decision to discard (or not)a number of move cards can only be made before the start and from the initial 14 cards dealt. The further move cards which will be required may be taken from the top of the pack at anytime but all cards taken add one second each to the time whether played or not.

The run commences by playing one of the move cards and so as the first bend is a left hand turn just 2 spaces from the start then a black 2 followed by any black card will make the first turn a perfect one.

The time display board should be maintained after each move allowing for standard course time (marked on the race board), start-move-error-skill cards and the last decimal place is determined by the value of the move card last played.

After reaching the final turn line a player may cross the finishing line by playing any red card of value 2 or greater or a red 1 move card followed by any card.

Finish

After crossing the finishing line a check should be made of all cards in play to confirm the display time.

name: Dust 1947: Horten Ho-367 – "Hexe"
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Luftwaffe has of course access to the latest generation of jet powered aircraft. Many are even fielded before the trials are over: if there's an operational need, then the plane goes on mission! The Hexe is such an aircraft, equipped with some of the latest systems available. Its nose radar makes the plane very accurate, especially coupled with the underbelly gliding bomb. It allows to attack large targets from a safe distance, a new nightmare for the enemies of the Axis.

This miniature comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: BOMB SQUAD
description:
Bomb Squad - ボムスクアッド is a co-operative card game for two players. Each player has a rack of five cards. The cards have information on both sides. The back side, which is only visible to the player, shows an X or O. The front side, which is visible only to the other player, shows a number between one and five in one of five colors. The goal of the game is to complete a grid of 25 cards - one of each number in each color - without using more than three cards that show an X on the back.

On your turn, your options are (1) spend a clue token to give your partner a hint; (2) play a card from your rack; or (3) discard a card from your partner's rack. Whenever you play a card or have one of your cards discarded by your partner, you must draw a new card to replace it.

Play continues until (1) the deck runs out (at which time each player gets one final turn); (2) someone tries to play an unplayable card (thereby losing the game); or (3) the players complete their grid of 25 cards.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Alien Architects
description:
Description from the publisher:

There are exceptional monuments, buildings, and statues on Earth that have left archaeologists wondering for millennia about their origins and construction. The Great Pyramids of Egypt, the Moai of Easter Island, Stonehenge of England, the Ball of Twine of Kansas; could early civilizations of humans have designed and built these with limited technology and knowledge? Or is it possible (even probable) that we, on this planet, have been receiving help from more advanced cultures from other worlds? In Alien Architects you take on the role of an extraterrestrial who has traveled across the galaxy to compete with other aliens to build monuments on earth throughout human history. Collect or steal resources, blueprints, and technology in order to prove that you are the greatest builder in the universe. And why not have some fun with the humans while you’re here?

name: Sarah's Singularity
description:
Future Sarah has fractured the timelines and it's up to you, an earlier-version Sarah, to solve missions and set things right. Bring dinosaurs to Ancient Egypt and ComiCon panelists to Feudal Japan while trying to rescue lost companions scattered in time. Put companions to work in their own times to complete missions. You've got seven time jumps to complete as many missions as possible, but watch out for paradoxes; if two or more Sarahs meet in the same time zone, everything about them will change in an instant and all your plans could go up in smoke.

In Sarah's Singularity, players select an assortment of time periods from prehistoric Pangea to ComicCon 2012 and establish a set of missions for each period. Stranded companions from far-ranging times are scattered among the chosen periods and each player gets a "Sarah Card" with special powers. Finally, players choose two secret objective cards for hidden endgame scoring and a Chronologist is selected from the gathered players.

Each round, Future Sarah visits a time period to strand another companion and the players simultaneously and secretly select a time period to jump to where they hope to solve a mission by matching icons on the mission card with icons on the stranded companion cards and the icons on their own hand of helpful companions. Typically, when the selected periods are revealed, they're resolved in chronological order. However, if two or more Sarahs (including the Future Sarah) land in the same time period, they paradox! Those player immediately turn in their Sarah Cards and get a new one at random, losing the special powers they may have planned to use to help solve the mission. The Chronologist then decides the order in which the paradoxing players gets to take their turns. The paradoxing player who goes last gets to be the new Chronologist.

Players claim solved missions as victory points. They also gain bonus points and a wild icon token for rescuing a stranded companion and hidden endgame points through their secret objective cards. After seven rounds, the points are tallied and a winner is announced.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Travel
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Guildbreakers: Battle for Agawan
description:
Description from the designer:

Guildbreakers: Battle for Agawan is a two-player tower defense card game. It plays like a miniatures game, but it needs only a minimum of table space and can fit perfectly in your pocket. You assume the role of a Guild Master, scrambling to stake your claim on the valuable ore deposits of Agawan Island. You must build up your base, recruit your troops, and smash down your opponent's base before he does the same to you. This fast-paced strategy game distills concepts from miniatures games, collectible card games, and real-time strategy games into a quick and portable card game.

Battle for Agawan's streamlined game system is a card game that has no shuffling and a tactical combat game that has no board, no rulers, and no dice rolling. Instead, players can freely select cards from their own customized army pool of twenty Base and Character cards. Base cards build up your rate of production while Character cards are used for engaging in combat. Special Character abilities and stats, combined with a deterministic support-based combat system, encourage mixed forces and dynamic counterplay. Battle for Agawan uses neither grid-based maps nor measurement-based movement, instead abstracting the field of battle into four simple rows. This minimalism allows for extremely quick setup and portability while preserving the core tactical elements of movement, range, and positioning.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Combat Leader: Poland 1939
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Combat Leader: Poland 1939 is the newest release in the Combat Leader game series, covering the Polish campaign on September, 1939, with German and Polish troops.

The game comes with two maps (#9 and #10, rural and suburban terrain), two counter sheets (J & K, which must be cut apart), two identical Reference Cards, and a 24-page rules booklet. The rules contain all the standard, advanced, and optional rules for the system, along with five scenarios. This game sees the entry of the Poles into the system, and special rules cover the use of the 18-man Polish squad, with their characteristic weaponry (Kb wz.98a rifles, Browning wz. 1928 BAR LMG, etc.) and organization. The German SS also are introduced into the system (a full SS squad is included), with special rules governing their use on the battlefield. Overall, three German squads, two Polish squads--plus plenty of extra men to create different formations--are included.

The core rules have been expanded to include several options originally appearing in the Combat Leader: Expansion Module. These rules are now considered standard, and there is no need to buy that module.

Combat Leader: Poland is a complete, stand alone game. The core rules of the game system remain the same, plus additional optional rules have been included. So, Combat Leader: Poland 1939 provides you with not only a new nationality and the SS, but the most up-to-date edition of the series. It is compatible with all other Combat Leader games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Agents: Mission Critical Expansion Set (Second Edition)
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Agents: Mission Critical, the first expansion for The Agents, consists of forty cards, with two versions of twenty new unique mission cards that can be added to the base set. To play, simply shuffle these new missions into the existing missions, then get started.

Not compatible with previous editions' expansions due to different card size and rules changes.

name: LOKA: A Game of Elemental Strategy – Yuddah
description:
Yuddah is an expansion for the game Loka, available as an online
pdf.

Yuddah includes two main sections – the first one shares with you the creative process used to design the armies for Loka. The second much longer section is a collection of additional experimental rules. They are:

1) New terrain tiles
2) Elemental Power cards
3) Epic Games of Face-off Loka
4) Battle for Loka campaign
5) Heroes of Loka

Each of these rules expands the game of Loka and can be enjoyed separately or added to the core game as you prefer.

name: Wargame The Wars of the Roses 1455 to 1487
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the Wars of the Roses in the Fifteenth Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.

name: Wargame 1066. Saxons, Vikings, Normans
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the Norman Invasion of Britain in the Eleventh Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Throwback Minis Pack
description: Nearly all of the Kickstarter exclusives minis from the first Ghostbusters: The Board Game
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Combat Patrol: World War II
description:
Description from the publisher:

Combat Patrol: World War II is a set of rules for WWII miniatures skirmish game involving two or more players. Combat Patrol is an exciting set of rules that allows players to focus on the game instead of the rules.

Combat Patrol is a unique card-based miniatures game. The unique Double Random Activation mechanism provides a streamlined method for activating units that provides the friction and drama of card-based systems with none of the drawbacks.

More importantly, Combat Patrol uses a card-based combat resolution mechanism that is exciting and simple while eliminating unsightly chart cards cluttering your beautiful gaming table.

In developing Combat Patrol(TM) I developed the G.A.M.E.R.(TM) “engine.” Key features of the engine are:

•The Double Random Activation(TM) mechanism provides the unpredictability and drama of card-based activation without the drawbacks. This activation mechanism was originally developed for Battles by GASLIGHT and was refined during the development of Look, Sarge, No Charts titles. The mechanism uses cards for activation but ensures that multiple players are acting at the same time.
•No big yellow or pink chart cards cluttering up your beautiful gaming tables. Each player needs one or two 3″x5″ cards with the information about his units, including their weapons and equipment. Other than those, there are no chart cards. The back of these unit records includes the modifiers for hand-to-hand combat and terrain effects on movement. After a game or two, players rarely need to refer to these, so two unit records can be taped back to back for even less clutter.
•Combat resolution is resolved by flipping cards. Players read different sections of the cards in the Action Deck depending on what they are trying to do: shooting, resolving hits, “rolling” to penetrate enemy vehicles, hand-to-hand combat, movement, and morale. In development, I took a series of charts and then broke them apart to fit on an Action Deck of 50 cards. Flipping a card is essentially the same as rolling a die and looking up the result on a table. The difference is that you don’t have to do all that table look up. Flip a card and determine whether you got a hit. If so, flip the next card to see which target figure was hit, how severely, and whether he is protected by cover.
•Cover is represented explicitly. Instead of cover providing a negative modifier to hit, if you get a hit, when you flip the next card in the Action Deck, you look for cover icons. If the target figure is in the type of cover indicated on the card, instead of being wounded or incapacitate he ducks back behind cover and is stunned. While the use of cover as a to-hit modifier and the process in Combat Patrol(TM) can be mathematically equivalent, there is something intuitively appealing to knowing that the window sill deflected that round that would have otherwise hit your figure. In play tests, this explicit representation of cover has made players make better use of cover while maneuvering their squads.
•Messy “opportunity fire” rules are replaced by a simple reaction mechanism.
•Somewhat randomized movement speeds based on the Guts level of the unit or its leader.
•The G.A.M.E.R.(TM) engine name is an acronym for the attributes which describe figures in Combat Patrol(TM): Guts (morale), Accuracy (shooting), Melee (hand-to-hand combat), Endurance (how many wounds a figure can take), and Reaction. The game master can “sculpt” a unit to fit a historical scenario.
•Playable on multiple levels of resolution. At the lowest level, all the figures in a unit have the same attributes. At the highest level, each figure can have different attributes. The levels of resolution can be mixed so that the Commando unit has more detail than the installation security personnel. This allows games that have a historical feel as well as those with a more cinematic feel.
•Rules for replacements of personnel and equipment between scenarios enable players to represent mini-campaigns.
•Ground scale is 1 inch = 5 yards. This is a good compromise ground scale between extreme range being 12 inches and the games resembling Agincourt and ranges that are in scale with the figures where short range covers the entire table.
•The basic rules are just eight pages -- and that includes several pictorial examples of firing and grenade resolution that fill almost a full page themselves!

Activation:
Combat Patrol(TM): WWII uses the Double Random(TM) Activation mechanism. In Combat Patrol(TM), forces are divided into teams, which are typically half a squad. At the beginning of each turn, players roll a six-sided die for each team. This is referred to as the unit's command die. Then cards are drawn from an Activation Deck. The Activation Deck has cards numbers 1 to 6 in red, 1 to 6 in black, and a reshuffle card. The cards are drawn from the Activation Deck. When a card is drawn, all teams whose command die matches the drawn card activate. In this way, many teams are activating at the same time, speeding up game play. When all teams have gone, the next card is drawn. When the reshuffle card is drawn, the turn ends. The command dice are rerolled, and the Activation Deck is reshuffled.

Combat Resolution:
Combat resolution uses decks of cards, called Action Decks. See the video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n0hinO2KaMY
There are additional instructional videos, information, and free downloads here: http://www.bucksurdu.com/Buck_Surdu/Combat_Patrol.html

name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad
description:
Description from the publisher:

Death from the skies over Babylon! The Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad deals with any light or heavy enemy infantry the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Fliegerfaust (Rocket Launchers), they are not helpless against aircraft and can blow one to pieces in seconds. Their Maschinengewehr 48 (Machinegun) is efficient against these as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: PT-47A "Plavayushchiy" Tank-47
description:
Description from the publisher:

Developed initially for special operations use, this command amphibious ready vehicle is slowly becoming a staple of SSU forces around the planet. At the moment it can be mostly found with Spetsnaz and PLA forces, which make the most of its capabilities: the PT-47A can go nearly everywhere with a small group of soldiers. This version is equipped with enhance communications capabilities perfectly suited for a command vehicle.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: MI 48-H "Invader"
description: The Spetsnaz fulfill the most dangerous missions in the name of the Sino-Soviet Union. And as such deserve the best equipment available! The Invader is the latest development of a long line of very efficient helicopter family that has been of great service to the Motherland. The SSU uses by far the largest number of helicopter, to transport troops, destroy vehicles and even other aircraft. The Invader combines the best of two functions: it transports a small group of Spetsnaz into battle and then stays on target to provide fire support.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Maggie Booster
description: Booster for the Walking Dead: All Out War core set. Includes three miniatures - Maggie, Arnold, and another Walker to add to the herd. Included are character cards and extra equipment cards.

name: Freejumper
description:
This fun and social game accommodates any number of players, mixing elements of role-playing, sci-fi, and tabletop strategy. Each player designs a “freejumper” – a small, privately-owned multi-purpose, self-aware spaceship.

The players then have “adventures” as they search for valuable cargoes to beg borrow or steal, alien artifacts, wrecks to salvage, or get hired as mercenaries in a variety of roles. Like a role-playing character, your ship can “learn” and grow if your adventures are successful. You can purchase new software and systems for it, upgrade weapons and defenses, and perhaps eventually sell it and buy a larger and better ship altogether.

Along the way you will fight a variety of battles. Sometimes all of the players cooperate against a single threat. Sometimes the players divide into teams trying to complete tasks. And sometimes there is a free-for-all, as every freejumper is trying to get home with the most loot and goodies.

Each ship is controlled with a single small “interface” no bigger than a poker card, and a hand of “system cards” that represent the ship’s various capabilities. Gameplay consists of playing cards to do various sorts of moves, attacks, and defenses, all the while trying to load up as much cargo as you can and get away without too much damage. A typical game lasts about one hour.

name: España 20: Variante en Solitario
description:
This expansion pack add two new game modes to this game system.

Solo rules let a solitaire player play against a non player side, managed by the game system.

For those wargamers that prefer simple rules and switching sides, we have include some easy to learn rules to manage morale spent (forzed march, commit reserves, declare a lung,…), advance after combat, or actions to be performed during reaction phase.

In addition to above, for those wargamers that like complete set of rules that manages all AI side avoiding that player takes decision about actions to be performed, we have included a set of priority and target selection. These rules are used together a few flow charts in such way that the game system shall guide the enemy units to their best targets in order to defeat your army. Obviously, these rules are a bit complicated and hard to learn, and increase the game difficulty.

Furthermore, 3 AI experience levels has been included in order to make the solo game challenging to both novice and veteran players.

This solo rules shall be completed with a few particular rules for each battle. The particular rules shall include, initial targets definition if they are required, use of particular event cards, or any useful rules relationship with the exclusive rules of each battle. We are developing this rules for the 4 battles included at España 20.

This solo system has been supplemented with a set of quick battle rules, and four player rules. The main function of this system is offer to players the chance to play alternative battles without the historic background by means the use of recruiting points system that increase the playability of each battle. A simplified set of Army recruiting rules, let each player shall recruit their own units, purchase cards. Furthermore, exclusive rules are replaced by a short table with a set up, and objetive definition rules for each map in the game.

Expansion pack components:
• 36 solo action cards.
• 1 countersheet with more than 50 markers.
• 1 Player helpsheet.
• 1 Rulebook.

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Goblinade
description: This additional drink card came as a Kickstarter reward for The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Lindisfarne 651
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the year 635 Scottish monks founded an abbey on an island before the north coast of England, and gave it the same name as the island: Lindisfarne.

Under the leadership of Aidan, the monastery flourished and became a center of Christian art and culture. In 651 Aidan died - and the struggle for his succession begins.

In the game Lindisfarne 2 - 4 players try to become the new abbot of the monastery Lindisfarne. To this end, they have to win not only the support of their fellow-monks, but must also gain the favor of the king in order to expel the fellow-competitors.
At the same time, the players plan their actions and the order in which they are executed. Pray, read the mass for a nobleman, support the expansion of the monastery, or let another monk work for you - with each of the actions the players get closer to their goal. It may also be helpful to slander the other players or hinder them in other ways.

In principle, each player has the same actions - but the acquisition and playing of cards results in additional possibilities.
Lindisfarne is a game that combines a high degree of interaction and tactical consideration, and is therefore aimed at players, who play regularly.

name: AOX
description:
Description from the publisher:

AOX is a traditional-style abstract strategy game for 2 players.

In AOX, players take turns moving tiles in an attempt to defeat their opponent in one of two ways:

1. Capture 3 of the opponents tiles
OR,
2. Move a triangle tile into a highlighted space on the opponents board edge

However, neither of these conditions are easy to achieve, as each turn a player may only move specific tiles as designated by the tokens drawn from their bag. In addition to this, the active player each turn will have the option to strategically 'swap' a token with the opposing player, changing the number of each type of token in both players bags, thus shifting the odds of being able to move certain tiles. AOX is a game of strategy, patience and balance.

Made entirely from laser-cut wood, AOX has a traditional and classy appearance. The gameplay and concept of AOX is very simple, though the level of strategic depth is great.

name: Bushido: The Nian
description:
Description from the publisher:

The legends speak of ferocious beasts
terrorizing small hamlets in the dark of night, these stories are now told with added gravitas in the remote and isolated villages of Jwar. The return of the Nian is bad enough but the affinity between them and the Oni stalking the land will inevitably be a severe blow to humanity in the dark days ahead.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Police Precinct: Michelle Schroeder Character Board
description:
Was available through Police Precinct - Online! kickstarter campaign as well as being available at Dice Tower Con 2016

Text:
Unorthodox: At any time before taking your action, you may discard any one of your police cards to temporarily increase your strength in any area by 1 (e.g. investigation goes from 2 up to 3)
Underdog: As a community service officer, you get more donuts for arresting than others (one donut for 1 or 2 punk tokens and two donuts for 3 or more punks)
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kaihei Alpha
description:
Description from the publisher:

Eight foot of lean muscle, a cunning, ruthless hunter. The Kaihei Alpha are the large and most ferocious of the Kaihei an already deadly beast. Like all packs it only functions with strong leadership and Alphas have this in spades, another creature born out of the unforgiving wilderness the Oni call home where only the strongest survive. In battle, under the Kaihei Alphas glare the pack moves as one, quickly and decidedly devouring their helpless prey alive, snapping and ripping in a bloody fury of tooth and claw. Of the many fighting beasts of the Oni the Kaihei rightly hold a place of feared in the minds of men.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kaihei Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

These muscled hunters are pack animals and whilst fearsome in isolation they are truly terrifying when running in a group. Lean and agile they bound across the battlefield, throwing themselves with great momentum at their quarry, barrelling them to the ground whilst another in the pack snaps and tears at the exposed vital areas of the prey. Teeth and claws as hard as steel they can tear through even the toughest of Minimoto iron with a concentration bite.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Rinsho
description:
Description from the publisher:

Rinsho are prized within Bakemono society for their enormous strength matched only by their stupidity, making them perfect shock troops. These gangly Bakemono are blessed with vastly accelerated regenerative powers, able to regrow limbs and heal what would be mortal wounds as if minor graze. Their durability offers some staying power to the Bakemono battle lines, anchoring key points on the battle field, weathering the brunt of the enemy offense and enabling a swarming counter punch. Bringing down these giant Bakemono is no mean feat as injury only sends them spiralling into a furious whirlwind and violence.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Akimoto
description: How the transformation will take hold no one can be sure, Akimoto is taking on the very image of Orochi. In the heat of the battle his allies claim he transforms further, this claim is supported by the opponents that flee in terror in the face of his onslaught.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Chiyo
description: Chiyo has distinguished herself further from her fellow Temple Bushi, she quickly mastered the art of the Asp Strike and her spirit and determination to return to the fray when knocked down has been noted by her superiors.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Temple Bushi
description:
The Temple Bushi are chosen from the ranks of the Ito’s ashigaru for skill and prowess shown on the battlefield. Only the best are selected to guard the temple of Orochi and it is considered a great honour to be chosen.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 9Apr40:  Norge angrepet!
description:
Basically regiment to brigade level fast, simple game of the April-June 1940 campaign in Norway. 7 10-day turns. Area movement. Has Norway Unprepared and Nazi Treachery/Surprise rules, as well as variants cancelling one or both of those, to show the difference (unhistorical) preparedness and alertness could have made. (My 7 yr old Norwegian-American daughter took a look at all the historically initially upside-down/Disrupted/un-mobilized Norwegian units and opined that they were "sleeping.")

Basic game - naval warships/units abstracted - is chess-like. The Advanced game - including naval units, although non-Norwegian naval forces are still somewhat abstracted - is still relatively simple, but takes about twice as long.

I am very proud of my pixel-by-pixel ship, aircraft, and tank unit icons, especially the little Norwegian Army Air Service Gloster Gladiator with insignia.

The game was designed with the research assistance of a librarian in the excellent Defence Museum in Akershus Festing/Fortress, Norway's Pentagon.

Lots of possible event outcomes make the game enjoyable for solitaire play as well.

Very simple combat mechanics, including an innovative ground combat system.

Has map also divided into 3 sections to enable magnum-sized copy of game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Bushido: Sanjakubo
description:
If the Koroko are the soul and heart of the Tengu then the Karasu are the mind. In the Chamber of the Sun the Karasu study the texts written in an age immemorial, learning the secrets of the Kami and how to command them. This has led to a tense relationship with the Koroko who see the use of this knowledge as dangerous. Sanjakubo is an adept Shugenja able to invoke and harness Raijin’s fury against the enemy, or through the use of ancient lore curse them.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hokibo, Kurama Samurai
description:
Where the Suzume are the most common, the Kurama are a rarity at the hatching. They are the largest, proudest and strongest warriors amongst the Tengu. Hokibo being a prime example of the Tengu warrior caste. There are few who can be called his equal with a blade, but as the Tengu are taught one’s mind must be as keen as the blade they wield. Hokibo’s knowledge of tactics lets him know what the enemy are planning sometimes before they do. His fluid strikes slice steel like rice paper, in combat a single flex of powerful wings can launch him to his feet or force smaller foe away.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Scout of the Blue Gale
description:
Of the Suzume warriors the fast and most athletic are chosen for the Blue Gale, an elite scouting force. Skilled in watching without being seen, striking and fading away, with blade or bow they are effective fighters adding even greater tactical options to the already mobile Tengu Warbands.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Hakzabo
description:
The outcast, an iconoclast once shunned by the Tengu, his wings clipped by the elders for crimes unclear. The Kuren Tengu are one of the rarest and the black Kuren even rarer. However the Black Kuren is a portent to a great disaster. Cast out and thought dead, but Hakzabo survived, raised by a hermit hunter. He has become an agile and skilled hunter warrior, deftly dodging and leaping across the battlefield.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Loot Trap
description:
A 2-4 player pirate themed card game that kinda sorta plays like a board game.

Lay traps or play instant cards during your turn in an attempt to lower your opponents health to zero, or end a turn with five pieces of Loot banked in front of you to win!

name: Ex Libris: Addendum
description:
Now expanded to include Non-Fiction as well as works of fiction from 48 authors new to the original Ex Libris collection. Addendum adds an extra dimension and years of play to this perennially popular game.

—description from the box
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: ARGH: Goodies
description: ARGH: Goodies is a set of three promotional cards for ARGH that can be shuffled into the main deck. The spider nets you 1 point for each card with a star, the twin brother costs you 1 or 3 points depending on whether he's alone or with his twin sister, and the reporter owl lets you look at one of the cards removed at the start of the game.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dadaocheng: The Stretch Goals
description: This adds wooden warehouse tokens, a start player metal junk token, and several new cards.

name: Bushido: Arata
description:
The fury of the Chrome Sea, the shark is the apex predator beneath the waves and Arata is just as frightening above water. Dazzlingly fast, driven wild by the smell of blood, he is a pure monster when unleashed. Whether savaging startled enemies with a maw of razor sharp teeth, or bowling then over with tremendous force he is a formidable warrior. Like all those changed by the great Kami Sumiyoshi Sanjin, little is left of the man he once was but this does not matter in times of war.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Gunsmoke Card Game
description:
The object of Gunsmoke Card Game is to build a gang of Gunfighters and then shoot it out to the death. Players control a gang made up of Gunfighters Cards, they move around town earning dollars and buying weapons and items for their Gunfighters to improve their abilities in the hope they can defeat the other Gunfighters in Brawls or Shoot-Outs. When a player loses their last Gunfighter they have been defeated and are out of the game, the last player left is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Squeeze
description:
All beginnings are difficult. Imagine you assemble a poor wooden self-made lemonade stand and work yourself up to a global juice producer. That's exactly what you do in Squeeze. In this two player card game you can either win if you max out one business niche (stuff, production, marketing) or if you prevent your opponent from doing this.
With Squeeze you get:
-Fast and arousing two player card game.
-Simple rules but you need a sharp eye to master it.
-A perfect lunch-break game, invites to an immediate revanche.
-Family friendly and easy to carry (small cardbox)

After every quarter of the year (quick card duels) you have the opportunity to get business cards from the market with which you upgrade your business. How many depends on how much more lemonade you sold this quarter than your opponent. A business unit which has the most upgrades in the game - and that's what makes the game interesting - gives you a certain advantage.

But pay attention, not every business card can immediately upgrade your company. If you still sell your lemonade for 50 cents in the neighborhood you probably will not need the lemon squeezer ultra 9000 yet. If there is nothing in your interest you can let yourself cash out and use the money on later markets. It is quite important to keep a close eye on what your opponent is doing because before you know it he "strikes" all your niches and wins the game. If the legal way doesn't work you can also get the black "illegal cards" from the market to gain mad advantages.

Squeeze is the kind of game you want to play in every lunch break. It takes around 10 minutes and invites to an immediate revanche. It is perfectly made for two players.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Yuji
description:
All captains must have a trusted Juhin and there is none more trusted, in any port in the Gulf of the Three Brothers, than Yuji. A seasoned sailor and servant of the Jung, for many cycles he has barked the orders of his captains, the Kaizoku darting to complete his commands, an inspiration to them. Never far is his oldest friend Same, no one is able to catch Yuji napping with the old monkey around.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Planet of the Apes: The Miniatures Boardgame
description:
In Planet of the Apes: The Miniatures Boardgame, an action-packed game of combat and strategy for 1-4 players, players command teams of apes or humans moving across innovative, three-dimensional game boards as they battle for the future of the planet. The game includes dozens of finely detailed plastic board game miniatures, multiple game boards, and numerous high quality components.

—description from the publisher

Cooperative action-adventure boardgame for 1- 4 players. Take the lead of the apes army and fight the soldiers in the Muir Wood Forest in this cooperative action-adventure boardgame.

The game will be a cooperative experience where you play as the Apes from the popular movie franchise, trying to fight against the human forces that seek to hunt you down. As well as a proper miniature-based skirmish clash on the tabletop between the two forces, where everyone has no real idea of what the capabilities of your foes are, you can also develop things with another side of the game that has you creating your village too.

—description from the Kickstarter page
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Home of the Brave
description:
Home of the Brave is a sociopolitical board game emphasizing the complexity of the world of modern U.S. politics. It's a 2-5 players tabletop game in which players will compete for influence, advance their professional position and gain powerful supporters. Driven by a story presented in a 18-page novella, the game creates a rich landscape where politics, media, social activism, business and criminal world mix. Home of the Brave is full of negotiation, blackmail, alliances and scandals.

The game takes place in rounds. Each round (except the first) starts with revealing a voting card (events) and voting for one of its two possible results. Then the players take turns doing actions (play a card, earn profit from previously played cards, advance on the path of bravery, etc.). When everyone has finished doing actions and has passed, the round ends - players draw new cards and reveal a new voting card. The primary player action is to play a card. Each character has their own deck of cards representing their typical behavior, acquaintances, and strengths. Each card has a cost (in resources) to play it, which is printed on the card. Skillful resource management and optimal card play is the key to victory in Home of the Brave.

A basic type of resource in the game is supporter cubes. They symbolize allies, voters, subordinates, or favors owed to a character. There are four types: Republicans, Democrats, Activists and Criminals.

Additional resource types are dollars and bravery points.

Players keep their own resources hidden behind screens so that opponents cannot see them. A player pays the cost of playing a card by paying the required resources from behind their screen to the bank. A player cannot play a given card if they do not have all the required resources.

The aim of the game is to gain 4 (or more) stars before one’s opponents. 2 stars can be gained by career advancement along the path of bravery, but each character also has many other ways to earn stars, mostly through their personal goal cards. Players will often have to prioritize between their career and private life.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Shadows over Normandie: New Characters
description:
Exclusive punchboard from the Kickstarter #3 Strategic Resupply

Came with the SoN storage solution.

Three new characters for SoN + tokens ( 16 )

Oliver Derwetho - special investigator

Jenarth' - Dagon's favorite

Dark Fire - Black Sun experimental fire soldier

Those 3 new characters were
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Ofmos Classic
description: Ofmos is a family of business games.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Saucer Escape: A Spacemen and Scribbles Adventure
description:
Saucer Escape depicts four of humanity's best space soldiers abducted by an alien Mothership after an assassination attempt. Their mission: Destroy the enemy forces, fuel up their escape pod, kill the alien's leader, the Hivemind, and survive! This game is an homage to Grey Gnome Games' Doom Realm games and Mark Jindra's Pencils and Powers game.

In Saucer Escape, a very brisk yet challenging one player game, featuring variable setup and unique, variable character powers,
the player will spend each turn rolling four dice and allocating them toward four different goals - reconnaissance, enemy strength, items, and locations' artifacts:


Reconnaissance dice will allow you to move around the interior of the ship, finding special encounters and the entrances to the enemies' locations.
Enemy Strength dice will increase the strength of one enemy; players must balance the enemy's strength against their own as their increasing strength makes them harder but also affects your final score directly.
Location dice simply make each enemy's location more valueable. They don't directly affect your score, but rather how many Alien Artifacts you find in a location after slaying the enemy who inhabits it.
Reward dice extend the value of an enemy's loot when killed; there are many unique items in the game which can aid you in both scoring and simply surviving. From shields to medkits to laser pistols...your ability to manage these tracks are key to your success.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Ten Thunders Brothers
description:
Not everything can be achieved by stealth and guile. When the Ten Thunders need to make a statement with blood, or defend their territory from attack, they send out the Brothers. Anonymous behind leering demonic masks, these hardened warriors are experts with the ten sacred weapons of Wxu-Shu. Only on the orders of the clan are these weapons used, as to do otherwise is punishable by death.

The Brothers are recruited from the lower ranks of the Three Kingdoms, those who will serve loyally to lift themselves from the constant toil of their daily lives. They are trained rigorously, rewarded with wealth and prestige, and seen as tools of the clan.

Their oni masks no only make them even more fearsome in battle, but also prevent Brothers from being identified on the street. As a method of passive control, it is highly effective. Throughout the Three Kingdoms, and these days in Malifaux's Little Kingdom as well, no one speaks ill of the clan in case a Brother is nearby.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing three 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

3 Ten Thunders Brothers

Stat Cards

3 Ten Thunders Brothers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Malifaux: Shadow Effigy
description:
On several recent missions, agents of the Ten Thunders have discovered they are not alone in the shadows. Sneaking alongside them uninvited is a bundle of dark fabrics, wearing a familiar mask. While the clan is reluctant to trust anything they clearly do not control, they tolerate Shadow as it has proved useful on more than one occasion.

Shadow itself takes great delight in hiding and infiltrating, mimicking its favorite company, the Torakage. Despite its odd appearance and strange mannerisms, Shadow takes its adopted duty very seriously. More than once a clan member has been accosted by the little poppet, who with a deliberate tilt of its mask reminds them that their mission is not yet complete.

Shadow is the embodiment of the clan's ideals; silent, honorable, and deadly when necessary. Wielding a small but razor sharp blade with surprising accuracy, and with the shadows concealing clan members on its silent command, Shadow protects and aids the clan as it sees fit. Afterwards it vanishes; only reappearing after it has joined another mission.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing one 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

Shadow Effigy

Stat Cards

Shadow Effigy
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The First Blitzkrieg: The Raid on Zhitomir – 25-26 April, 1920
description: Another game in the system Great Battles of Small Units. Free, for your own printing. This time we will move to April 25 and 26, 1920. The Polish-Bolshevik war is underway from february, 1919. The beginning of the Kiev expedition. Motorized group of Colonel Stefan Dąb-Biernacki attacked Bolsheviks 58th Rifle Division in the Zhitomir. Nothing in this extraordinary, but to reach the city Biernacki legionaries have to overcome from their own line about 80 km. Surprise is a priority here. On foot it is not advisable, so the decisive moment of motorization and armor (2, and perhaps 3 armored cars) of the Biernacki group is decisive. Surprise is complete. A Polish grouping on the deep rear of the enemy causes the units to be confiscated on the first line. During this time, Heinz Guderian is the ordinary captain of the Reichswehr...

name: War Among Gods
description:
The war between 5 ancient civilizations has begun, as the ruler of theses mighty people, will you lead them to victory, or fade in the history?

War Between Gods is a strategy game that's designed to allow both hardcore war game players and those who are about to become one. It contains all the key factors we love, but much straight forward and light.

In the game, each player play as the leader of the 5 ancient civilizations, they are Greek, Eygpt, Maya, Norse and China.

As the leader, you must withstand the threat of another 3 civilization and honor your Gods, which may help you with their power if you've served them well.


Draw a card that may influence your decision.
Harvest golds and souls.
Recruit warriors.
Build the city.
March to battle.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: City Park
description:
A calming walk through the park is nice… but what if you could design the park?

City Park is a unique card-laying game designed for up to six players. You can even play it as a solo challenge!

To win, a player must score the most points before the end of the game. Points are scored by connecting the paths on the playing cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, City Building

name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 8
description:
Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 8 includes seven all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder role-playing universe: the iconic shifter, Aric, The Red Raven, Meligaster, and Rivani!

Characters featured in this set list include:


Zova, the iconic shifter
Aric, human vigilante
The Red Raven, human vigilante
Meligaster, halfling mesmerist
Rivani, human psychic
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Memo tropico
description:
For this memory game you need a brain the size of an elephant’s to keep up with the animals who often move between hiding places... Be careful not to lose track of them...

Dans ce jeu de mémo, il faut une mémoire d’éléphant pour se souvenir de l’emplacement des animaux qui changent souvent de cachette… Attention à ne pas perdre le fil…

—description from the publisher

name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – Egg promo card
description:
The Egg promo card is a single card addition for Serengeti: A Race for Life that was first given away free to visitors at Spiel '17 in Essen, on purchase on the game.

Its availability was thereafter limited to the first year after the release of the game, including at trade shows attended by the publisher, direct sales from their website, and the Kickstarter campaign for the 'Revised Edition' of the game launched in June 2018.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Schwitzkasten"
description:
Promocard #17 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" Box.

It reads:

Benenne einen Gegner. Für jede Ausdauerkarte, die er ausspielt, verliert er einen Lebenspunkt. Statt eines Nahkampf-Angriffs darf der Gegner in seinem Zug eine Nahkampf-Probe ablegen, um diese Karte abzulegen.
Im Abenteuer: Benenne einen Schergen, Für jede 11-20 die er bei einer Aktion würfelt, verliert er einen Lebenspunkt.

Roughly translated:
Name an opponent. For each endurance-card the oppontent plays, he looses a lifepoint. Instead of making a melee-attack, the opponent may choose to make a melee-test to discard this card.
Adventure: Name an enemy. For each 11-20 rolling on an action, he looses one lifepoint.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Schlagring"
description:
Promocard #22 for Aventuria card game. It was available in the "Drachling" box.

It reads:
1, erschöpfen: Nahkampfangriff 1W6+1
Musst du eine Handkarte abwerfen, darfst du statt dessen diese Karte aus dem Spiel ablegen.

Roughly translated:
1, exhaust: Melee-attack 1D6+1
If you must discard a card from your hand, you may discard this card from play instead.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Broken Axles
description:
Broken Axles is a 15mm vehicle combat game set in a retro sci-fi, post apocalyptic world. Warbands of raiders roam the Endless Desert, vying with each other for dominance over vital supplies of Crude Oil and refined Cruel with which to sustain their ever-thirsty warmachines. Such prizes are no easy prey, however, as often times these resources are carried in the armoured bellies of massive Battle Rigs, bristling with weaponry and surrounded by escort vehicles.

The rules are fast and bloody, where every dice roll can range from triumphant execution to disastrous mishap, conveying the nature of the ramshackle vehicles each player utilizes. Crush your opponents with bouts of metal-crunching road rage, explosive Boomsticks and potent mounted weapons, or die trying.

—description from the publisher

name: Aventuria: Promokarte "Drachenjunges"
description:
This promo card was available in the "Bärenherz"-Set. It's promo #27 and reads:

Wirf zu Beginn deines Zuges 1W6. Bei 4-6 schlüpft das Junge aus und erhält folgenden Effekt:
1, erschöpfen: Ein Gegner deiner Wahl verliert 2 Lebenspunkte.

Roughly translated:
At the beginning of your turn roll 1D6. On a 4-6 the dragonbaby hatches. You can use now this ability:
Pay 1, exhaust: An opponent of your choice looses 2 Lifepoints.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: AVA Starship
description:
Earth slowly fades away under the weight of a global War. The League of Nations has come together to build humanity's last sprint for survival: a Starship, with everything that mankind needs to colonize our cosmic neighbor: Mars.

The final stretch of preparations is underway and the launch is imminent. Four nations join forces on board: USA, United Kingdom, Soviet Union and the Third Reich.

Despite initial agreements, conflicts ensue soon after boarding. Lead your nation, form and break alliances, fight and take control of the starship.

In AVA Starship players command their units in the fight over starship areas. They build decks of orders to gain tactical advantage and roll custom dice to resolve fights.

—description from the publisher

name: Supremacia
description:
The conquest of B-Xion takes place during several game turns and its duration may vary between games.
In turn, each player rolls the dice, activates events and uses the points obtained to carry out corporate actions, and may also spend credits to use corporate activities and sector activities. Once the player finishes performing all his actions he passes the corporate actions card to the player on his left who will play his turn.
During the game each corporation (player), sends new spaceships to the galaxy, mobilizes its fleets, fights with rival spaceships, infiltrates agents in planets, mobilizes its agents to gain influence or control of the sector and can also explore new sectors to expand the Galaxy.
Players will explore and consolidate sectors during the course of the game and at the moment that any player manages to consolidate its fifth sector the game ends immediately, then check the victory points obtained by the consolidated sectors.
The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will be the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Events, Hand Management, Modular Board, Race, Sudden Death Ending

name: HUSKY 8
description:
