Lest the innings start to blur together, a team's lineup is far from static. Each player demotes a batter to the minor leagues at the end of every inning, selecting from among a handful of minor league call-ups to fill the void. It is never too late for a last-minute comeback!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Dungeon Runners
description:
You and your friends play as one of six heroes and navigate an ever changing dungeon. Triumph over encounters to earn treasure or test your luck with Quests to earn Epic Treasure! Find the key to unlock the boss door, and prepare yourselves for an epic battle against one of six unique creatures of darkness.

Dungeon Runners is a board game designed to introduce new players to table top fantasy games without being too overwhelming, but while still maintaining a fun experience for hobbyist players. There are 3 different play lengths, a short game, mid game, or long game. The board is modular, so each run will be unique each time you play.

Single Player: For a single player campaign, the player takes control of 2 heroes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Pit Patrol
description:
Grab family and friends, select your favorite bird and race to the backyard to compete in a frenzy of animal fun. In Pit Patrol players take actions flying to a location, collecting resources, and buying habitats to score victory points. Bonus tokens are earned once a habitat is bought making each bird richer and faster. After each round players can disrupt their opponents future flight plans by rolling dice to activate Stealin Steve the squirrel and Patch the pit-bull.

Stealin Steve takes a resource from the location and any bird present, hording them in his nest. Patch blocks locations preventing birds from buying habitats or gathering resources. Birdies beware your opponents will soon be able to do the same to you when it is their turn to roll the dice. In the end the bird that best manages their movement, most wisely uses bonus tokens, and buys the most habitats will earn the most victory points and win the game!

Pit Patrol is a family style, set collection, take that game for 3 - 4 players. In just 20 - 30 minutes players can take each other on in a fast paced game that will leave your opponents feathers ruffled.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Year 57: Scavengers
description:
In Year 57: Scavengers, you will take on the role of one of six nation leaders in a wild and dusty post war apocalypse. Your goal is to collect resources, improve your nation, and go on raids, all the while exploring new territory, warring on other nations, trading goods, and establishing your presence in Year 57.

The flow of the game is built around gaining 'Resources', which are used to purchase 'Recipes'. These Recipes give your peoples new 'Nation Strengths' which can then be used to go on 'Raids'. 'Raids' are worth victory points at the end of the game. In addition to 'Raids', you can also excavate to collect 'Artifacts'. Different sets of these will also be worth victory points at the end of the game. In addition to collecting and purchasing cards, a large aspect of the game is discarding the 'Recipes' you've built, as each one has a unique effect that can be used AT ANY TIME. That's right, in this game you can immediately discard recipes and use effects out of turn, constantly attacking and defending against the other players with effects such as 'Gain a Victory Point', 'Cause Immediate End of Turn', or even 'Swap Hands with Another Player'.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Cornered Wolf
description:
Cornered Wolf is a skirmish game aimed at 15mm, 20mm or 28mm miniatures, and aimed at representing the chaos of urban combat with the simplest possible rules.

Uncertain activation, randomly generated forces, deployment that will throw you immediately into chaos, and quick and deadly rules will have you wargaming Chechnya in no time at all. Perfect for playing with younger family members, or for those of you who would prefer to make tactical decisions rather than look up a rule, Cornered Wolf provides everything you need for infantry, weapon teams, vehicles, multi-level buildings and suppression.

These rules cover the basic infantryman armed with AK-47 or AK-74, RPG, SVD sniper rifle or PKM. Weapon Teams like the AGS-17 automatic grenade launcher, NSV heavy machine gun, 'fagot' anti-tank missile and mortars are also covered.

Rules for vehicles cover the BTR-80, BMP-1 / BMP-2, ZSU-23-4 Shilka, 2K22 Tunguska, T-72 / T-80 and MT-LB.

While the basis of this game is kept simple (No markers or tokens needed!), extended rules are provided for players to introduce more detail. Extended rules allow troops to ride along inside (and on top of) vehicles, while extended wounding rules allow carrying wounded and loading them into vehicles. Evacuating wounded could potentially save you some points with regards to completing your mission objective.

A points system is also provided for those who aren't too keen on randomly generated forces, although we strongly recommend at least trying the random generation as it makes for very interesting and still quite balanced games.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: OrcQuest: Old Foes 1 –  The Mighty Barbarians!
description:
You will have to be nuts, or an Orc, to face them in such number ! Do not hesitate to call your allies to measure strength with these rabid dogs. If you feel you have the soul of a fearless warrior, you can now decide to add even more of the most tenacious enemies of the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: OrcQuest: PorkQuest
description:
Our Orc heroes are real adventurers. Wherever they can spread chaos and be glorious, they come bursting furiously.

They heard of the Age of Towers Kickstarter Campaign, from our Devil Pigs friends, and decided to go have a look! The perfect excuse for some kharnage! To avenge themselves, the Devil Pigs have left in our universe the Porks!

For those of you who thought that Orcs where the most deceitful and vile creatures, don´t fool yourselves!

This expansion will introduce the teamplayer mode : you can play Orcs vs Porks, where the mutual aid will be encouraged on each side. In order to protect yourselves from the Cheap Shots of the opponents, you can protect yourselves with body guards, ready to take the blows on your behalf. At the end of the game, the team with most Gains will win.

Solidary Orcs, it´s beautiful!

You will have as well the possibility of playing a game with only the Porks. The Brawl Cards with the Orc heroes from the base game can be put on the central pile to make for epic, violent fights. The Pork Brawl Cards will allow as well the Orcs to avenge themselves and to unwind the Porks.

This expansion offers you so many possibilities to go postal!

Among the Pork heroes, we welcome Lord Bacon! A general, coming directly from the dementious Universe of Kharnage and Age of Towers, by Devil Pigs. He will lead an insane crusade against the Orcs to demonstrate who is the biggest deceiver!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Final Score College Basketball Game
description:
You will need one of the Final Score College Basketball Year Books to play the game.

As the name implies, this quick play game provides you with a final score for a College Basketball game. Allowing you to rapidly play games and watch standings unfold before your eyes. However, there is more to the game than just generating scores. There is plenty of excitement and drama along the way, keeping the game play exciting and compelling. You will have nail biters, blow outs, and even a big upset or two.

Each team is rated individually for Offense, Defense, and Home Court Advantage. And while there will surely be some surprises along the way, since this is a game, after all, the accuracy of the game will astound you. We also have a normalization system for every team and season we rate, so you can play across seasons to determine the best team of all-time.

name: Big Time Charlie
description:
The game can be crudely described as Monopoly meets Scrabble. The premise is based on property development, but tile placement and scoring is similar to Scrabble.

Each player has a hand of tiles, set up on a tile stand. Each player in turn has the opportunity of placing tiles on the board alongside and tiles already on the board. Each tile placed on the board automatically makes a row (or "street") longer. At the very least a new street consisting of two tiles is formed when a new tile is laid.

Whenever a player so manages to lengthen a street by placing a new tile on the board, he scores the new total arithmetical value of the street, for as far as it extends in a straight unbroken line. Each successive tile added on to a given street will score more and more as the street increases in length and value.

Tiles must be matched to the board by color and number as a general rule, but there are a number of "joker" tiles that do not conform to this.

The game ends when the first player achieves 1000 (2 player), 800 (3 player) or 650 points (4 player).

name: Respuestas Abiertas
description:
In Respuestas Abiertas (Open answers), players must move on the board and taking cards of two different types:
- Cards with text, in which the player must answer personal and hilarious questions, and the other players try to guess the answer.
- Cads with images, in which the player must invent a phrase or words about it.
Correct guesses give points, and the winner is who has more points at the end of the game.

name: Professor Ravenwood's Time Machine
description:
Professor Ravenwood's Time Machine is a semi co-op mystery/investigation game for 2-6 players. It features elements of hand/resource management, take-that, variable player powers plus randomization which ensures it cannot be played the same way twice.

Players must work by shipping goods and trading with each other to earn enough money to buy the supplies they need to reach each location.

Once a player has the necessary supplies and holds one of the 28 map locations, they can move to the investigate phase.

Each location is always a mystery. There could be someone in hiding, holding a set of blueprints, or a shady character you will have to deal with. It may also contain a mystery crate with unknown contents..

Mystery crates however are padlocked, and can only be opened with a skeleton key. They may contain missing components of the Time Machine or unusual artifacts which will convey positive or negative effects onto the player, or everyone else.

At one of the locations, Professor Ravenwood has been locked away. When he is found, the identity of the mole can be revealed, which is one of the players chosen secretly at random at the beginning of the game.

With their cover blown, that player now becomes a Saboteur, receiving a unique deck of instruction cards, and whose mission is to subvert the search and recover as many of the missing blueprints and components before the others.

Players share the win or loss against the Saboteur, however each is also out for their share of the reward, so the person who contributes the most to the search will gain the victory points and be declared the winner.

If the Saboteur wins, all is lost. Professor Ravenwood's Time Machine must not be allowed to fall into the wrong hands.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Red Skies: Soviet Ace Pilot – Lydia Litvyak
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes Soviet ace pilot Lydia Litvyak and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
1 Yakovlev Yak-1 Fighter
1 Advantage Flying Base
1 Aircraft Card
2 Aircraft Trait Cards
2 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Lydia Litvyak Ace Card
2 Ace Skill Cards

Lyda Litvyak joined the famed Soviet all-female 586th Fighter Regiment in 1942. She scored her first two kills three days after her arrival, becoming the first woman fighter pilot to shoot down an enemy aircraft. After shooting down the German ace, Erwin Meier, he demanded to meet her to prove he had been bested by a woman. She scored a total of 14 kills.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – George Preddy
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes US ace pilot George Preddy and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
1 P-51D Mustang Fighter
1 Advantage Flying Base
1 Aircraft Card
2 Aircraft Trait Cards
2 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 George Preddy Ace Card
2 Ace Skill cards

George Preddy was the top scoring Mustang pilot and was ranked sixth overall among USAAF Aces with a total of 27 aerial victories. Despite suffering from a hangover, on August 6th 1944, Preddy shot down six enemy fighters in the course of one mission, earning him the Distinguished Service Cross.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, World War II

name: Mage Wars: Screaming Zombie Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Mage Wars originally available at GenCon 2014

Creature. Undead. Zombie.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Clubhouse Defense Squad
description:
Clubhouse Defense Squad is a 1-6 player cooperative game where you play kids who channel their favorite cartoon heroes and go up against the greatest evil that they can imagine. Clubhouse Defense Squad is a deck building, tower defense and strategy game all mashed up into one.

Place randomized Gates in each of the 8 areas surrounding the Clubhouse as the first line of defense. These each also have a different game changing effect. Place 6 Bad Guys around the outside of the board, letting the D8 decide the fate of which Gate they will be attacking.

Collect your allowance, buy new Arsenal or Equipment cards and then dive into the fight. Each player has their own number of Actions per turn. Your hand allows you to add damage to attacks, gain extra actions and much more.

When your turn ends, the Bad Guys assault begins. Roll the D8 once and then go around the board resolving their randomized attacks. Once a Gate falls, the Bad Guys move in and start attacking the Clubhouse.

You win when you vanquish all Bad Guys in the draw pile. You lose when the Clubhouse is destroyed, all defenders are kidnapped or the Dusk Clock reaches 6 pm and the kids are called home dinner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Task Forces and Convoys:  A Naval Chess Game
description:
My simple, free print-and-play, fast-playing abstract World War 2 naval operations game for family and friends - my 7 year old daughter loves it - free to print-and-play on CoatneyHistory.

Choice of 7x7 square or 7 hexagons on a side hexagonal battle boards to play upon. The hexagonal board can enable a 3-way game: British vs. Italian vs. French, for example. And there can be separate task force commands for team games.

Includes a simple basic game version for beginners.

For the more wargame game, a CV, BB, CA&CL, DD, Sub, Convoy, and Land-based Air vs. [same] matrix is used to resolve contact&combat. The rules are only 2 pages (so far).

I have no idea as to play balance or optimal (selection of ship types) force structure at this point, but I/we've already had a lot of just fun with it here in Oslo.

Representative Italian, American, British, German, Japanese, Russian, and French ships are included for secret selection and deployment and are revealed only with contact/combat.

I now have a more complex "Historical Game" too, with historical scenarios - it's fun doing them for such an abstract game - and additional ship units: Norway 1940, Mers el Kebir, Cape Spartivento, Matapan, Denmark Strait, Cornering Bismarck, Escape from Riga, 2nd Sirte, Coral Sea, Midway, Convoy PQ17, Savo, Eastern Solomons, Cape Esperance, Santa Cruz, 1st Guadalcanal, 2nd Guadalcanal, Tassafaronga, Philippine Sea, Surigao Strait, Engano, and probably more to come - maybe added by others.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Snapshot
description:
You are partaking in a photo contest at the zoo. Each player must walk through the multiple zoo paths and take 15 pictures of animals, according to objective cards. As soon as a player managed to take all the pictures he needed, the contest ends and each player tally its points.

The trick is that each time an animal has a picture taken of him, he gets scared and hides. Healers must take care of him for him to be visible again by other players.

—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: The Heroic Legend of Arslan
description:
The Heroic Legend of Arslan is a cooperative fantasy game set in the world of the homonymous epic by Tanaka Yoshiki. Players assume the roles of characters of the Pars army, aiming to clear stages while working together. Victory or defeat depends on teamwork.
Join the world of the Arslan, defeat the hostile armies, and take back the Kingdom!

The Heroic Legend of Arslan is a fantasy novel series written by Tanaka Yoshiki. It started to be published in 1986 and ended in 2017 with 16 novels and one side-story. It was adapted into a manga, 2 anime film adaptations, a 4-part (unfinished) anime OVA, and an anime television series (covering the first 4 novels).
The game, its artwork, story, and the scenarios are based on the latter.

—user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: RallyBird Baseball
description:
RallyBird Baseball (also known as RallyByrd Baseball) is a 1-hour board game that Peter Gelman designed to emphasize quick turns, easy of play, yet meaningful baseball decisions for both offense and defense.

Here's the general idea of play: Offense chooses a tactic from the set of At Bat cards and places it face down. Then Defense arranged the 6 Glove tiles in their zones on the board. Offense reveals the card, showing the tactic and what zone or zones it tests. Offense rolls 2 six-sided dice and compares the sum of the dice to the sum of the relevant Glove zones. The dice result is either less than, equal to, or more than the sum of the Glove zones. The players apply the At Bat card's result to the batter and base runners.

The game board is 18-inches square. The tiles, made of laser-cut pressboard, are 2-inches square. These tiles include Defense's Glove tiles, Inning tiles to keep time, and Run tiles for keeping score. The 17 At Bat cards are poker sized. There are 4 red and 4 blue large wooden meeple tokens, and 2 yellow Out tokens as well.

The Rally Bird itself, also a tile, is a popular and recommended optional rule that gives the 9th inning underdog an extra chance... extra chances continue if the underdog succeeds, as long as they succeed. In baseball terms, it's a rally. If Home follows Visitor as a 9th inning underdog, both sides will have the opportunity to find inspiration in the birds who visit the field.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Crime: Do not Cross
description:
"Crime - do not cross" it's an Investigation card game.
Someone has tried to kill the king of England and now you have to find out who it was ... Not alone, but with the help of the most famous detectives in the world.

In a first deck we find 10 detective and some tools. The tools need to increase the value of each detective.

Each player must play with 2 private cards in his hand.
On the Table we find 9 public card and each player must reserved 3 of this in a row, in a coloumn or in diagonal (like tic tac toe).

Only the public cards reserved by a single player can increase the value of their investigation.
Who has the highest value, can investigate and find the clues to solve the case.

A player wins when find all the right clues or if it's the last in game.

name: Capital City: The Game Store
description:
Yee-haw! Your Old West town is now ready for tabletop fun!

Nobody in the Old West cares about dry goods, so replace the dry goods store building card in Capital City with The Game Store promotional card.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: ShutterBug: Train Tickets
description: When using the ShutterBug: Train Tickets mini-expansion, during set-up, all players receive one train ticket card and place it face up in front of them. Once per game during their turn, while their pawn is in a city, a player may flip their train ticket to the VOID side to move their pawn to any other city as a free action. Once used, the card cannot be used again for the rest of the game. All aboard!

name: Shootin Iron
description:
Shootin Iron is a fast-playing miniature game designed for tournament play or pick-up games. The goal of these rules isn't to simulate realism, but rather to allow you to play out cinematic Wild West shootouts using smart tactics and no small bit of luck.

—description from the introduction

This concise miniatures game shares some cosmetic elements with Shotguns -n- Saddles, (the roleplaying game); however, it is a standalone miniatures combat game. The play surface is suggested as 3' x 3', with at least some indication of terrain. The game assumes figures will be used to denote participating units. Ranges are given in inches and play assumes the use of a tape measure. Resolution requires a D6 and a D8. The game rules primarily deal with fire and movement (as you would expect). The default starting situation finds two opposing teams ("posse") of six fighters each.

The game is played in rounds; during each round each participant takes a turn. Turns are executed in specified order and effects take place immediately. Units utilize a simple facing mechanic and gain benefits depending on type. Some complicating rules (e.g., "town folk") are optional. The rules are presented as a single, color PDF document - included are the rules, optional rules, and twelve scenarios (eleven are standard westerns; one is a weird western (zombies).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Simulation, Take That

name: The Flower Essence Game
description:
Designed by award-winning Napoleonic wargame designer Kevin Zucker, this flower game is used for learning the names and properties of flower essences.

Seven flower cards are dealt to each player, dealing the cards one at a time, picture side up, so that all the cards can be seen at the same time. Three symptom (green) cards are laid out in the center of the playing area face-up. The players agree on a famous real or fictional person who fits the "patient profile".

Players scan over the flower cards and turn over 1, 2, or 3 cards that their eyes land on first. Each player turns over his or her own cards. Read the separate cards and pick one that relates to the symptom or symptoms, explaining to the other players how this addresses the symptom. Each player in turn plays one flower card that best addresses the symptom or symptoms, explaining how this applies. Players scan over the remaining cards in front of them and pick those they wish to turn over. Repeat these steps until all the cards that each player wants to introduce have been played.

Discuss which of the flower essence cards introduced into play by the players best fit the symptoms. Refer to the Flower Essence Repertory as needed. There may be more than one right answer. The goal is to agree on up to 5 essences for the perfect blend to fit the patient's symptoms.

Items required

• One deck of Affirm a Flower affirmation cards (published by FES)

• One deck of Green Apple cards from the game Apples to Apples®

...

Example of play: If Marilyn Monroe is considered to be the "patient", the following might happen when the flower cards are examined. The first player played "Pretty Face" which says "I accept all parts of my self. Light shines through darkness and pain. My whole self is my beautiful self. I am this Shining Star." The second player played "Dogwood" which says "My body is healed by flowing grace. I release what has become hardened. This gentle purity fills body and soul. I feel the blessing of grace-filled life." It was determined that either flower card would help address the life challenges of Marilyn Monroe, and both players were considered to have right answers.

There are also solitaire and advanced versions of this game.

name: Disloyal Royals
description:
Disloyal Royals is a two player card game that uses only standard playing cards and dice. At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt a jack, queen, and king. This is your royal family. The royal family wants to collect riches (diamonds) and bury them (face down) for safe keeping. Throughout the game, players will attempt to dig up their opponent's riches using their shovels (spades). When this doesn't work, they will attack their rival using their clubs (clubs). To protect against clubbings, they will strengthen their defences (hearts). The player with the most buried riches (diamonds) at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

name: Army Guys
description:
Army Guys is a game for people who want to play strategy games, but don't want to sift through a novel to learn the rules or pay thousands of dollars to put together an army. Army Guys is meant to be played with minimal accessories - you can play on the floor or on a table; you can use literally anything to make up the battlefield; and you only need a tape measure.

—description from the introduction

The game is designed primarily for two opponents but does support more players; the game is intended to be quickly learned and rapidly played. The rules assume (but do not demand) the game will be played with "little green men" plastic figures, and uses a suitable scale for movement. Forces are purchased with a point-buy system. Initial placement uses a "hold and drop" method (preferred) to randomize units in a close area. Play proceeds in alternating turns. During each turn a player may select five units and execute two actions with each unit. The game supports only two actions - move and attack. Attacking units have an "accuracy" value which must beat the defender's "hitability" value - in which case, hits are automatic. Damage is randomly rolled. Several types of special movement and terrain are supported.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: DropMix: G.I. Joe – Main Title Theme (Remix) Promo Card
description:
One of two exclusive promo cards released as giveaways to the attendees of the 2018 Pax East Convention in Boston.

This is an additional wild card (can be played on any color sequence) and plays a remix of the 1980's G.I. Joe theme song.

Icons for the card are as follows:

Yellow (vocals): Mic
Red (Loops): Keyboard
Blue (Percussion): Drumbeat
Green (Baseline): Keyboard

The expansion icon displays a DM logo in the lower right corner of the card with a "3" below it.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Real-time

name: Darling in the Franxx: Training Grounds
description:
Based on the hit anime by Studio Trigger, Training Grounds is an unique 2 v 2 free print and play board game where you and your partner straddle on to pilot a Franxx together in order to defeat your opponents who do the same in combat training.

Each pair consists of 1 Stamen and 1 Pistil player. Pick your character respectively and partner up to co-pilot in a fun simultaneous select and reveal action programming system.

You'll want to communicate with your partner so your attack is well coordinated, but the more you communicate, the more info you give away to your opponents!

Download the Print and Play here: https://www.brotherminggames.com/
Play the Table Top Simulator here: https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=13679366...
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Out of Line: Nature Calls
description:
Out of Line: Nature Calls is a leg-crossing game of Russian roulette. A stand-alone expansion of our Out of Line series, players race to the front of a line of portable toilets at an outdoor concert. The deck is full of cards to help you cheat your way to the front, but you never can tell when nature might strike. The further you get into the deck the more desperate the race becomes because the clock is always ticking on a full bladder.

To win, you simply have to be the first one to get to a portable toilet without having any accidents along the way. Nature could call at any moment and no one may make it to the front of the line, so use all the tricks up your sleeves to cheat your way to the front.

A player's turn consists of 3 easy steps:
1. Roll a dice and move that line up
2. Draw a card and hope nature doesn’t strike
3. Take an action (play a card, move to the back of a line or just discard a card)

Player cards allow you to do things like:
• Move a player to the end of a line
• Force a player out of line
• Let a foodie cut into the front of the line
• Add people to the end of a line
• Temporarily close down a portable toilet
• Stop another player from playing a card

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Puzzleboard game
description:
Puzzleboard game (for 2 - 6 people)
(print&play game)
The board game consists of 6*9=54 piece puzzle element and a regular hexagonal dice. The basic board consists of the common play area which is avilable for everyone, and the 6 individual play areas.
At the beginning of the game, the players agree to wich picture (figure) the each want to complete at wich area. In case of debate, the decision will be made by the dice.
After the decision, the puzzle elements have to be placed at the common play area ofthe hexagon, which can happen according to the player's agreement:
- placed according the chosen picture (figure) at the furthest slice from the individual game area,
- the chosen picture at the furthest slice from the individual game area: mixed,
- the puzzle elements are mixed at the hexagon of the common game area: with the agreement of every player.
Regular movement of the puzzle elements: at the common or individual game area,in patallel with one of the without skipping another element.
After rolling the dice, the number on top of dice will determine the number of steps.
One step is when a player moves a puzzle element to a specific direction: towards the individual game area of the player, without having another puzzle element in the way (without skipinng another element). If there is an element in the way, it should be movedorderly beforhand. If the element not reach individual's game area, it is has to be parked (stored temporarily). In case the puzzle element at the individual game area can only be rotated to the correct position, then it should be moved (orderly) to the O sign first, abd then rotate it here.
The winner is the one who completes the picture (figure) at his own game area.

name: Footprint: World Edition
description:
Planet Earth is struggling under high levels of pollution. Your task is to buy and invest in eco-innovations to build a successful green economy which reduces Earth’s pollution. Along the way you can win bonuses by answering fascinating facts about the world's geography, wildlife and environment. You’ll have to keep an eye on the clock though, as you need to reduce all the pollution before time runs out!

Footprint is a semi-cooperative euro-style card game where players answer bonus questions and buy and invest in eco-innovations to remove pollution cubes from Earth. There are three levels of questions in the game to suit different ages and abilities (beginner, medium and advanced).

The winner is the player who removes the most pollution from Earth, however should players run out of turn cards before all the pollution is removed, everyone loses!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Fighter in Sight
description:
Fighter In Sight is an aerial-based game for two players or more, which recounts the WW2 battles.

Minimum length: 45 minutes (Playing can take longer, depending on scenario size and number of players) At the controls of your fighter planes, will you dare you to fight the fearsome Messerschmitt 109E over England, or the famous Japanese Zeros over the Pacific Ocean ? Will you succeed this battle ? Or will you have to escape the flaming wreck ? Fighter In Sight, with its historical scenarios, will allow you to relive this all over again. The game proposes a fresh approach of aerial combat. It will allow you to make mass struggle by involving many squadrons. Fighter In Sight was created with rules that will become more difficult as you play more scenarios. For example, when playing the first scenario you will learn how to use the speedometer. When playing the second one, you will also learn about the fuel management, and so on. The progressive rules have been prepared to address families as well as experienced players. It offers a simple, fast, realistic and easy to assimilate gameplay. It is possible to increase the realism and the difficulty level with additional parameters. Documenting and researching about historical background and technical facts has been an important part of the creation of Fighter in Sight so that the game would respect as much as possible the spirit of air combat, and still remain easy to play.

—description from the designer

name: Welded Iron
description:
Lore:
In an alternate 19th century world created by artist Nicholas Maxson-Francombe, machines have been built to serve as soldiers. Fires burn in their heads, keeping their engines running and they survive a hail of bullets. Princess Feodora has taken control of London, which has now been turned into Clockwork City.

Machines were given more and more autonomy and control - punchcards passed between soldiers and seers. Now, the machines seem to have developed some sort of consciousness and no-one has heard from Feodora in years.

In Edinburgh, re-engineering has gone awry and a new set of machines has arisen, wanting nothing less than the decimation of every potential problem in the land - including humans!

Clockwork City is being invaded, this is the moment for the human captives of Clockwork City to escape.

Welded Iron allows players to either play as the Imperial machines defending their tyranny over Clockwork City, or as human heroes who strive to escape.

The Imperials want to keep the humans as slaves and keep their infrastructure intact. The humans want to avoid casualties and use the chaos to evacuate the city. In the end, everyone might survive but this is just the start of the war.

Gameplay:
Welded Iron is a tower defense yet competitive game of an uneasy asymmetric alliance between one player: the imperial machine overlords and the other human factions. The imperial machines will use iron and steel resources to build and maintain infrastructure, while also ensuring area control over regions where humans work and live. Each player will have asymmetric powers to reflect the differences in strengths and objectives. For instance, The imperials will have powers which help to quickly build up defense infrastructure from the invading machines of the North, while also utilizing passive human "resources" to help in those goals. The human factions will have formed an alliance with one another after the grueling human wars in a bid to overthrow their imperial overlords. Their objectives are at odds with the imperials, as they must extract and rescue as many humans in clockwork city, and beyond to win, yet also defending the city from invasion.

The game utilities randomly allocated hex tiles with positions in which towers are built for defense and attack, with regions to place electricity to power these up. The hex tiles also contain unknown bonus resources, with higher more valuable resources closer to the invading camps of the north. The imperial and human factions must work together to defeat an AI controlled invasion force or face annihilation, while also working towards their own objectives to win.

Designed by acclaimed medium-heavy weight designer David Turczi, Welded Iron will please those looking for a new fresh take on tower defense games, with many miniatures available.

-description from publisher

name: WinPak #2
description:
This six scenario pack revolves around battles involving AMERICAN FORCES in the European Theatre of Operation, during World War Two, and is compatible with MMP's ASL™ System and modifiable to be used with other miniature Wargaming systems.

Note: WinPak #2 uses ASL boards (10,40,54,55) and ASLSK boards (p)

The six scenarios are:

Martinville Ridge, France, 9 July 1944: Elements of the 3rd Fallschirmjager Division supported by an Assault Gun launch a counterattack against Company A, 1st Battalion, US 175th Infantry Regiment in attempt to stem the American advance. The Americans, pounded by heavy fire and taking causalities, are forced to withdraw and are nearly routed...

Media, Morocco, 9 November 1942: The Allied Forces have just landed in North Africa as apart of Operation TORCH; for the American, this operation is their first in the European Theatre. A key objective for the US 60th Infantry Regiment and its commander Brigadier-General Lucian Truscott is the airfield at Port Lyautey...

Honinghutie, Holland, 18 September 1944: Just before dawn, a small force of American paratroopers of the 508th Parachute Infantry Regiment under the command of Lt. Lloyd Polette Jr. are tasked with securing Bridge #10 over the Maas-Waal Canal; in the fading darkness the forces breaks cover and races for the bridge...

Pont de St. Fromond, France, 7 July 1944: The US crossing of the Vire River had gone better than anticipated, the 117th Infantry Regiment had three companies across under the cover of a heavy mist, and they fanned out to secure a bridgehead, Company G ran into resistance in the village of Pont de St. Fromond...

Martinville Ridge, France, 9 July 1944: The German counterattack along Martinville ridge had managed to cut off several forward units of the American 29th Infantry Division. The Fallschirmjagers toting flamethrowers and supported by assault guns advance against the dug-in and lightly armed Americans...

Mortain, France, 7 August 1944: For Operation Luttich SS-Panzer-Grenadier Division 17 "Gotz von Belichingen" now reduced to kampfgruppe strength was tasked with the capture of a ridge known as Hill 317. The hill, occupied by the 2d Battalion, US 120th Infantry Regiment, was located on the eastern side of the Mortain, which the Germans had earlier decided to bypass, but now had come back to sting them...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Sellswords and Spellslingers: Count Cariali's Curse
description:
Count Cariali’s Curse is a scenario for the Sellswords & Spellslingers solo/coop skirmish rules.

Count Cariali came back from a trip changed into something horrible. Now the good people of a small village have hired a group of mercenaries -- your party -- to deal with the Count. But rumors about the Count’s monstrous nature are contradictory. Is he a vampire, a chaos acolyte, or just a madman? You will know the truth only when you will meet him.

This medium difficulty scenario also includes:

Cards for 15 new foes (Armored Guard, Chaos Champion, Chaos Cultist, Lunatic, Major Vampire, Medusa, Minor Vampire, Minor Werewolf, Mutant Souldrinker, Possessed Madman, Serpent-Man Brute, Serpent Man, Campire Thrall, Versipellis, and Armored Militia)

Cards for 8 chaos mutations;

Cards for 9 Vampire powers;

Cards for 5 Useful Items and 2 new potions;

Two pages of counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Malign Sorcery
description:
The cataclysmic necroquake of Shyish has flooded the Mortal Realms with the powers of the aether. Incantations summon forth new conjurations of unprecedented power and frightful sentience, but beware – such endless spells can be treacherous, as likely to turn upon their caster as they are to devastate the enemy. From unleashing disembodied gnashing jaws to devour your foes, to raising prismatic barricades to protect your flanks, doing battle in the time of the Arcanum Optimar is unlike anything that has come before.

The Malign Sorcery boxed set is an expansion for Warhammer Age of Sigmar containing new rules and spells for magic, along with 17 imposing miniatures used to represent Endless Spells, powerful pieces of sorcery that can be unleashed by any wizard. These rules and miniatures can be used alongside the core rules to introduce wildly different and incredibly powerful spells brought about by the Arcanum Optimar – an age of rampant magic. When combined with the Realm of Battle rules found in the Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Book, this set becomes a gaming toolbox you can use to fight narrative-driven battles in the Mortal Realms.

Contained within the box:

The Book

Malign Sorcery features an 88-page hardback book packed with rules and background:


Magic in the Mortal Realms: a history of magic in the Mortal Realms, tracing the origins of sorcery back to the Age of Myth and presenting detailed information on the differing specialisations of various races, and the magics of the Eight Realms.
The Learning of Magic: all sorcerers face the same dangers when bending wild powers to their will – the forces Order, Death, Destruction and Chaos deal with these dangers in their own manners, detailed here;
Concerning Realmstone: this mysterious substance contains enough power to annihilate cities – here is detailed the different realmstones which can be found across the Eight Realms;
Descriptions of 13 manifestations that herald a new era of magic, which will soon be seen of every battlefield in the Mortal Realms;
A showcase of the miniatures found in the box, including step-by-step guides and descriptions of effective painting techniques.


Rules

Rules expanding the use of magic in games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar make up the second section of the book:


Endless Spells: these are the rules for using the miniatures included with Malign Sorcery, magical constructs which remain in play until dispelled or out of bounds. This includes 5 Narrative Battleplans designed for use with this set;
Skirmish on the Realm’s Edge: the wild magics unleashed by the necroquake grow wilder the closer to the borders between realms an army finds itself – these are rules for fighting skirmishes right where the sorcery is at its strongest. Includes Command Traits, Artefacts, and Leader Spells, Rewards of Battle and Edge of Aqshy scenery rules (for games set within that Realm). Also includes a Skirmish battleplan specifically designed for use with this set;
Paths to Glory at the Realm’s Edge: rules for playing a Path to Glory campaign under the conditions at a realm’s edge, including Followers Rewards Table and Champions Rewards Table. Also includes 2 Paths to Glory battleplans specifically designed for use with this set;
Spells of the Realms: 7 sets of spells for use with the Realm of Battle rules from the Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Book;
Artefacts of the Realms: Artefacts of Power – weapons and relics – divided between different Mortal Realms for use in games;
2 Pitched Battle battleplans specifically designed for use with this set;
Pitched Battle profiles for the Endless Spells, including minimum and maximum unit sizes, points, and battlefield role.


Miniatures

13 Endless Spells are represented, with 17 push-fit miniatures used to represent the Endless Spells on the tabletop:


A Purple Sun of Shyish, an enormous spiked orb with a skull face, supplied on purple-coloured plastic;
Ravenak’s Gnashing Jaws, a huge set of jaws that streak across the battlefield, supplied on red-coloured plastic;
The Suffocating Gravetide, a large wave of skulls pulling up dirt and rocks in a chaotic tsunami, supplied on red-coloured plastic;
A set of Quicksilver Swords, 11 blades descending to the ground on pillars of flame supplied on silver plastic;
An Aethervoid Pendulun, an enormous swinging axe with aetherflames describing its arc, supplied on silver plastic;
A set of Chronomantic Cogs, sinister clockwork bursting from the ground, supplied on silver plastic;
An Umbral Spellportal, a pair of spectral mirrors supplied on silver plastic;
A set of Soulsnare Shackles, 3 miniatures depicting magical shackles flailing through the air, supplied on silver plastic;
A pair of Geminids of Uhl-Ghysh, two spheres locked in magical orbit, supplied on blue plastic;
A Burning Head, depicted as a huge flaming skull, supplied on blue plastic;
A Malevolent Maelstrom, an orb full of skeletons surrounded by magical flames, supplied on blue plastic;
A Prismatic Palisade, a sturdy cover structure made up of sorcerous crystals, supplied on blue plastic;
An Emerald Lifeswarm, countless insects swarming forth from a fallen warrior, supplied on blue plastic.


Extras

The box also includes 14 Endless Spell Warscroll cards – these cover each of the miniatures described above with a 14th card covering rules for the Balewind Vortex, available separately. As an added bonus, the entire set comes in a sturdy box with a handle, making it easy to transport to and from games!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: J'apprends le calcul mental en jouant
description:
An educational mathematical game for children and parents.

In this simple speed game, players are dealt cards with numbers. One after another, they reveal their current card: if colors match between 2 cards already placed face up on the table, the first player to say out loud the proper solution of the mathematical operation (addition, subtraction or multiplication) wins both cards. The last player to have cards remaining in their deck wins the game.

name: MYnd Kraft
description:
MYnd Kraft is a card game inspired by basic programming concepts.
There are two types of cards in the deck – Action Cards and Number Cards. Action cards present problems, based on programming concepts, which need to be solved using Number Cards and players score points for solving Action Cards. The goal is to score the highest number of points in order to win the game. A point worth noting is that there are only numbers and symbols on the cards and there is no text.

There are seven different games that could be played with the MYnd Kraft card deck.....


EZY CODR: Provides a gentle introduction to the underlying programming concepts introduced by Action Cards with each player in turn getting a chance to solve Action Cards and score points.
SPEEDY MONSTR: A fast paced game where players compete simultaneously (instead of in turn) to solve Action Cards and score points.
MEMRY FLIPOTHON: A game that challenges memory skills as Action Cards are revealed one at a time and players have to remember their location in order to solve them and score points.
DECODE: A game that challenges players to consider different permutations when solving Action Cards in order to score the highest points.
COBBLE THE CODE: A strategic, tile placement game similar to Scrabble.
CODR POKR MATCH: A challenging game where players apply ‘game theory’ when wagering with the objective of winning as much as possible one pot at a time - similar to a game of poker.
CODR LEAGUE: A strategic, partnership game where players work in teams of two to solve as many Action Cards as possible and score points.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Kampfgruppe Scherer: Player’s Guide
description: Articles and additional scenarios for the Kampfgruppe Scherer ASL historical module. There is a 60 page player’s guide and seven scenario cards which consist of scenarios KGS16-23, SASL Mission KGS1, and scenario FT224.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Killing Lee Garvin
description:
A 3-6 player card game about killing real-world game designer Lee Garvin. Or saving him, you can win either way. Basic play involves color combinations of amusingly illustrated Harm and Help cards to manipulate the overall state of play.

Get rid of all the Harm tokens you have and you win. If someone else has too many, Lee bites the dust, and the winner is the one with the fewest tokens. So, you can either frame someone else for Lee's demise if you think you will end the round with the best game position, or simply try to improve your own position without making too many enemies.

—description from the publisher

name: Darkness Comes Rattling: War of the Spirits
description:
In War of the Spirits, an expansion for the cooperative board game, Darkness Comes Rattling, players must stop their world from being torn asunder by the powerful, world-eating serpent. With a new and challenging end game, new obstacles to overcome, and new boons to discover, players are tasked with saving both the physical and spirit worlds before Darkness grows hungry once more.

The Darkness Comes Rattling: War of the Spirits expansion bundle includes:
- 52 Vision Quest cards
- 6 Body of the Beast cards (and 1 Eater of Stars card)
- 18 Unleashed Event cards
- 4 New Legendary Item Cards
- 4 Blessings Cards

Description on DriveThruRPG website

War of the Spirits is a digital-only expansion for Darkness Comes Rattling. It includes a quest system for the game that allow the players to take on Darkness in a new way, adding new difficulties to the game.

Players can now take on Darkness directly as a group, foregoing venturing inside the snake to free the Sun. To do this, they must gain the Winds' Blessings and keep the world pure. The better the players do, the weaker Darkness will be when it is forced to manifest on Tallil.

The game rules for War of the Spirits can be found below, and the components can be printed on-demand from DriveThruRPG.

Description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: The Barmaid's Tale
description:
The Barmaid's Tale takes place in the Ratcatcher's Rest, one of Tinderbox's more colorful establishments, and features a game known to the locals as "Pass the Buck".

The game is introduced via a story a barmaid at the Ratcatchers relates in an interview, in an obvious parody of "The Canterbury Tales". The account details the exploits of a hapless party of adventurers returning to Tinderbox to face their patron after a failed quest. Needing to set an example, but realizing that even bad help is hard to find, their benefactor decides that only one of them will be held accountable. But whose fault was it? It's at this point that the players step in to, well, pass the buck.

The Barmaid's Tale is a simple ten-minute social strategy game of blame and bribery for 4-6 players.
categories: Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play

name: The Trader's Tale
description:
Now a day of discount sales across Tinderbox, the original "Ruby Tuesday" was so named after a famous quest to recover the ruby hoard of the Salamander King. This quest saw every adventurer in Tinderbox racing to equip themselves and be the first to embark on the adventure, making a lot of traders very wealthy in the process.

The Trader's Tale is a fast-paced trading game in which you compete to control the game board and equip your party of adventurers.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Stock Holding, Trading

name: 18Moon
description: An 18xx game on the surface of the moon. Incorporates a few interesting differences as a result and is a unique map.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding

name: Musket Diplomacy
description:
A Napoleonic Wars flavored multi-player campaign game for up to 6 players based on Avalon Hill's War and Peace, Blitzkrieg, and Diplomacy.
Each player is a major state on a fictional continent occupied by 5 other major states and 7 minor states. The players have force pools from which to purchase infantry, cavalry, naval forces, and naval transports, to gain control of the continent for themselves or their alliance.

A print-and-play game with 1872 one-sided counters on a 33" x 26" map, 30 Event Cards, 12 Reinforcement Schedule Cards, 6 player cards, charts and tables, rules, and even art-work for the box you store it in, as well as a ZunTzu gamebox to play online or even solitaire without printing a thing...
all available free, at Uhlan Games: http://UhlanGames.us

—description from the publisher

name: Simulation Theory
description:
What if everyone you know, loved, and remembered are just complex simulations in a computer-generated universe? What if you began to see through the shroud that separates what you think is your life from what is real? What if you wake up from this simulation, only to wonder if you are in another?

With multiple play modes for competitive, solo, or even cooperative play, what happens next is completely up to you. You can play the game in the standard Classic mode, the more complex Challenge mode, or the stretch goal based Adventure mode, which will allow you to match wits against a litany of enemies.

Compete with your friends in a race to ascend to the ultimate reality! Choose cooperative play to collaborate with your rivals or plot each others’ downfall. Or go solo and practice your skills at breaking out of the simulation.

The base game will include 3 realities, each with 5 unique characters. A 6th character per reality will be available as a stretch goal. Each of these characters has their own strengths and weakness plus a unique backstory which has a real impact in the Adventure mode.

—description from the publisher

name: DreamQuest: L'épouvanpaille
description:
Dreamquest is an invitation to create with your kid a customized book in wich you are the story's characters, but not any of those!
From an adventure notebook, you decide which paths to take and what challenge to deal with. The game system is based on cards that allows the players to solve different challenges.

Once the adventure is finished, you can record and personalize your story in a few clics on the website Elixeer. Abra-cada-bra, you'll receive YOUR novel within a few days.

Elixeer is offering a wonderful experience to get generations of players along and develop the taste of books to children, by mixing gaming and reading.

Dreamquest is a 2 players game, as from 5 years old and for games of about 30 minutes

------- French -------

Dreamquest vous invite à créer avec votre enfant un livre personnalisé dont vous êtes les acteurs de l’histoire, mais pas n’importe laquelle ! A partir d’un carnet d’aventure, vous décidez ensemble des chemins à prendre et épreuves à affronter. Un système de jeu coopératif à base de cartes permet de résoudre les différents défis.

Une fois l’aventure terminée, vous enregistrez et personnalisez votre histoire en quelques clics sur le site Elixeer. Abracadabra, vous recevez VOTRE roman quelques jours plus tard.

Elixeer propose une formidable expérience pour rapprocher les générations et développer le goût du livre chez les enfants, mélangeant le jeu et la lecture.

Dreamquest se joue à 2, à partir de 5 ans pour des parties de 30 minutes environ.

name: Oracles Game: Civil War
description:
Oracles Game is a 2 to 10 player, team-oriented, combat strategy board game with augmented reality feature, designed to work with its exclusive free mobile application to elevate board game to a whole new level. Players will split into two teams, choose a leader on each side and start the game with the goal to occupy the enemy’s tavern.
On their journey, players will face obstacles, mystery chests, dragons, sea monsters and dark forest creatures challenging them for their lives. Your leader, using the included augmented reality mobile application, will guide you through the dangers of the game and into victory.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Civil War, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Knights of King Arthur
description:
Knights of King Arthur is an adventure game for two or more players -- played with miniature figures -- which simulates the heroic combat of the Age of Chivalry. Here is a realistic game in which you lead an army of knights and men-at-arms as they pit sword against shield in a struggle for the throne of medieval England. It is your skill and strategy which will determine the outcome.

Knights of King Arthur is a simplified version of Heritage's Knights and Magick gaming system. This set is your introduction to the world of Adventure Gaming with miniature figures -- then as your interests and abilities grow, you can add to the set with extra figures from the Knights and Magick line and begin playing with the extra features in the advanced Knights and Magick Rules Set.

—description from the publisher

A Knights and Magick series game from Heritage USA's Paint 'N' Play line. The Paint 'N' Play games all feature Heritage miniatures along with paints and painting instructions. Knights of King Arthur also includes miniatures rules that allow you to fight out battles directly on the tabletop.

Additional contents include 14 metal miniature figures, paints, brush, "gaming die," and a painting guide. Heritage sold additional 25mm "fantasy-historical" metal figures that could be used with the series games.

—user summary

name: Drinkill
description:
It’s time to get drunk! Drinkill is a drinking board game that will make each game become a night you’ll surely remember, and a day you’d rather forget.
How do you win? The only objective is to make it to the end. The first player that arrives to the “Vomit Here” space at the end of the board is the winner.
How do you lose? If you’re not the first player that arrives in the last space. You can also lose if you refuse to do a challenge but also refuse to take a shot. You can always surrender and admit defeat.
The Drinkill game consists of 10 different characters. Each character has a special ability that can be used only once in every game. Before the game starts, each player chooses a character and draws 3 item cards from the deck. All players roll a pair of dice – the player with the higher number goes first and the other turns go clockwise.
On each turn, the player rolls a pair of dice and advances the number of spaces the dice say – when landing on a space – the player must do what the space indicates.
If it’s your turn, you can activate any card in your hand. If it’s not your turn, you can activate any card that is marked with a star.


What type of cards can you draw in this game?
Item cards: Items can be used to give the user an advantage in the game. Attack your opponents or delay them, defend yourself from other opponents and many other functions to make you win the race.

Challenge cards: Challenges are the core of the Drinkill game. When a player lands on challenge space he has to draw a card from the deck and decide whether to complete the challenge or to take a shot.

STD cards: STD cards are challenge cards that the player can hold in his hand like item cards and use them against other opponents.

Each player can hold up to 5 item cards at any given time and any amount of STD cards. Challenge cards are immediately discarded. Item and STD cards are discarded after use.


The Drinkill board spaces and what you have to do when you land on each of them:
1. Burning shot – Take a shot.
2. Totem – Draw an item card from the deck.
3. Challenge – Draw a challenge card from the deck. You can decide to do the challenge or take a shot instead.
4. STD – Draw an STD card from the deck.
5. Pub – Choose another player to take a shot with, take a picture and upload it.
6. Hospital – You’re stuck there and lose your next turn.
7. Arrow space – Go forward/backward depending on the number on the arrow space.
8. Golden coin – If you have the “Capitalist Pig” item card and you land on this space you can choose as many opponents as you want and discard all of their item cards.


Invite your friends, race them to the end and do a lot of stupid challenges while you’re getting drunk. Use cards combos and collaborate with other players to delay the leading opponent.

Do you think you’re hardcore? Do you want to make your friends wash the dishes? Do you want to make someone drink all the leftovers of the party? Do you want to kiss a beautiful girl but you’re the ugliest dude around? Now you can.

name: Trucking Hell
description:
Trucking Hell is a pick-up-and-deliver game. Deliver objects of various types to cities that may be asking for animals, furniture, toiletries, food, etc. The things you pick up are actually Wibbell++ cards, which you then use to spell out the things that you are delivering! Thus, this game challenges both your spelling ability and your route-planning.

It's the first in a series of games that will contain a mini-Wibbell++ deck as one of the components.

name: Battles of 1866: Austrian Gatling Guns
description:
This is the sixth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 21 additional counters with rules on their inclusion in two games.
—user summary

For Frontier Battles, we look at Austria's too-little-too-late attempts to arm its infantry with breechloading rifles, and how this might have affected the outcome of the battles of 1866 had it been accomplished in time. We've provided new pieces for a brigade armed with Werndl breechloaders (Ferdinand Poschacher von Poschach's "Iron Brigade" of I Corps) so you can try it out in the Jicin scenarios.

As part of Austria's desperate attempts to re-arm, the Imperial-Royal Army acquired another new technology: the Gatling gun. The Viennese firm of Paget purchased a license and began production, but the guns did not reach the troops until years after the war had ended. Once again, we have new pieces to equip I and X Corps so you can mow down the Prussians at Jicin and Trautenau.

We went the route of weirdness and fun for Chickamauga&Chattanooga. You get pieces for the Confederate helicopter, so you can bomb the Yankee invaders into oblivion. Or as the Northern forces of freedom, you can deploy Siamese elephants.

—description from the publisher

name: Panzer Grenadier: Sherman Tanks
description:
This is the twenty-third of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 24 additional counters, all alternative Sherman Tanks, with variants for their use.
—user summary

Almost 50,000 Shermans would be produced during the Second World War, equipping not only U.S. Army and Marine Corps tank units but those of many Allied nations as well. The Sherman appears in many Panzer Grenadier games (more of them than you’d think, thanks to all of those Allied Shermans).

But are those Shermans studly enough? Designer Brian Knipple gave them an armor rating of “3” in Battle of the Bulge, the first game in which they appeared. They remained so rated in Desert Rats, their next appearance (this time in British colors) and it’s been that way ever since. Should they have had armor of “4”? Some fans thought so from the beginning, but we have stuck with “3.”

Our “Belton’s Bane” variant gives you two dozen Sherman tank platoons of various types (M4 Shermans, M4/76 and M4/105) and service (Army, Marines). While the Sherman had a bewildering number of sub-types, most of the differences aren’t enough to show up in game terms and we’ve always kept the naming conventions simple.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Bushido: Minimoto Clan Starter Set
description:
The Minimoto clan are as stoic and unyielding as the Iron Mountains they call home. Unparalleled masters of metal craft and the arts of metallurgy and mining. The great mountain not only provides the clan’s wealth but also its protection. This great clan, whose loyalty was once unquestioned by the Takashis, has grown distant of late. Rumours spread of the Old Bear rousing from too many long winters, slumbering in his mountain halls, and he is hungry. So long on the fringes of the ‘civilised’ world have left the Bear clan without the need or taste for the frivolities of court, ‘The Bear does not dance’, but it does fight, and would that be against the shadows, Dragon, Eagle or Snake it pays no mind, for with Tetsubo in hand there are few that can oppose its fury.

Blister contains five models, five 30mm bases, five full colour profile cards, one enhancement card and one theme card.

name: Wargame The War of the Spanish Succession: Paper Soldiers for Marlborough's Campaigns in Flanders
description:
In this series, renowned historical illustrator, Peter Dennis breathes life into the 19th Century paper soldier and invites the reader to re-fight the wars that surged across Europe as Louis XIV fought to establish French dominance over its neighbours. Refight the colour and spectacle of the Wars of Spanish Succession with French, British and Allied infantry, cavalry and artillery.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.

name: EverWyrd Fantasy Gaming
description:
EverWyrd is a Dungeon crawling adventure roleplaying game where you become the hero(es) in a constantly changing world. Using map cards randomly drawn from the deck, you and your friends will create worlds of adventure, peril, and battle; more importantly, you will collect and horde wonderous treasures while questing your way across the land and towards legendary status.

The 2020 update will include all-new, original artwork, different playable races, new cards, and an entirely new format. We will also have all creatures and example heroes as 2D print & play miniatures.

The world of EverWyrd had its origins with the Elves and Dwarves who forged a balance of work and life that allowed them to live in peace and harmony. The elves took the surface domains of Ral and Friijlant, while the dwarves toiled in the caverns and tunnels beneath Ashland Heights and Eryn. In order to survive, both learned the ways of the other, but only as a means to provide for each other. Thus, for thousands of years did they live in peace together; dwarves forging weapons and minting precious metals, the elves hunting, farming, and encouraging life to sustain and prosper above.
All this would change with men. Seeking a better life - an easier life perhaps - man moved north, across the marshes from the land of Ibros, to live amongst the elves and dwarves. Both peoples were curious about men. Those creatures were notoriously greedy and often cruel to one another. Could they learn to live in peace as the elves and dwarves had done?
۝ ۝ ۝
Each side believing in their cause, each side using powerful magic that would corrupt the lands in which they fought. Their wars would drive the elves from the land of EverWyrd, with the exception of a small band who would become the Sidhe, the last of the elves born with magical abilities and skill to them. The Sidhe built a stronghold in Calus, deep in the forest at the base of great mountains and shunned the human race.
The dwarves, who had made their home in the tunnels and caves underground found their homes collapsing from the heaving of the corruptions of magic. They tried in vain to fight against the power of the Warlocks, but they could not resist them. In the end, the dwarves died out or found safety in the more remote lands of EverWyrd, fearing their numbers would never recoup their loss. The dwarves, like the elves, would never be inclined to share with the human race again. From their icy tunnels in the Frigid Peaks, the dwarves watched man destroy itself.
As the armies of men clashed, great warriors, powerful magic-users, and assassins from the shadow rose and fell in great numbers. Such it was that the humans destroyed themselves. Those who fought were killed however possible, and those who did not die ceased to fight. After years of carnage, so few were left that they finally agreed to end their battles. Practicing the dark power of NecoMagia was outlawed, save for a select few who studied relentlessly and proved their value to the councils. Wyrd, being the purest form of magic became revered and the power behind the thrones of EverWyrd would forevermore be that of the powerful witches and wizards that thrived.
None recognized the damage they had done to the world itself. The tunnels and underground caves, the murky underworld of EverWyrd, had been forever transformed. Creatures that had never before existed now thrived in the corrupted magic left behind by the great war, and they became a threat to the people and other races that now sought to live their life on the surface of EverWyrd.
۝ ۝ ۝
Thus, does your story take place, a thousand years after that first group of men reached for a better life, only to find their future generations destroying everything they believed in. As man stretched its wings to discover the art of magic and use magic, so too did they actively destroy their own world. What lies beneath the ground for which thousands walk? Are you brave enough to find out? What other things might you learn if you delve into the reasons behind the thrones of EverWyrd? What magic, power, and riches might you discover if you’re brave enough to dare?

name: Noggin Workshop Picture Problems
description:
Noggin Workshop Picture Problems card game makes brain training fun! Train your brain with this visually intriguing assortment of pattern recognition, geometrical, and mathematical riddles. It's not what you know, it's how you think!

Noggin Workshop is Outset Media’s brand of card games dedicated to making your brain broil and bubble! These mind teaser card brain games challenge you with logic puzzles, word puzzles, geometry riddles to sequence puzzles! The card brain games promote logic, lateral thinking, visualization and other mental exercises that your brain may not use on a regular basis. Limber up, it’s thinking time!

What you see may not be what you get!

—description from the publisher

name: Guild Ball: The Union – Faithful of Solthecius
description: This expansion set to Guild Ball includes a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Seasoned Brisket, Pride, Grace, Benediction, Mist, and Harry ‘The Hat’.

name: Dust 1947: Lilith's Coven
description:
Something dark has happened in the sands of Babylon... An event that will forever change the World of Dust. The Cultists of the Mythos Gods and their twisted allies have emerged from the shadows. They have come back into this ancient place, where their forefathers prayed to forbidden idols when this land was young. Lilith's coven is now unleashed on this World at War and it won't bring it any peace.

Lilith's Coven includes the following units:

Lilith, Maiden of the Cult (one Hero with one Unit Card for the Mythos Bloc)
Possessed Lilith, Transfigured Maiden of the Cult (one Hero with one Unit Card for the Mythos Bloc )
Cultist Fire Squad (5 miniatures with one Unit Card for the Mythos Bloc)
Mi-Go Assault Squad (3 miniatures on flying base with one Unit Card for the Mythos Bloc)


Everything you need to start a new glorious Mythos Army is included in this box! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Leaders of Euphoria: Mining Cart
description:
A promo card from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter campaign.

Action: Choose a player. Take all of that player's Artifacts.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: The Swamp Fox
description:
The Swamp Fox is a supplement for Sharp Practice which presents twelve scenarios and nine unique campaign backgrounds for the career of Francis Marion, one of the rebellion’s greatest and most celebrated leaders.

Ideal for Sharp Practice, Marion led his small band of men through the swamps of South Carolina, emerging to strike against Crown forces and slipping away when threatened by unfavourable odds. This supplement contains twelve varied scenarios based on historical actions and provides a complete Georgetown campaign system which can see multiple campaigns being run. A minimum of five campaigns will combine to create a complete narrative of Marion’s exploits in South Carolina in 1780 and 1781. The supplement contains an historical backdrop to appraise the reader of the situation in the South and Marion’s role. It provides complete Army Rosters and support list options to allow you to run the campaigns provided or to create your own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Thrifty Collector
description:
As a thrifty collector you hunt for collectible items, searching second hand stores, yard sales, flea markets, auctions, and other online sources. How successful are your thrifting skills? Increase your rank by finding, trading, and selling valuable collections. The greater the collection, the greater your reward.

The Thrifty Collector is a set collection card game for one player, ages eight and up. Approximate playing time is 15-20 Minutes.

Rules are only two pages long!

Available as Print and Play in the files section.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection

name: Confront
description:
Confront is a medieval fantasy board game where players control their armies and using strategy to move and destroy their opponent’s units they strive to ultimately claim the artefact of immortality for their own.
The player is declared winner if one of their units stays in the winning zone (central square of the board) without getting damaged for three turns, or by eliminating all opponent units.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: August Storm: the Soviet-Japanese War, 1945
description:
August Storm a game for two or more players that simulate the campaign of 1945 in Manchuria, Sakhalin and the Kuril Islands, with the possibility of extending operations to Hokkaido.

The 16th Soviet Army, after invading the southern half of Sakhalin Island, had orders to be prepared, within 10 to 14 days, to invade Hokkaido. This game follows the theory proposed by Japanese historian Tsuyoshi Hasegawa, who wrote that it was the Soviet declaration of war, and not the atomic bomb, what finally led the Japanese to surrender. August Storm plays with the what-if possibility that the Japanese government delayed for a few weeks the decision to surrender because the military believed that they could successfully defend the Kuril and Hokkaido with the resources at hand, and because the Soviets lacked the experience and equipment needed for launching such a complex operation as an amphibious landing. In fact, the dismal performance of the Soviet amphibious attack against Shumshu Island seemed to confirm the idea that they could resist a Soviet amphibious invasion.

Command Magazine Japan #142 in August 2018.

name: TKG ARENA: Dawn of the Edifices
description: The Elemental Kings grant their generals the power to unleash unearthly constructs known as the edifices. These ancient glyph-like manifestations influence the course of battle in unique ways but only those who are able to weave their deadly capabilities into one’s existing combat schema and strategies will truly open up new roads of victory. Will you be able to build your way to greater glory?
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Power Surge: Cyber Security Academy – The Card Game
description:
In Power Surge: Cyber Security Academy - The Card Game you play a cadet of the Cyber Security Academy, learning to fight criminal minds lurking on the web.
For this, you will play Power cards, that can be used in multiple ways, either for their attack value or for their individual special powers.
3 individual nemesis are offered in this print and play - easy Practice Doll, medium difficulty Gate Defender and very difficult Dark Star. Each nemesis requires different strategy to be defeated.

Game offer two modes - solo mode with 28 cards in draw deck (including card selection mini game) or 2 player cooperative mode with all 56 cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Amerika: Bring in the Heavies
description:
The following rules will help you incorporate these new units into your “AMERIKA” game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

Through the course of any war, despite its destruction, there is also inevitable innovation. WW2 saw more technological advancement in weaponry than any other war throughout history. The units in this expansion provide the means to bring those advancements to the front lines of Amerika.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Ein Grosse Ratte – The P.1000 Ratte In Amerika
description:
