The following rules will help you incorporate this new unit into your AMERIKA game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

It is widely known that Adolf Hitler was a huge proponent of Wonder Weapons and felt they would win the War for Nazi Germany. And while we can see his “bigger is better” philosophy come through in such designs as the Maus tanks and Amerika bombers, it is a far lesser known fact just how large his aspirations were when it came to super-sized weaponry. Weighing in at 1,000 tons, this behemoth was designed to be a mobile platform for a pair of naval cannons accompanied by a super-heavy anti-tank gun as a secondary weapon, complete with Flak guns for its own air defense.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: I-400 Sentoku
description:
Designed to carry attack aircraft in secret across the Pacific Ocean, the I-400 class was the only operational submarine carrier in the world. Each could carry (3) M6A1 Seiran bombers and still hunt for prey after launch. Built in production quantities during the fall of the U.S. Pacific fleets, these will terrorize the West Coast like never before in Amerika.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Projekt Ursel Type XXI U-boat
description:
A feat of German engineering, the Type XXI had improved speed and large capacity batteries, allowing it to travel farther and longer without the need to surface. These characteristics made it the perfect platform for Projekt Ursel, a plan to add rockets to the sub and included a guidance system for targeting. With tested accuracy after the Atlantic Campaign, these will terrorize the East Coast like never before in Amerika.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Magnus Rex
description:
Magnus Rex ("Great King") is a classic 4X civilization builder with aspects of map-building, resource management, and deck building. Use the resources at your disposal to achieve a victory in Science, Culture, Economics, or Conquest!

Magnus Rex is played through 4 technological ages -- Ancient, Medieval, Industrial and Modern. Endgame strategy will dictate the tempo of the game and how far into the ages the game progresses. The Ancient era is one of exploration and resource exploitation. Medieval era features a technological Renaissance and the expansion of trade. The late-game Industrial and Modern eras offer powerful endgame powers gained through negotiation, espionage, and World Wonders.

If you are nostalgic for a boardgame with that 'One More Turn' feeling from PC-era Civilization, this is the game for you!

—description from the designer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d4l_yKy0pQk
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: The Basic Game
description:
A Game of Knights and Knaves is a set of miniatures wargames rules covering medieval warfare and medievalesque fantasy.

The basic rules mechanics will be familiar to players of the DBX family of games: figures are grouped onto stands of uniform width classed into a number of generic types (heavy infantry, light cavalry, knights, etc) and combat is resolved stand by stand, each rolling a die, adding a combat factor depending in its type and opposition, and comparing to the opponent's. Each turn a player rolls a die to see how many command points he has to move his troops with, any within range of enemy then fighting automatically.

name: Dark Death
description:
China circa 168 CE

Chinese traditional medicine is the oldest continuous medical system in the world. When the Angel of Death spread a devastating plague along the Silk Roads into China the physicians must work together to eliminate the disease or die themselves.

One player is the Angel of Death placing disease disks on the intersections on a 8 x 8 squared board. As he spreads disease the rest of the players move the physicians and battle to contain it and even destroy it completely.

Players take turns to move any physician diagonally except the one moved on the last turn. Move next to the disease to eliminate it, but with another physician close by to protect you. If you are not prepared to sacrifice some of the physicians lives, you cannot eliminate much of the disease. If the physician jumps over a disease, it is eliminated from the board and the game. Physicians may continue jumping as long as
they can eliminate disease.

The Angel of Death places more disease at the end of each physician player’s turn. A physician, surrounded by diseases, four in the middle of the board, two on the side of the board, or one in a corner, is killed and removed from the game.

The game is over when either:

• When there is no disease left to place.
• All the physicians have been killed.
• There is no disease on the board.

Total the numbers on the physicians, that is their score. The total number of disease on the board is the Angel of Death’s score. The side with the highest score wins the game.

Dark Death is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement

name: BATTALIA NCBC: Armamentum
description:
Highly Effective city walls defense weapons. A must have in some situations, especially when playing with the rampaging Rammoth Deleo-arx. Increases the security of your city against random NPC attacks and could be used in player vs. player interactions in different scenarios.


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basic competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replayability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Urban Insanity
description:
Urban Insanity is the game where the board changes every time you play.

128 game-play variations are available, from endless destruction to mind-bending strategy... and all with the same basic rules!

Work together to complete a city map... until it's time to score points! Compete to complete city blocks, streets, suburbs, and stadiums. Dial up the madness with one or more of the 6 expansion packs. Create a mobster turf war, an alien invasion, light your city on fire, and much more.

Each turn consists of drawing an action card and playing a tile. In a single round everything can change!

This fast-paced game combines strategy, luck, and something something something.

We debuted in the game room at DragonCon 2018, and were an instant hit!

We've created a couple videos for your enjoyment, so take a moment to see what we've cooked up!

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Red Skies: Junkers JU-52 – German Transport Aircraft
description:
The venerable 'Tante Ju' (Auntie Ju) was slow and outdated at the beginning of WWII but it soldiered on as the Luftwaffe's most ubiquitous transport plane throughout the war.

The JU-52 was reliable and could carry a wide variety of loads, from much-needed equipment to the elite airborne troops - the Fallshirmjager!

Contains:

3 x Junkers JU-52 German Transport Aircraft
3 x Decal sheet
3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
1 x Aircraft Card
1 x Assembly instruction leaflet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Midnight Legion: Portal of Life
description:
Portal of Life is the final gamebook in the Midnight Legion trilogy. However, it can be played as a stand alone or following book 2, The World Reborn, and book 1, Operation Deep Sleep.

The Midnight Legion: Portal of Life is an interactive story where you decide what happens next. Solve puzzles, recover lost memories, and utilize combat, stealth, or sixth sense and diplomacy. It is a highly advanced, color illustrated gamebook with control over your character and world. An interactive story is combined with combat, strategy, puzzles, diplomacy, stealth and role playing elements. Collect information, knowledge, and goods from the world around you to advance your character.

The world that has replaced it is alien and savage, but filled with wondrous new life. In the last remaining Midnight Legion base a computer controls technology that can destroy it or help it to thrive. If you’re strong enough you can defeat the agent who betrayed your mission. If you’re clever and skilled enough you can solve the base’s puzzles and outwit its traps. But even then you will still need to confront the sentient, possibly deranged computer itself. What it can tell you depends on how much you are willing to sacrifice to regain the memories you have lost.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 3 World War 2 Era
description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical (LnLT) Compendium Volume 3. This is not so much something brand new as running into an old friend you have not seen in a while and remember all the great times you had. LnLT has come a long way from its initial release and the Battle Packs.

LnLT Compendium Vol. 3 is the joining of two previously released products titled Battle Pack Alpha, Battle Pack Bravo with a few new scenarios. We have cleaned up the scenarios, redesigned and updated the maps and put everything into our new LnLT series style.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Flames of War: Fighting First – US Forces in North Africa 1942-43
description: Fighting First covers the US forces in North Africa throughout Tunisian Campaign, from the initial landings in Operation Torch, through their painful baptism of fire at Kasserine Pass, their redemption in the Battle of El Guettar and the eventual triumph with the final defeat of the Axis with the capture of Tunis.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: 2 out of 3 ain't bad
description:
An n-in-a-row game using 'spicy dice' (6 sided dice that each have a different face colored red). Players take turns rolling 1 or more or their unused dice and placing them onto the board. When all 12 dice are down, the 10 scoring lines are evaluated (each containing 3 dice slots). If a scoring row has 2 or more dice that are identical (even if they are owned by different players), then it will award 1 point to the person who has 2 or more dice of their color in that row. Some other scoring patterns and displacement rules apply in special cases.

—user summary

name: Microcosmos
description:
In Microcosmos you represent a bacterial species, to thrive and win you need to grow and multiply, acquire unique characteristics of eukaryotic cells as the cell nucleus, improve your metabolism and evolve as many organelles as possible before the nutrients and environment's available resources are depleted.

The player that controls the bacterial species that has managed to accumulate the highest score according to their performance and number of evolutions achieved will be the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Expansion #15 – Israel #2
description:
The Israel #2 expansion adds Israel national forces to the game. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


10 Player Soldiers
7 Non-Player Soldiers
8 Squad Soldiers
23 Weapons
1 Equipment
1 Skill
2 Events
4 Locations


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Warfighter: Expansion #27 – Poland
description:
The Poland expansion gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Poland. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


10 Player Soldiers
7 Non-Player Soldiers
8 Squad Soldiers
21 Weapons
5 Equipment
5 Skills


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Teeky-Tiki
description:
The Annual Teeky-Tiki Festival has begun!

Each year, the natives of Teeky-Tiki get together for an awesome celebration, filled with feats of bravery, trickery, and tribute. Seven days of excitement and intrigue end with the crowning of the new Big Chief of Teeky-Tiki, an honor like no other, given to the Chief that has amassed the most Influence over the course of the Festival!

Mysterious Visions and crazy Events await as you compete in dangerous Jungle Quests, recruit new allies, and build glorious Tikis. But beware other sneaky Chiefs and the ever-lurking Wild Boar trying to stop you!

Will you be crowned the next Big Chief of Teeky-Tiki?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Debacle:  Dutch East Indies and Malaya 1941-42
description:
Abstracted land, sea, and air game. 9-day turns, so a normal 8Dec41-6Mar42game is 10 turns, although the game can be shortened by an even earlier Japanese victory or lengthened by a stubborn, crafty Allied/ABDA defense.

Individual battleships and carriers, otherwise usually 2-cruiser, 4-destroyer and 6-transport divisions, air squadrons, and regiment or brigade size land units. As in Desert Campaign for tanks, air-to-air combat determined by aircraft type matrix - not factors. Also, a simple but elegant ground combat system enabling the attacker to risk greater losses to win.

Unknown Dutch secret airfields and secondary Dutch ground unit strengths aid solitaire playability. Concealed (until contacted/exposed) and dummy units for deception and bluffing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Memory, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Pictionary Frame Game
description:
The beloved game of quick sketches and hilarious guesses now features three innovative, new ways to play! Mirror, Mirror: trace on one side of the window while your teammate follows along with a marker on the other side; Action: pull your clue, then use the window to act it out; Classic: the Pictionary game you know and love. It also features a large group display, stand, timer, and pen. With 750 clues, the guesses can be just as hilarious as the sketches! For 3 or more players. Ages 8 and older.

A whole new way to play Pictionary
3 ways to play: Action, Mirror Mirror and Classic
Trace along with your teammate or act out your clue
Or play a game of Classic Pictionary
Includes frame display, stand, timer, pen and cards with 750 clues
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Kedai Kopi
description:
Who is the best barista in this coffee shop?

Prepare yourself! Manage your workers in Kedai Kopi and use the best strategy to serve customers. Be the fastest and best barista in Manikmaya's coffee shop!

—description from the publisher

name: Ibnu Batutah
description:
Nine centuries ago, there was a young man called Ibn Batutah. He left his homeland to explore the world. After walking the scorching desert, he crossed the sea, then passed through the coldness of the snow. Here's a great adventure throughout history! His great journey was written in a note entitled "Rihla".

A few centuries later, you and your friends discovered Ibn Batutah's journey. Inspired by "Rihla", you decided to trace Ibn Batutah's adventure, and the journey has just begun.

The Ibnu Batutah board game was based on "Rihla" and another journey notes from Ibn Batutah.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Raus aus dem Verlies!
description:
Enter the dungeon and leave it as first with the most loot. But sadly it isn’t that easy. While building the dungeon card by card, you need to fight against monsters and pass some silly traps.
Raus aus dem Verlies! is an easy card game for the whole family.

name: Profanity: A Card Game For Smutty People
description:
Profanity is a card game for smutty people. If you enjoy reading some of the really messed up stuff on Urban Dictionary, this is the game for you...

That's because you're going to be creating your own deeply disturbing phrases and giving everyone a glimpse inside that warped mind of yours.

How To Play

The smuttiest person begins the game as the Judge. The Judge chooses a starting word and places it face up in the middle of the table.

Players now choose one card from their hand to pair with the Judge's card.

You may combine your card with the Judge's in any order you wish. For example, if the Judge's card was Swallow, the card 'Dutch' could be used to make the phrase 'Dutch Swallow' or 'Swallow Dutch'.

Once a player has announced what their chosen phrase is, they may provide their own twisted definition.

Profanity is as dirty as you decide to make it, however due to the adult nature of the content, we recommend that Profanity is played by guys and girls who are 17+ years of age.

—description from the publisher

name: Rally Point Volume 15: Special Study I of the Korean War
description: Ten scenarios from the Tampa ASL Group to be used with ASL module 15 Forgotten War: Korea 1950-53
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Wargame

name: Death Ride Kursk: XLVIII Enhancement
description:
The XLVIII PzK Enhancement package builds on the detail of the game system. Those who own the original games will recognize some of the counters in this package as those from the Maintenance, Logistics, and Air Enhancements. They have been bundled together similar to the ones from the IISS PzK Enhancement package.

Each game now includes the Command and Control and Fire Support Enhancements which mean you don’t need to buy this package in order to have detailed command and fire support operations if you want them.

The specific elements for Maintenance include the chart and track which determine at what level and how long it takes to repair a vehicular unit, and vehicle recovery units which are used to drag the wrecks back to where they need to be in order to have maintenance performed.
As for Logistics there are supply convoys and supply points. This enhancement is only necessary for those wanting a more detailed picture of how long an organization can last without proper supply. If you’re not playing a game that lasts more than 3 battle days it is not going to manifest its importance.
And lastly the Air enhancement that is likely the most enjoyable aspect of the package. It allows you to explore the air campaign in a completely different light. If you have a team you can make an air commander and that job alone will be lots of fun.

XLVIII Enhancement comes with (in Full Color):

Air Operations Charts
Logistics Charts
Maintenance Charts
600 Unit Counters and Markers


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Matching Adventures: The Werewolf's Treasure
description:
You are a treasure hunter and you enter the deep forests that surround a small town. You hear about the legend of the pure gold coins that are hidden there. According to villagers, these are guarded by a creature of the night, a big werewolf. You should look for coins and be alert for threats, get objects to advance in the search and hopefully catch the werewolf ... If he does not catch you first.

About the game:
It is a card game in the style of "Memory Game" for 1 to 4 players.
The main objective is to find the 6 Gold coins that will be hidden among the game's deck.
Along the same we will be stalked by the Werewolf, the protector of the coins that will try to eliminate you, to avoid it we must find 4 objects: Wolf Trap, Rope, Shotgun and Cartridges.

Game play:
Four cards are placed in a row and face down, one after another in 3 columns, thus completing some 12 cards (4x3). For each turn, the player must turn (reveal) 2 cards from among these 12. If the 2 cards we reveal are not from the same object, we place these cards face down in the same place. Otherwise, if these 2 cards are of the same object, we can obtain one of those cards and the other is placed in the discard deck; that is, we now have that object in our inventory to use. Once this situation has happened, we must replace the two cards that we took from the playing field (the 12 cards) with another 2 cards that we are going to draw from the game deck; there always have to be 12 cards on the table. Once the turn is over, we repeat revealing another 2 cards and so on until we get all the coins or be eliminated by the wolves. When we reveal 1 coin, it becomes part of our inventory and we start a new shift, that is, it is not necessary to reveal 2 coins to obtain it. In the same way we must replace 1 card to take its place in the field of play.

—description from the publisher

name: For Treasures!
description:
Several brave heroes go down into the dungeon to fight monsters and collect the treasure... Familiar plot, isn’t it? ‘Gosh!’ you might say,’One more Dungeon Crawler!’ But halt! This game will surprise you!

To begin with, the unique system of laying out the dungeon’s tiles will let you not only to pave the way towards the desired crystal, but also to affect your opponents’ movements.

The monsters do not come out of nowhere. You control them and you can unleash them onto other players or you can fight the monsters yourself to level-up your skills.

Here treasure chests are hiding at every turn and series of event that you encounter won’t make you feel bored!
Hurry up and choose a hero to go down to the dungeon and be the first to retrieve the precious crystal!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Mirror Universe Faction Pack: The Kelvin Timeline
description: The Mirror Universe Faction Pack: The Kelvin Timeline is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Mirror Universe faction: two Kelvin timeline Constitution class ships, and and two Kelvin timeline Klingon warbirds. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 28 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Throw Down Seven
description:
A polyhedral dice game for one or more players.

A "press your luck" game where players start with a standard set of seven polyhedral dice then roll repeatedly, setting one aside after each roll in an attempt to achieve a low score.

Dice are eligible to be set aside, or "thrown down", based on rules involving the value rolled and the maximum face value on that die.

The game includes a fantasy story that correlates the different dice to different evil creatures such as ogres, trolls and necromancers.

—description from the publisher

name: The Judge in Circuit: A game for the law-abiding?
description:
“When crooks (= criminals) get together for a pint at their local boozer (= public house), there is nothing they like better than to boast about all the porridge (= prison sentences) they have done. And the more prisons they can boast about, the better!” N. S. Fletcher

The Judge in Circuit lets you do this, too! In this board game, each person plays a Crook. The object of the game is to be the first Crook to get into a specified number of Prisons. But it’s not as easy as you might think! To get into Prison, you have to get arrested by a Policeman and then sentenced by a Judge. To get arrested, be on a Crime Square at the same time as a Policeman. When arrested, you will be sent to THE CELLS, ready for trial by the next Judge who comes round the Circuit.

If you are found Guilty, you will generally be sent to Prison. But which one you’re sent to depends on the Crime and the Judge who tries you. You stay in Prison until you have served your sentence and get to Released! or Remission, or you escape, or are let out because of something another player does. Sometimes, of course, you are found Not Guilty, or are put on Probation, or sent for Re-Trial (probably by a different Judge).

Actions by other players can upset your careful plans, though. And then, of course, there are the Luck cards!

—description from the publisher

THIS IS THE LAST GAME EVER PUBLISHED BY FRANCIS TRESHAM. IT IS COMPLETELY UNLIKE ANY OF HIS OTHER GAMES.

name: SUMMONED: The Devil Inside Edition
description:
SUMMONED "The Devil Inside" is a horror-based party card game that contains a full backstory that puts the players into the game themselves.

SUMMONED “the Devil Inside”, is the first of many planned extensions Attack from Marrs Games has for this game. They plan on doing future extensions. The extensions will have their own Spirit, ghost, zombie, etc. With their own separate back-stories. SUMMONED is a party card game that contains a full back-story that puts the players into the game themselves. All players will start with a set of Curse Cards that players will use throughout the whole game. These cards contain Dares that the “Victims” (non-active players) can choose to complete or pass on. Each Curse Card is worth a point, so the Victims choices of taking and successfully completing a card will effect if the Victim earns or losses points. Players will take turns being a Demon, which is the active player of the game. Victims are the inactive players that are vulnerable to the Demon. Who can give one Victim Player a Curse Card at any moment. SUMMONED also features a Curse Ability Extension deck. Curse Ability Cards are “Special Cards”; these cards are worth ½ point. Curse Ability Cards have benefits on them, which will help the Demon or Victim player. But these cards will be bad news for the apposing player. SUMMONED pulls together different types of game play, that creates a party card game that everyone will have a blast playing. Player can play this game sitting down, while you are out and about or as a live action RPG.

How can you play this game as a live action RPG? Well-SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” provides characters. The Demon and Victims, who will take turns turning each other into Demons by giving them a Curse. This Curse has a back-story. That starts out with a drunken friend who decided to wander off into a friend’s house. They find an Ouija board with etched words written on it. While they try to read these words they accidentally summons a Devil. The Devil was not a fan of being awoken, so he gave the drunken friend a curse that starts turning them into a Demon. To make things worse the only way to get rid of this curse is to get another person to perform actions from cards. Those were provided to the friend by the Devil himself. Players are able to bring their Demon characters to life while they are the active player. Being the active player you will use your Cards to pick off your Victims one by one. Trying to reduce the number of cards they have in their hand. Victim players in turn, will try their best to successfully complete these actions on the cards. Earning them more points.

SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” is for ages 21+, with approximately 60-90 mins of game play. Players can choose to continue their game for longer if wanted. SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” has Curse Cards with a rule book containing; the story, rules and game play instructions. SUMMONED “The Devil Inside” has one extension pack (so far) that will be available, containing Curse Ability Cards.

name: Peanut Club: De une face & Plans d'une Station de Combat
description:
Two promo cards (packaged together) given out during conventions.

Un De a une face : give 1 yellow / 1 black / 1 white

Les plans d'une station de combat : give 1 brown / 1 blue / 1 purple
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Troll Inn
description:
You are a troll server. And as each and every average troll server, you must do your best to satisfy clients, and hope to earn generous tips, or even profit from some particular favors. Because your clients are strange people.... I mean, are they actually people? Anyway, choose your client wisely, and serve it at the good speed, to not be doubled, or worse, have your plate spilled out on the floor. Whatever, a warthog nicknamed the Troll waits to guzzle all unclaimed dishes, and he's doing it so well that the inn is called after him: welcome to Troll Inn!

Each turn, you serve a client, trying to gain the best tips, make their values evolve, and take benefits of their favors. At the end of a turn, the Troll tosses out some remnants, most of the time on the clients, making them leave the inn. Once only 3 clients or less remain in the tavern, doors close and it's time to count your pay. The richest server wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: 素数大富豪 (Prime Daifugo)
description:
User summary
素数大富豪 (Sosuu Daifugo) (Prime Daifugo) is a climbing card game which uses a standard deck of playing cards. Players take turns raising the number by playing a prime number with cards in their hand.

This game uses 54 standard playing cards with two jokers included. Suit doesn't matter in this game. Shuffle the deck and deal 11 cards to each player.

The leader plays any prime number (see below). Then in clockwise order, players may play greater prime numbers with the same number of cards as the leader. The round continues until no player wants to play. The last player who played a valid number leads the next round.

To play a prime number, take a certain number (or any number if you are the leader) of cards from your hand and arrange their order to indicate a number. If the number is prime, your play is valid. Consider Ace as 1, and 10, J, Q, and K as two-digit numbers (10, 11, 12, and 13 respectively). For example, you may play 3 and J in two ways, 311 and 113 (both are prime numbers), but you may play 3 and 5 as 53 only, because 35 is not a prime number. There's a penalty when you play an invalid (non-prime) number.

You win the game when you get rid of all cards from your hand.

大富豪と素数の素敵な出会い！
普通の大富豪とは一味違ったゲームです。
トランプで遊べるので気軽に楽しんでみてください。

【ルール概要】
各プレイヤー11枚のカードが配られた状態でゲームが始まります。
大富豪と同じように、プレイヤーがカードをプレイする時、親が出した枚数と同じ枚数で、かつ前のプレイヤーが出した数字よりも大きい数字をプレイする必要があります。手札を全て出し切ったプレイヤーが勝利です。
通常の大富豪と違う点、それは「プレイするカードが素数でなくてはならない」ということです。
複数枚のカードをプレイする場合はその数字を並べたものが、プレイした数字となります。例えば 3 と 7 をプレイすると決めた場合。
1枚目を3、2枚目を5とすれば「35」になり
1枚目を5、2枚目を3とすれば「53」になります。
この場合35は素数ではないので、53としてプレイすることになります。

その他細かいルールもあるので詳しくは説明書を見てください。
（2018年10月現在、英語版の説明書は作成中です）

name: Dread City
description:
​Dread City​ is a strategy game for 2-4 players in which players take on the roles of monsters terrorizing a 19th Century New England city.

The base set contains 3 completely different games (Werecat game, Vampire game, Great Old Ones game) that combine seamlessly to make a 4th game that includes all 3 monster types!

Werecats eat citizens to increase their strength, and can convert useful citizens into their werecat minions.
They score points for eating a lot of people and having a powerful cat army.

Vampires charm citizens into their herd so that they can periodically drink their blood. Vampires can also convert members of their herd into vampire minions. Vampires score points for building a powerful vampire army (preferably all from the same family) and having an ample blood supply.

Great Old Ones use dreams to lure citizens into their cults. Once citizens become priests, they can lure their family members into their cults, drain the dreams of cultists, or sacrifice themselves to themselves to Great Old Ones. Great Old Ones score points for recruiting priests from all 5 families and having big cults!

Werecat Version : Easiest to learn. Fun and light.
Vampire Version : Trickier than Werecat, but has the deepest strategy of the three versions.
Great Old One Version : Somewhere in between the other 2 versions.
​
Backstory:
It is New England, around the turn of the 20th century. Mysticism and the occult are all the rage among 
the trendy upper crust of society. The countless seances and spiritual meetings awoke something dark and sinister and ancient. Madness and misfortune swept through the city, as those dark and ancient things they woke tightened their grip on the city.

The local people, in their wisdom, blamed the madness on toxoplasmosis from cat poop. All cats were banished harshly from the city. A few werecats living nearby found out about the terrible mistreatment of their fellow feline friends and have come to the city looking for some payback....and tasty meals!

Vampires who have "lived" unnoticed in the city for nearly 2 centuries have decided that the time is right to take control of their city...before something else does!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Rally Point 12: Schwerpunkt's Greatest Hits II
description:
This scenario pack is a reprint pack of favorite scenarios previously featured in the Schwerpunkt issues Volumes 11-20, with one scenario being selected from each of the Schwerpunkt releases by Evan Sherry. The scenarios have been renumbered with the Rally Point numbering scheme.

All of the scenarios were designed by Evan Sherry.

Scenarios:
RPT111: Malignant Mahrattas
RPT112: The Bozsoki Relay
RPT113: The Legrew Maneuver
RPT114: The Fond Dagot Drag-Out
RPT115: Halfhearted Hiwis
RPT116: The Elefant of Surprise
RPT117: Requiem for a Dreadnaught
RPT118: Mius Mischief
RPT119: Varaosliget Park
RPT120: Galician Persuasion
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Penny Breadful
description:
Our first handmade game is a real wonder. We hand crafted and laser cut cork to cram a 2-6 player game into a tiny pocket sized loaf of bread. Penny Breadful is a reverse bluffing game where players vie to be the last one who survives! Deceive your opponents into eating poisoned slices while you save the safe ones for yourself. Each loaf is separated into 4 chapters that act as player elimination minigames. Game night will never be the same again!
A small-batch reverse bluffing game of survival.
COMING SOON to Kickstarter in 2024.

—description from the publisher

name: Immortal Paths
description:
The Elementals have challenged the greatest heroes in the land to take the Immortal Paths: an ancient challenge of fire, earth and water. Many have tried but few win.

Each Hero must make their way across nine obstacle challenges of Fire, Earth and Water.

Summon bridges of Stone, Wood or Rope bridges to build the longest possible connected paths that create powerful multipliers and gain you the highest score to win.

Watch your challengers - choose your bridge summoning cards wisely. Seek your advantages at every turn! Choose poorly and you will join those who fell in peril.

The highest score will crown the next champion of the Immortal Paths!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Star Supremacy
description:
Star Supremacy is a game in which you take control over one of the galactic powers. By clever use of strategy, resource management and abilities of your faction you will have an opportunity to build an empire whose scale and achievements on the pan-galactic scale will overshadow the adversaries.

Thanks to the modular game board, various abilities of interstellar civilization, random exploration events, with multiple paths to victory, each game of Star Supremacy is different.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Economic, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Snowdonia: Share and Share Alike / 18XX Train
description:
A promo card give away at UKGE and Essen 2018. Double-sided, it includes the Share and Share Alike mini expansion on one side and the 18XX Train on the other.

Share and Share Alike:
Whenever you would place a scoring marker on a station space (either as a result of excavating the last rubble on a rubble space, or by building a building) then instead of doing so you may choose to take any one other player's scoring marker and place that on the space instead.

If you do that then you immediately place one or two of your own scoring markers on that player's Share Portfolio (this card) - if the pint value of the space which you gave them was from 1 to 9 (inclusive) then place one of your scoring markers, and if it was 10 or more then place one OR two scoring markers (it's your choice).

You now have shares in that player's points - you can have as many shares in other players as you wish, but cannot have shares in yourself. When the normal scoring has been calculated at the game's end, for each player in whom you have a share you gain 1 point for every 10 points of their final score for each share that you have in them. Add those points to your total score.

18XX Train:
Whenever a train is built - including this one - then the Train Maintenance Event is triggered (the purchaser of this train gets the steel bar before the event is triggered). At the end of the game the owner of this Train gets 18 points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: KOI: Cool Weather Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for KOI.

This promo is a new weather card. Add it to the weather deck before set-up.

The weather card's name is "Cool" and has the following ability: "Frogs are worth 2 points when eaten today."

This promo was distributed in Game Trade Magazine 225 (Nov. 2018).
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Take That

name: Final Score College Football
description:
Downey's Final Score College Football offers every FCS, FBS, Divison II, Division III, NAIA, CIS and even teams from the NESAC, HAAC, GAC, MAIAA and NSIC are included. The year book also contains a complete schedule for the FBS Division. Downey's Final Score College Football has a unique Strength of Schedule system, as well as a seasonal normalization system so that you can match-up ANY team from ANY season and have realistic results. With Downey's Final Score Football you can truly determine the best college football team of the decade or all time! The match ups are truly endless with Downey's Final Score College Football!

As the name implies, this quick play game provides you with a final score for a College Football game. Allowing you to rapidly play games and watch standings unfold before your eyes. However, there is more to the game than just generating scores. There is plenty of excitement and drama along the way, keeping the game play exciting and compelling. You will have late in the game touchdowns, field goals and fantastic defensive stands.

The Final Score Football line of games differs from our other quick play line, Ultra Quick, as the games all unfold in a quarter-by-quarter manner.

Each team is rated individually for Offense, Defense, Strength of Schedule, and Home Field Advantage. And while there will surely be some surprises along the way, since this is a game, after all, the accuracy of the game will astound you. We also have a normalization system for every team and league we rate, so you can play across seasons to determine the best team of all-time.

—description from the publisher

name: Villages: Cardsmith Pack
description:
The People Have Spoken

Monarchy is so yesterday.
Democracy is the hip new trend.
But building villages never goes out of style!

The cards in this pack were designed by villages fans and chosen by popular vote.
From over 250 submissions

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Planet Eaters Unit Expansion 1
description:
Chompers are simple but effective destroyers that function like mobile mouths, opening wide to eat entire armored vehicles and then channeling the energy of each meal to their greater masters.

Destructomites are insectoid horrors that converge on their targets to obliterate them in a wash of superheated energy. An enemy covered in gnawing Destructomites is easy prey for larger Planet Eaters.

The Explodohawk exists only to fly at its enemies and then unleash an all-consuming blast. Nothing in the vicinity escapes unscathed after it detonates with a spray of metallic chitin like a living grenade.

Contains:

Chomper (3)

Destructomite (1)

Explodohawk (1)

—description from the publisher

name: Complexcity
description:
An anomaly has been detected in Sector 1357! Galaxy-wide destruction is assured and you only have 3 cycles to relocate all of the sector’s inhabitants to an uninhabited planet outside of the range of the cataclysmic event! All of the Ambassadors are urging you, the scientists of the Allied Galactic Command, to ensure that the members of their species are being taken care of according to their special needs.

Can you design the best possible city to meet the diverse needs of the Terramorphs, Neridians, Phylons, and Replicons that will seek refuge on the inhospitable planet? If you do, you’ll be hailed as a saviour by the entire sector!

In Complexcity, you plan your city using tiles that show the habitats of the various alien species. When you form Complexes with these City Tiles by enclosing habitats with Transport Tracks, you can use the aliens’ abilities to further develop your city and even influence the various Ambassadors' Growth Initiatives. At the end of each cycle, you will compare your city to those designed by the neighbors to either side of you and gain Growth Points accordingly. If you have the most Growth at the end of 3 cycles, your plan is used by the AGC to save Sector 1357 and you win the game!

-description from publisher

name: Bad Santa Hex
description:
A Hex variant with a huge luck element!

Like Hex, the objective is to connect opposite edges of a diamond shaped, hexagon-tessellated board with a path that consists of only your counters.

On your turn, you play three of your counters. One of these counters is randomly selected to be transformed into your opponent's colour!

name: Global War 1936-1945: Zombie Apocalypse
description:
OVERVIEW
In this expansion, there are several “zombie” scenarios to suit your style of play.
Scenario 1: Zombie Global Game (Section 2.0)
Players set up for a standard game that starts with a global zombie outbreak. World War II is fought with the added challenge of zombie hordes in several theaters of war.
Scenario 2: Zombie Outbreak (Section 3.0)
Players begin with a standard game but do not know when or if the zombie outbreak will occur. Players pursue victory objectives with the added menace of zombies when randomly introduced.
Scenario 3: Zombie Scheme (Section 4.0)
Schemes are part of several Global War expansions and generate a series of extraordinary changes to the game. In this scheme, a player initiates a scheme to build biological weapons that initiates the zombie outbreak.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: UnderWorld: The Card Game – Dominator
description:
Adds
17 Secret Society Cards unlocking more background stories, settings, and objectives of Secret Society

109 Basic Cards supporting team playing mode to facilitate the cooperation between the players and enhance the complexity and gaming experience.

Dominator Mode which lets players fight against a very powerful warlord in a 4 player game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology, Zombies
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: B.A.R: Bored Astronaut Racing
description:
B.A.R is an abstract race game for 2 to 4 players. In the game, players attempt to move 2 astronauts through a space station with moving rings. Dice are used to represent power modules that enable astronauts to move, station rings to rotate, or enable the power modules to move themselves. However, the dice are not rolled, but are instead manipulated up and down in power. Players must efficiently control the power modules (dice), station rings (paths), and their astronauts to be the first player to move their astronaut pair to the race end points. The game includes several variations on setup and race style for 2, 3, and 4 player counts.

—description from the designer

On The Origins of B.A.R:

Orbiting a distant moon, the 4 occupants of a small space station sit around a table and stare out into the blackness of space.

“This is unbelievably boring!” an astronaut proclaims suddenly. The other 3 astronauts turn to face the speaker, shocked out of their own boredom. “Seriously… is this what we signed up for? Sitting around a table doing absolutely nothing?”

“We should be doing something adventurous,” a second one says.

“We should be doing something… exciting!” the third chimes in.

“We should be doing something dangerous?” the fourth states with raised eyebrows.

The silence returns to the table, then suddenly all four speak at the same time.

“I’ve got an idea!”

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Z War One: Exodus – Dark Tide
description:
The Kickstarter edition of Exodus comes complete with the intense & emotionally charged Dark Tide expansion.

Experience the terror of the initial outbreak from the perspective of two desperate parents, fighting to get their daughter to safety. This prequel campaign introduces new characters, locations & monsters to the Exodus roster.

Dark Tide also includes the 2-4 player "Renegade Mode". Work individually or as a team to collect as many loot cards as possible, use director cards to hinder your opponent's progress. If you are taken down, continue your fight from beyond the grave, using your freshly infected hero to tear apart the opposition.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Beatrix: Mr. McGregor's Garden
description:
A 3-5 player trick taking game designed for small children.

In this game, players receive 3 cards, choose one to keep, one to pass to the player on their left, one to pass to the player on their right, then draw a card. Cards are numbered 1-35. Players only work through this small deck once, receiving a total of 6-8 cards. After the trick taking phase, end game scoring is resolved based on the various vegetables collected from Mr. McGregor's garden.

Players receive a unique character which effects scoring opportunities. Among these, Mr. McGregor, who wants to collect one of each vegetable in his garden and cause the animals to lose their collections of vegetables; Peter Rabbit who prefers carrots and attempts to retrieve his coat from Mr. McGregor's scarecrow; Benjamin Bunny who is likewise attempting to retrieve Peter's coat but prefers onions; Flopsy, Mopsy and Cottontail, (played by 1 player) who try to collect 3 vegetables of any kind; and Timmy Willie and Johnny Townmouse (played by one player), who can trade vegetables with other players and want to lose all of their vegetables to Mr. McGregor. This exciting and chaotic romp through Mr. McGregor's garden also features other original characters created by Beatrix Potter, including Squirrel Nutkin and Old Brown, Mrs. Tiggywinkle, and Jeremy Fisher.

The game also includes a variant for amall children, and a simple 2 player variant.

To play the game, you will need a means to keep score.

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Farming, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: 人外の代理人 (Agent of Evildoers)
description:
Publisher's summary
人外の代理人 (Jingai no Dairinin) Agent of Evildoers is a social deduction game to deal magic stones containing magical powers as the agents of evildoers. The game is comprised of only one round. During each turn, you can only replace magic stones once. The victory conditions vary for each player and only one player wins. Make deductions, suppositions, inductions, and actions, and unexpected results will be awaiting you.

The second edition, released in the same year 2018, had some small changes:
the package changed, a new evildoer card was added, and victory token added. The game was expanded from 3-4 players to 3-5 players and a small rule was changed, but the game remained basically the same.

さまざまな人外種族（Evildoers）の代理人（Agent）になって、魔力を封じた魔導石を取引する正体隠匿系ゲームです。
１ゲームは１ラウンドのみで、１ターンは、魔導石の交換１回のみです。
勝利条件はプレイヤーごとに異なり、勝者は１人です。
推理し、予想し、誘導し、行動し、そして最後には予想外の結果が待っています。
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fantasy, Negotiation, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Fortress Budapest
description: As the Soviet Red Army marches westward, the city of Budapest stands in their way. Encircled and severely outnumbered, the German and Hungarian forces attempt to resist the Soviet juggernaut and defend Festung Budapest to the last. This book brings the siege of Budapest to the table-top with in-depth information on the forces involved, linked scenarios, and new Theatre Selectors that make this an ideal resource for any Bolt Action player with an interest in the the Eastern Front and the fall of the Reich.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaiju Stadium
description:
Kaiju Stadium is a two-player strategy game about giant monsters playing sports. In it, you make use of dice, play cards, and unique kaiju abilities to pull off wild combinations and score points against your opponent.

Each turn, you roll two dice and pick from them to decide what you're going to do with that turn. The dice give you movement options, let you kick the ball, and more, plus you have access to limited-use Play cards that let you do things that aren't on the dice. Beyond that, every kaiju has a pair of unique special abilities: one that modifies how it interacts with the basic rules of the game (e.g. Hyperion can trample through opposing kaiju while moving) and one that happens when they switch onto the field from the sidelines (e.g. Nimbus can steal the ball from a nearby space). You're going to spend each turn making decisions about who to move, who to have on the field, and what to do with your kaiju, trying to solve the ongoing puzzle of "can I score a point this turn or not?"

Get the ball into the opponent's goal to score a point. The game is over when a player can reach three or more points with a two point lead or when either play reaches five points.

Rounds take about 15-30 minutes and the game rarely unfolds the exact same way twice, so the game is meant to be played several times in a row.

name: LFG: Looking for Group
description:
In a world of swords and sorcery, everybody wants to quest for fame and glory! But before you can get to the glamorous part, it's time for some good old-fashioned HR.

In LFG: Looking For Group, you're trying to build an adventuring party by gathering heroes with different aptitudes and convincing them to work together! Or, you could just recruit all the shadiest scoundrels in the land.

LFG is a game of drafting; choosing resources turn by turn. Each round, you will choose one Hero from your hand to join your party. Then, you'll pass your hand to the next player. However, Heroes can use their abilities to mess with rival parties. Using them wisely will make the difference between assembling a winning team, and a dysfunctional mess!

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Dale, Prison Advisor Booster
description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Dale and Scott to your games, along with Walker Rick!.

Contents:


Plastic Dale and Scott moon Miniatures
Plastic Walker Rick Miniature
Dale, Prison Advisor, and Scott Moon Character Cards
Beretta 92, Colt 1911, Meds, and Prosthetic Leg Equipment Cards
Mantic Points
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies

name: 16 Chickens Dice Fight to the Death
description:
When you play 16 Chickens: Dice Fight to the Death, you’ll build a team of up to 16 chickens to help you eliminate your opponents.

You'll experience four fast-paced phases featuring card drafting, team building, dice rolling, and discarding action cards at just the right moment. Each phase incorporates a careful balance of strategy, unexpected decision points, and just enough chance to create a tabletop game experience that’s fun for everyone. You’ll fall in love with the adorable little chickens and become heartbroken when your favorites are tragically sent to the fried chicken carry-out bucket.

But if you and your chickens can endure enough dice fights and outlast your opponents, it’ll be winner winner chicken dinner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: LunaTix: Solar System
description:
This first expansion to LunaTix: Star Trackers adds planet observation and quest tokens such as vehicle upgrades, astronomical items and flags with an astronomical theme. Items and flags require certain observations an they need to be brought back to their location of origin. New hidden agendas are added to combine observations with planets. Solar System brings new ways to enjoy solo games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Space Exploration

name: LunaTix: Lunar Lander
description:
This second expansion of LunaTix: Star Trackers is an anniversary expansion of 2019 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the first Apollo landing. The game expands to actually landing on the Moon depending on your revealed mission. This can even result in an Apollo 8, 10 or 13 mission, which has other missions than landing due to the historic situation. In this game both inclination and altitude are combined with maneuvering and economic fuel usage. A way back to Earth is required to finish the game. The winner in this expansion has the most point, based on efficient maneuvering and a fast return after mission execution. Co-op in teams is encouraged in this expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Space Exploration

name: Wench: Gratitude Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Wench.

The promo card is shuffled in with the other cards before the game begins. Unlike the other cards in the game, the Gratitude promo card does not have a suit or card value.

It has the following rule: "If a player does not say 'You shouldn't have...' when you give them a card, you may also give them this card."

This card was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #226 (Dec. 2018).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Memory

name: ATS To The Volga II: Mamayev Kurgan
description:
MAMAEV KURGAN, STALINGRAD, RUSSIA, 27 September 1942: Acknowledging the damage done to his army in assaulting the southern and central sections of the city, General von Paulus had systematically reconfigured his forces for a fresh assault. Two shock groups were formed, with one consisting primarily of the 100th Jäger Division, whose task was to clear and control Mamaev Kurgan, followed by an advance into the Tennis Racket and the Bannyi Ravine and finally to occupy the Krasnyi Oktiabr workers' settlements. Paulus' counterpart, General Chuikov was well aware of these preparations and had planned appropriate spoiling attacks, though he was unaware of the fresh German reinforcements. His attack was disrupted before it could even begin, with waves of Stukas strafing his advancing forces. His strongpoint on the crest of the burial mound was destroyed. Bombs and artillery cut down the attackers, decimating their ranks and allowing the following German advance to gain ground. The jägers advanced two regiments abreast and captured the western slopes, but initially failed to take the southern slopes. The 227th Jäger Regiment's vigorous assaults, supported by intense artillery, destroyed the Russian ability to hold on. The Germans would secure the summit that evening (though some bypassed remnants would harass the Germans on the southern and western slopes for the next few days). By day's end, the 95th Division retained a foothold on the northern and eastern slopes of the burial mound, but was down to only 400 effective fighting men.

This is the Advanced Tobruk System treatment of this bloody battle which includes a large-hex map on heavy cardstock panels, new overhead (OVR) infantry and light weapons counters and the usual set of scenarios, Battlefield Walkaround document and AFV cards.
Ownership of ATS Rules, playaids, system markers and a "standard" Russian/German sheet of AFV counters are required to make use of this product.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Leida Heim
description:
A card, turn-based strategy game without dice.

In Leida Heim each player take control of a Norse mythology hero. At the end of the game who earned more honor is proclaimed winner.
The game uses an action points system to make heroes move and perform actions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Grid Movement

name: Bite-Me
description:
Bite-Me combines an epic battle of survival between Humans, Vampires, Werewolves, and Zombies with hilarious quirky artwork, cheesy puns, and strategy for the ultimate card game.

Turn other players into Vampires, Zombies, or Werewolves and then kill them. Slay one of each type of Monster and you win! Watch Out, others will be attacking you. Don’t get bitten or you turn into a Monster and start biting others. Plot your strategy to use magical objects, spells, and weapons to battle Monsters, defend yourself, or become human again.

There are six types of cards in the Bite-Me Deck. (Infection, Attack, Protection, Regeneration, Strength, and Movement cards). Many cards are specific to a species (Human, Vampire, Werewolf, Zombie). You can try to turn other players into a monster with an infection card. Use attack cards to try and kill another players. You can protect yourself from an infection or an attack with the right protection card. Turn back to Human or regain a life with right regeneration card. Make yourself stronger or others weaker with Strength cards. Change direction or skip players with Movement cards.

Each player starts the game as a Human. Each player will probably change species several times during a game. When a player attacks another with an attack card, it is a battle to survive. Think of the old card game war. If you are attacked with a level 1 attack card, you can fight back with a higher level attack card. This goes on until a player wins or a protection card is played. If you do not have a higher level attack or protection card, you die and your opponent get credit for killing your type of monster. Strength cards can add +1 to your cards or can lower your opponent’s cards for one turn. The other type of battle in Bite-Me is called an Alpha Battle. This happens each time more than one player becomes the same monster type. IE when a second person is turned into a Vampire. The victor is the Alpha and takes a card from the loser. They both continue with +1 and -1 cards until they turn into another species. Kill each monster type and be human or be the last surviving player and you WIN!

—description from the publisher

name: Hextra
description:
Hextra uses the Double-seven binary-coding hexdominoes by Nestorgames, that includes 36 tiles (with numbers from 0 to 7) composed of two adjacent hexagons. Instead of the standard ‘pips’, this set uses a special concentric binary representation. A central pip equals 1, a small circle equals 2 and a big circle equals 4.

Hextra is an upgrade on Dominoes for 2 to 4 players.

Shuffle the tiles facing down and deal all them evenly among the players. Each player places her tiles standing up before her so the other layers can’t see them (as in Dominoes).

The player with the double seven starts by placing any tile in the middle of the playing surface.

From now on, starting with the second player, players take turns in order placing a tile on the board so that at least one of its values matches an adjacent one already played. The tile can be adjacent to more than one placed tile. Consider the imaginary hexagonal grid as always.

If each of the symbols of the newly placed tile match with adjacent symbols of different tiles, the player gets an extra turn. As a result of this, the player might achieve a chain of extra turns.
Notice that if both symbols of the new tile match with the same symbol of a played tile, no extra turn is awarded.

But if they match different hexagons (even if both symbols are the same) the player gets the extra turn.

The game ends when a player gets rid of all her tiles, thus becoming the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Basket: Gioco di simulazione sportiva
description:
From IDG - Istituto del Giuoco (Italy) and Invicta Games

Simulation for the game of basketball. Created in cooperation with the Italian Basketball League (FIP).

The game tried to reproduce the tactics and the actions of a real basketball game.

It is played on board of 72 rectangular cells, 36 each midfield, regulating the position of the players on the court. There are 4 distinct zones on the board:
1 - Inside
2- close shot
3 - long shot
4 - midfield
In each cell only 1 player of the same team can be placed and in the 'inside' area, only friendly player can be placed, simulating the 3 seconds rule.

Players have 3 attributes, Defence, Attack and Rebound. DF and AF have 4 values, from 1 to 4 growing, RF is from 1 to 10 with the higher the better.

You can play typical defense tactics like in real basketball, and movement of player is asynchronous with the one of the ball.

The game has been developed and published in 1981, so it is obviously feeling the age.

The player are simple cardboard figures on a plastic base, as well as the ball. There are no basket or any other element in 3D apart of the players themselves.

It remarks more on the fidelity to the rules and the game more than the look.

It can be played in 2 players, normally and a game typically lasts from 40 to 60'.

The game is not language dependent for the set, but the rules are only in Italian.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: 信濃国土豪衆 (Shinanokoku Dogoushu)
description:
信濃国土豪衆 (Shinanokoku Dogoushu, "Lords of Shinano") is a card-laying game about exploring mountainous terrain and choosing the right spot to build a castle.

Each turn you may move and add a card to the map. You can move one step across normal terrain, pay two points to move through mountains, or you can move as far as you want along a river for free. When you add a card it has to be on a space next to your pawn and any rivers must line up. You get points equal to the number on the card (1, 2, or 3, with higher point cards being more complicated) for every edge that perfectly matches what you put it against. If no edges match you can still play the card but it's worth negative points equal to its face value. If you can't play a card at all, you have to discard one face down, which is worth triple negative points at the end of the game.

Once during the game you must play a castle. This costs ten points, but at the end of the game you get points for the card under your castle and the four neighboring cards. Castles must be built at least two cards apart, so building in the right place can also deny other players points. When moving, castles and pawns both allow you charge tolls for anyone passing through, which is the best way to get a point advantage over other players.

Explore the countryside, build your castle in the right place, and see if you can become the richest Lord of Shinano.

—user summary

name: The Obsidian Tower: Uprise
description:
While the Obsidian Tower is a fun adventure with solid gameplay and equal odds, this Expansion Pack is designed to provide an additional challenge to the overall gaming experience. This Expansion Pack is not intended to be a standalone game and must be added to the original Obsidian Tower game.

The Obsidian Tower: Downfall not only introduces 2 new characters but also the Witchlord of Agaroth as well!

The expanded gameplay offers new cards, new items, additional plights, and much much more ...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yuzu?
description:
Yuzu? is a game of words, knowing, bluff and a little chance.
It's like the "Scrabbles" had met "6 Takes" !
You play cards with letters to build words.
But if the cards you have in hand doesn't make any valid word, your last solution is to bluff everyone pretending it exists...

name: Solitary Journey
description:
Overview

This played-in-the-hand solitaire game, played with ordinary playing cards, simulates a journey through fields and forests, oceans and mountains. On the way you may meet helpful guides and mischievous fellow-travelers. With some luck you may find enough treasure and magical tools to enable you to find the home of your dreams and live happily ever after.

This game is played entirely in the hand, so there is no need for a table. You can play it anywhere. If you are interrupted, you can put it in your pocket and take it up later.

Set Up

Remove the four Jacks from a deck of playing cards and shuffle the rest of the deck, including the two Jokers. Arrange the Jacks face up in the order Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs, and Spades, with Spades in the back and Hearts in the front. Place the rest of the deck face down on top of the Jacks. The Jacks will act as counters to keep track of how many times you’ve gone through the deck; when they show up, put the first one behind the other three and continue playing. When you reach the Jack of Spades you have gone through the deck four times and have finished the game. The Jacks also hold your items for you.

Interpretation of the cards

The four suits represent four kinds of landscapes. Hearts are oceans, lakes, and rivers. Diamonds are plains, fields, moors, and prairies. Clubs are forests. Spades are mountains.

The values of the cards represent various treasures, tools, items, landscapes, and people. The “view” is the name for the four cards that are fanned face upward in your hand. They are not only the cards you can view, but they also represent the things you can see as you look around you.

Some of the cards represent first a location, and then, under the right circumstances, an item that you find at that location.

Goal

Travel though various landscapes, collecting treasure and magical tools. Eventually use the tools to find the home of your dreams and live happily ever after. If you find your home, you have won the game. But once the Jack of Spades appears, you have finished your journey, whether or not you have met your goal.

Terms

View: the top four cards fanned out face up on top of the deck. In some situations there may be more cards in your view.

Discard: place a card face down at the back of the deck.

Store: place a card face up behind the face-up Jack of the same suit
 
Gameplay

Hold the deck face down in your hand, with the Jacks face up in the back. Turn over the top four cards and fan them so you can see them all. These cards form your current view. If in the course of play your view becomes less than four cards, replace them with cards from the front of the deck.

You may discard any card from the view at any time. At any time you may look to see what cards you have stored behind the Jacks. They will be easy to find because they will be face up together, while the rest of the deck will be face down.

A complete description of the rules will be found in the files section.

—description from the designer

name: Mixed Company
description:
Mixed Company is a conversationally engaging card game.

How to Play:

1) Create Your Question Card Deck
Choose from Question Cards including All Ages, 16+, NSFW, or other expansion packs, to put together a variety of questions for your group.

2) Deal out the cards
Deal out Question Cards, Trophy Cards, Action Cards, Challenge Cards, and Vote Cards to each player.

3) Choose Questions
Each player puts out one of their Question Cards and then uses their Vote Cards to vote for the question they want to talk about.

4) Question Round
Have your conversation! You can choose to use only the top pick from the selected Question Cards or go for three rounds. During the Conversation Phase for each Question Card you’ll play your Action Cards and Challenge Cards. After each Conversation Phase, you’ll award a Trophy Card.

5) Wrap Up
If you need to know who “won”, count up your points and see who got the most points.

Free Print and Play:

name: Cruciverbalist
description:
In Cruciverbalist, each player takes on the role of a freelance crossword puzzle crafter. You have to make the best crossword puzzle in order to have your puzzle get published and for you to get paid!

Cruciverbalist is played over 5 to 7 rounds, depending on the number of players. Each round, players will roll 12 dice. With these dice, you will be able to use the conversion table to pick letters and create words to add to your crossword puzzle. Other players also get actions on your turn! Four of the dice are, "shared," and other players may use these dice to form words to add to their own crossword puzzles. In this way, all players can be engaged during each players turn.

Stymied by your roll? That's ok, you can use a helper token to reroll your dice, but you do lose the helper token and those are worth points at the end of the game!

Cruciverbalist is won by collecting the most points, and points are awarded for larger words, longest chain of letters, and staying within the topic of the crossword puzzle. For example, you could put the word "car" in a crossword about animals, but that will cost you points!

Collect the most points and win the title of Champion Cruciverbalist!

This is a roll and write game that was an entry in the 2017 GenCant roll and write contest and received an honorable mention.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Siege: Clan War
description:
The Scorpion Clan has been dissolved. The Lion Champion has been disgraced. The Emperor lies dying of the plague, and the Great Clans eye the throne with jealous spirits. It is an age of duty, and age of honor, and age of ambition, and an age of war. It is the era of the great Clan War. The Black Scrolls are being opened, and the forces of the Shadowlands have forged an alliance with ancient enemies among the Crab in an attempt to gain entrance into the Empire.
Who will emerge victorious at the most famous battles in history? Who will defend Rokugan, and who will see it fall?

Siege: Clan War takes us back in time to the era of the Great Clan War! The Black Scrolls are being opened and soon Fu Leng shall be released on the Empire. Come together with other players to defeat a dark god. During this time of political treachery and military honor you are called to lead the Siege on the Throne Room and vanquish Fu Leng if your army has the capability to overcome the physical and mental challenges that lay ahead of you.

Features:

Multiplayer format, pitting 3+ players against one.
New way to discover Rokugan and the world of Legend of the Five Rings.
Relive the defining era in the history of the game as part of the celebration of 20 years of L5R.
Fantastic art from fan favorite artists such as Jason Behnke, Sergio Camarena, Charles Urbach, Mario Wibisono and more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Ruthless: Yo Ho Ho Promo Expansion
description:
The promo expansion is intended as a fun seasonal novelty and not necessarily as a regular modification to the game. The Monkey may return in a different form for the expansion.

Monkey (2x): Replaces one Powder Monkey from each player‘s starting deck. The Monkey creates a loop in the pirate ranks. It fits between CPT and 1. Thus a straight CPT-M-1 is now possible. Additionally, the suit of the Monkey card is wild. You can decide the suit when assembling a raiding party.

Present (1x): Take the top treasure from the treasure discard pile. Sell or keep.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: ジグザ (ZIXZA)
description:
User summary
ジグザ (Jiguza) (ZIXZA) is a two-player game based on a 1980's cyberpunk novel where hackers and guards fight in the cyber space.

In a diagonal square grid, each player places their three dice on the spaces nearest to them.

During your turn, you take one of three actions below.
ROLL: Move one of your dice rotating vertically over to an adjacent space.
TURN: Rotate one of your dice 90 degrees horizontally,
ATTACK: Remove one of opponent's dice if your die adjacent to it has greater number.

You win the game when one of three conditions is met.
HOLD: Occupy all three squares at center of the grid with your dice.
GET: Remove two of opponent's dice.
ARRIVE: Occupy a square farthest from you with your die.

Repeatedly enjoyable and thought-provoking game system with less luck involved.
You can play this game anywhere with postcard-sized game board.

Two sets of three dice of the same color required to play this game.

Publisher's summary
ZIXZA（ジグザ）は80年代サイバーパンク小説をモチーフにした、
電脳世界でハッカーとガードに分かれプレイする2人用対戦ゲーム！
『移動（ROLL）』『回転（TURN）』『攻撃（ATTACK）』の3つの方法で、ダイスを操作、
『占拠（HOLD）』『奪取（GET）』『到達（ARRIVE）』の3つの方法で勝利するシンプルなルール。
運要素の少ないシステムと、繰り返し楽しめる思考性。
ポストカードサイズのコンパクトなデザインなので
遊ぶ場所を選びません！！

注意：遊ぶ際に2色3つずつのダイスをご用意ください。
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Dining Dynasties
description:
Owning a growing restaurant is hard work. An aspiring restaurant entrepreneur must make wise decisions to manage day-to-day operations and keep loyal customers happy, while always innovating to draw new customers through the door. But beware, competition is fierce as other restaurateurs are also looking to build their own reputations and secure their own loyal customers.

In Dining Dynasties, each player must work to draw in business, find loyal customers and create exciting new dishes! Players manage all aspects of their restaurant in a fast paced competition with their rivals to offer the finest cuisine and carve out a share of the ever changing customer base. To do this, players must build and maintain a hand of cards to create a unique business plan of options. Players may focus on marketing to advertise for new customers and seek out unique sales opportunities, improve the mood of the restaurant by building a professional staff and improving restaurant décor, or a combination of all. Yet another option is to invest in the menu and seek to claim the title of finest cuisine among the competitors! A unique meta-game within each game round has players strategically playing menu cards to vie for the title of finest cuisine, which may provide an immediate valuable customer bonus.

Dining Dynasties also allows players to increase the restaurant size. Do you want a small gourmet bistro or a huge dining establishment? The options are yours to choose, with each new room tile providing new worker placement opportunities to further your restaurant goals. But be cautious, expanding at the wrong time can take a toll on your available cash.

Over the course of nine rounds, players strive to build the most valuable restaurant by earning reputation, increasing sales and building infrastructure. The player who chooses the most effective business plan, and best mitigates the ups and downs of the market, will emerge the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Kislev
description:
Warhammer: Kislev is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 34-page softcover booklet is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Kislev Allied Contingent mini-faction and field it on the tabletop.

The Warhammer Armies: Kislev booklet describes the Kislev Allied Contingent army for the 6th Edition of Warhammer by Games Workshop. This 36 page long supplement was released through White Dwarf magazine.
(user summary)

North from the land of the Empire lies a land of dark pine forests and snow-clad wilderness - the land of the Kislev, ruled by mighty Tzars and Tzarinas. The icy realm of Kislev breeds tough and hardy people, not only because of the harsh climate, but also due to the constant depredations by raiders from the Chaos Wastes.

Warhammer Armies: Kislev is a compendium of White Dwarf articles for using Kislev allied contingents within an Empire army. This booklet describes the troops of Kislev, its history, its gods and its heroes.

Inside you will find:
- Kislevite Allied Contingents. New rules for using Kislevites, plus full background detail including the lands and people of Kislev, their history and their wars.

- The Ice Queen and Tzar Barons. Rules for your army to include both the mighty Boris Ursus, the red Tzar, upon his fearsome mount Urskin, and Tzarina Katarin, the Ice Queen of Kislev, wielder of the Ice Magic.
(from the back cover of the booklet)

This booklet was provided with White Dwarf 288.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Daemons of Chaos
description:
