Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Daemons of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Skaven
description:
Warhammer: Skaven is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Skaven faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Lion's Heart, Saracen's Steel: Battle of Arsuf, September 7, 1191
description:
Lion’s Heart, Saracen’s Steel: The Battle of Arsuf, September 7, 1191. This is the latest game in the Battles of the Middle Ages Series, an easy to learn wargame system that tries to recreate most of the principal battles fought from Roman Times to the dawning of Renaissance. These games are designed to be fast and furious, easy to learn and to play, but still true to the historical events portrayed. Lion's Heart, Saracen's Steel portrays the decisive battle of Arsuf. Richard the Lionhearted led the Crusader Army that was confronted by the legendary Ayyubid leader, Saladin. Although the Crusaders emerged victorious in this hard fought battle, the Third Crusade was ultimately a failure. Can you do as well or better?

—user summary

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Daemons of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Daemons of Chaos is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Daemons of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Goblin Killer Kontraptions
description:
From the publisher:

There is a long, messy history of Blood Bowl teams sneaking weapons onto the pitch, but few do it with such regularity (not to mention unapologetic brazenness) as Goblins. With very few exceptions, Goblin teams tend to have ready access to a well-stocked arsenal of unusual equipment at their disposal, most of which is hilariously deadly.

Goblin teams don't play fair, and nor should you! Rally crowd support with an ’Ooligan, and threaten your opponent’s End Zone with the super-quick and agile Pogoer and Doomdiver.

Goblin Killer Kontraptions is a 16-piece set cast in high-quality resin, and makes the following three Goblin Blood Bowl miniatures:

- 1 ’Ooligan
- 1 Pogoer
- 1 Doomdiver
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Attack All Humans!
description:
Inspired by the 1950's sci-fi movie genre, players take on the role of one of 4 alien races, to dish out vengeance on their captors, the humans. Be it through conquest, abduction, or plain 'ole vaporizing! All of these can garner you Points, but you'll have to move fast as the humans are developing The Doomsday Device, or might drop you the A-Bomb!

On your turn you'll use cards to move, mitigate action dice, and plan your action that round. Will you conquer a location to use its benefits? (Area Control), Abduct humans for the end game points(Set Collection), or plain ole' vaporize them for points? Don't forget your initial mission on Earth as these secret Objectives can put you over the edge and win! The game ends when either all players have orbited, or the humans devellop the Doomsday Device or dropped the A-Bomb! Do you want to risk getting extra points, or will this be the round the humans will capture you once again?(Press Your Luck).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Alhambra: Designers' Expansion – Orchard / Major Construction Projects
description:
These two expansions were available as part of the second Kickstarter for Alhambra: Designers' Expansions Box

Orchard by Emanuele Ornella:
Each player gets a player board at the start of the game that shows different combinations of fruits to collect during the game. Depending on where the fruits are placed and if a segment is completely filled by the end of the game, the player is awarded points.

Every time a new building is revealed at the market one fruit tile is drawn at random and placed on the building tile. A player acquiring the building will also get the fruit tile on that building. He then has to decide in which segment he want to place the fruit tile on the matching space.

Major Construction Projects by Dirk Henn:
These double tiles are great for speeding up the process of building your Alhambra. But each tile is auctioned off, and many players might be interested in it. Outbid your fellow players and increase your Alhambra by two buildings in one action.

Contains 15 double building tiles & 6 player markers.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Acquisitions
description:
ACQUISITIONS

ACQUISITIONS is a game inspired by the ideas of Sid Sackson. It is a game that is predicated upon building a Kingdom of wealth. Long ago, in distant times, Kingdoms were sometimes won and lost by mighty armies. Battles were waged to gain the lands and treasures held within the Kingdom under siege. Yet always behind these mighty armies were the Kings and Queens with their vaults of gold, silver, and bronze. Wealth has always driven the ownership of land. Kingdoms were always built on wealth.

The game of ACQUISITIONS allows players to wheel, deal, and plan their way to building the largest Kingdom of wealth. The only "luck" in the game of ACQUISITIONS is the luck of the draw for the Destination Cards. Beyond that, it is up to the player to purchase, trade, and strategically maneuver to become the King or Queen of the largest cache of Commodity Coins.

The basic concept of the game of ACQUISITIONS is that the players create and grow Kingdoms by playing the Destination Cards in their hand and placing buildings on the board. The Destination Cards available to the player are provided strictly by the luck of the draw. The skill in the game of Acquisitions, to generate a large amount of Commodity Coins, comes from the ability to obtain Kingdom Cards in the Kingdoms that will grow or even in the Kingdoms that are taken over by larger Kingdoms. The obtaining of Kingdom Cards is generally made in Kingdoms based on the players’ capability to grow those Kingdoms with their cards on hand. However, players can increase their Commodity Coins by obtaining Kingdom Cards in Kingdoms that grow from the other players building placements.

The main objective of Acquisitions is to become the player with the most Commodity Coins at the end of the game. This is achieved by obtaining Kingdom Cards in the Kingdoms that are growing, for a long term venture, while at the same time shrewdly investing in smaller Kingdoms that can be sacrificed in takeovers, for a short term outlay, all of which gains Commodity Coins through Royalty Compensations. The more Commodity Coins that can be generated in short term outlays, the more they can be invested into long term ventures. You can not reach the pinnacle of the game of ACQUISITIONS just by becoming the King or Queen of the largest Kingdom. The player who wants to become the wealthiest King or Queen must produce that perfect mix of active cash flow through takeovers and uncanny investment in Kingdoms that will grow. Many different strategies can be used to reach the pinnacle of wealth because every game is different.

The Game of ACQUISITIONS will keep the players focused because one purchase, one trade, one placement of a building can be the difference between win or lose.

Acquire a Kingdom of Wealth
-description from designer

name: Superzeroes vs Evil
description:
In Superzeroes vs Evil, each player will operate a superzeroes team that will try to overcome evil in all its forms. In this 2-4 player game that last 5 minutes, you'll need to cooperate to achieve your goal.

Players each have a hand composed of 7 cards. At the same time, they will all play a card to create a pool of damage and elements that they will use to kill the threat. If they are not able to defeat the threat, they can play another card or recall their hand and play a new card. Once the threat is defeated, a new one will appear. That goes on until the final boss is revealed!

If you can defeat the boss in under 5 minutes, you'll be the victor! If not, Evil shall prevails and dominate the world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Horror, Humor, Mythology, Party Game, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: GIPF: Das TAMSK-Potential
description:
The TAMSK potential
TAMSK is an independent game independent of GIPF and should always be considered as such. But within the project GIPF it makes even more sophisticated with its pieces, the TAMSK potentials, GIPF: You bring them into the GIPF game, but do not yet know whether you can use them or not. They can be beaten or neutralized, yes, it may even be that you can not use them at all. But as long as they are on the board, they pose a threat to the opponent. You will be amazed how a TAMSK potential affects your strategy and that of your opponent.

Apparently this new (2019) product contains 6 TAMSK potentials. The base game TAMSK includes 6 TAMSK potentials. The first GIPF expansion GIPF Project Set 1 (from 2001) contains 12 TAMSK potentials, so this new product seems intended to let TAMSK owners have the recommended full set of 12 TAMSK potentials without having to buy the earlier expansion with 12 of them.

name: Blood Red Skies: Hawker Hurricane Squadron
description:
During the Battle of Britain, The RAF had more Hurricanes than Spitfires, and the rugged Hurricanes shot down more enemy planes than their glamorous stable-mate. As the battlefield intensified in Northern Europe, Hurricanes went on to see extensive action in Africa, the Pacific, and Eastern fronts.

This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of Hawker Hurricane fighters, and additional accessories to add to the core game.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Single engine British aircraft
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Aircraft Card
6 Aircraft Trait Cards
6 Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Markings Sticker Sheet
3 Action Cards

Scale: 1/200th
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Cores da Guerra
description:
Cores da Guerra is a deckbuilding game set in ancient times period, more specifically in the Hellenistic period.

You are a general trying to achieve 7 victory points playing with Rome, Macedonia, Celts and Carthage and unify the Mediterranean sea in a great empire. These points can be achieved by military (pitched battles), political points (owning all the faction colors in your camp) and economical points (having three or more cards from the same faction in your camp). There is assault and raids against the adversary camp to slow down their economical engine.

The game is heavily based in wargame concepts in a very light way, but historically accurate. You will see light and heavy troops, infantry, cavalry, missile troops, terrain bonuses, etc. Cores da Guerra is divided in Campaigns. Each campaign is subdivided into three phases: A preparation phase in which players buy cards in the Market, set down cards in the area called camp, use abilities, assault or raid adversary camp, etc. When all players pass in their turn, the combat phase begins. Finally there is the renovation phase.

—description from the designer

name: Chakkan: Card game
description:
Chakkan is a card game based on the fantastic world of Chakkan. It is a 2 player game where memory, strategy and a bit of luck will make you the champion of your universe.
The game is to get skills by turning and discovering letters, you can identify them with their color and number, but do not trust your memory can be treacherous just like your rival. After you've got enough cards you can display different abilities to attack, provoke or defend your opponent or finally use your character's unique ability.
—description from the designer

Chakkan , es un juego de cartas basado en el mundo fantástico de Chakkan, es un juego de 2 jugadores donde la memoria, la estrategia y un poco de suerte te harán el campeón de su universo.
El juego consiste en ir consiguiendo habilidades al ir volteando y descubriendo cartas, estas las puedes identificar con su color y número, pero no te confíes la memoria puede ser traicionera al igual que tu rival. Después de que has conseguido suficientes cartas puedes desplegar diferentes habilidades para atacar, provocar o defenderte de tu contrincante o por último utilizar la habilidad única de tu personaje.
—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Antiques Roadshow: The Board Game
description:
The game of the BBC TV show of the same name. Licensed by BBC Worldwide.

Description from the box " Prove you're an Expert in this Game of Valuations, Bluff and Antique Trivia. "

A simple roll and move mechanic and set collection enlivened by the opportunity to estimate values and learn from expert guidance included in the cards. Very much suited to fans of the long-running U.K. TV show.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Quiz Match
description:
Quiz Match is a trivia game where two teams try to answer ten questions.

After each attempt, the panel is flipped and each team tells the other how many good answers they have (without further information).

—user summary

name: GOFO
description:
GOFO is Go Fish on steroids and crack. Players collect books of the finer things in life, like: beer, pizza, weed, whips, switchblades, money, human skulls and drugs. There are also four special function cards that add strategy and fun. GOFO is intended for mature audiences.

—description from the publisher

name: Fraud: The Game of White-Collar Crime
description:
2-6 player card game that satirizes corporate greed and white-collar criminals. Can be played in teams of 2 as well.

As a crooked CEO of a phony multi-national corporation, your mission in Fraud is to collect and bank Asset and Liability Cards in your Offshore Account, play Fraud Cards to attack your opponents, use Defense Cards to fend off attacks and avoid collecting Indictments. Once a player receives their 2nd indictment, they have to do the "Perp Walk" around the table while other players heckle them. The player who first banks $150 million ($150M) in Assets in their Offshore Account before receiving their 3rd indictment - wins the game.

Each card features unique, hand-drawn caricatures and art by Rick Parker. Rick’s probably best known as the artist of MTV's Beavis and Butt-Head Comic Book, and was on the staff at Marvel Comics for many years. Rick was the perfect man for job - supremely talented comic artist, and a really shady character.

Each player selects a CEO business card as their identity and gets a score pad to keep track of banked Assets and Liabilities in their Offshore Account ($150M wins the game) and indictments (3 strikes and you’re out).

The deck is shuffled and 6 cards are dealt to each player. The remaining cards are placed face down in the Draw pile. Played cards are discarded into a Discard pile, which can be shuffled and reused when the Draw pile gets low.

In any given turn, a player has 1 of 5 options:

Bank an Asset Card in their Offshore Account.
Securitize Liability Cards and if successful, bank those as assets in their Offshore Account on the following turn.
Attack another player with a Fraud Card and if successful, bank 1 Asset Card from you opponent while opponent also gets 1 indictment. Attacks are defended with Defense Cards.
Discard an unwanted card and draw back to 6.
Audit another player – each player can do this only once per game.


Fraud has been thoroughly play-tested, improved and refined over 10 years from initial beta launch in 2010 until this final game release. Fraud uses some of the similar game mechanics of Mille Bornes, the attacking, defending style card game that is listed in the GAMES Magazine Hall of Fame. Fraud is fun, simple to learn, and takes only 30 minutes to play. The game combines strategy and luck and satirizes corporate greed and white-collar crime.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Gloomhaven: Forgotten Circles – Removable Sticker Set
description: A replacement sticker set for the Gloomhaven: Forgotten Circles board game expansion. Featuring pre-cut removable vinyl stickers with non-transferring adhesive that can be used to reset, replay, and resell the game.

name: Manor Beans Takumi
description: It is a versus version of Manor beans that you can polish while playing with chopsticks like Japanese. It is luxury specification of the hidden box, and how to play also became abundant. Two kinds of beans, "chick pea" and "nagoya bean" are added, and chopsticks also come with 2 meals.

name: Night At The Movies Trivia & Games
description:
Movie trivia game. Includes cards (of specific topics) with multiple questions and answers, usually, but not always, three to a card. Also includes four kazoos (to be used in "Hum That Tune") and an Oscar Award-like cardboard trophy.

Made for team play; at least two teams, maximum of four. No limit to the number of players.

There are seven types of cards:
Film Trivia - Trivia questions about movies
Charades - Presents topics to be acted out for the team
Name Game - Get the team to guess the actor on the card.
Name That Movie - Read the given quote; the team has to
guess the movie.
Describe It - a la "Taboo", describe a movie, not using the
three words/phrases specified.
Shout Out - "All Play" type of question; both teams shout
answers to the question.
Hum That Tune - Using the included kazoos, hum the movie theme.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Daimyo Hero Pack
description:
A clan leader and military general, the Samurai Daimyo uses strategy and tactics to outwit and outmaneuver his opponents. As a powerful commander and trained Samurai warrior, he leads his armies into combat, for honor and glory!

The Samurai Daimyo starts each adventure with up to 3 Armored Ashigaru Foot Soldier Allies to command. In addition to being a skilled fighter, the Daimyo is also a natural leader, and many of his skills and abilities focus on giving bonuses to the rest of the Heroes and his Foot Soldiers.

An exclusive for backers at the Shogun level on Kickstarter. Includes the Hero Character Sheet, Rules Sheet, Upgrade Skill Tree, Game Cards, three Ashigaru Foot Soldier Miniatures, and both the Male and Female Daimyo miniatures.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: SelfieDado
description:
Selfiedado is a fun and dynamic dare dice game where your attitude will be challenged!

Selfiedado is played by rolling dice and completing challenges using your smartphone and Instagram account. Each challenge is related with taking selfies, group photos, record a video, and much more.

In each round a player throws the four dice once. Each dice are related to things like: type of photo, action, attitude, and what to upload to Instagram. The combination will dictate the challenge. There is fifth dice dice (video dice) that is rolled in some particular results.

Once the dice result is settled, you have 1 minute to complete the challenge using your smartphone camera app. The faster you are, the better. At the end your turn, next player rolls the dice and he/she needs to accomplish his/her challenge.

After five rounds, the player who spent less overall time wins the game. The loser instead, must do a final challenge.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: The Atlanta Campaign
description: The Atlanta Campaign is an Operational level wargame simulation of the 1864 North Georgia campaign fought between the Union armies of William T. Sherman and the Confederate Army of Tennessee led by Joseph E, Johnston. Abraham Lincoln's best hope for reelection against strong anti-war sentiment in the North depended upon the outcome of this campaign. If the South could hold Atlanta long enough, the Confederacy retained a hope for survival through a negotiated settlement of the War.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Dust 1947: Imperial Japan Navy Starter Set – Shadow of Death
description:
Forces of the Imperial Japanese Navy have begun to arrive in the Babylon theater. Their purpose at the moment is unclear, but it surely won't be any pick-nick! Their presence will have a great impact on the World's events, as they form one of the most seasoned military formations in the World. To stay discreet, they have arrived with stealth: Ninjas!

Shadow of Death includes the following units:
- Wen Gsi Wong (one Hero)
- one Ninja Infiltration Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Tengu Medium Walker (one vehicle)

Everything you need to start a new glorious IJN Army is included in this box! Please note that the Dust 1947 Starter rules, a durable neoprene gaming mat, terrain, dice, etc. are included in this Starter Set.

This item comes with three Dust 1947 Unit Cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: IJN Tengu/Enenra Medium Walker
description:
The Empire of Japan has started its VK powered walker program after every other Bloc on the planet. It therefore possess the most modern walkers, capable of holding their own against any foe. The Tengu mounts an impressive Rail Gun with its dedicated VK generator. The Enenra variant is armed with four antiaircraft guns to deal with enemy air forces.

This reference allows you to field one of these two variants. Please note that two “backpacks” are included with this model, one equipped with a radar for the Enenra.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the IJN Bloc.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant – Expansion 2
description: Expansion Two of Traveller Ascension: Imperial Warrant opens even more positions, so you can engage in up to 6 player games. With additional player positions, new events and secrets, and more systems to explore taking control of a system in the name of the Emperor just got more complicated. 10 Additional scenarios have been specifically tailored for large engagements.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Elite Canadians II: Manitoba at War
description: Four combined-arms scenarios with a focus on units from the province of Manitoba. Set between June 1944 and April 1945, the scenarios are medium-sized, and five to six turns long. In two engagements, the Royal Winnipeg Rifles take on 12. SS Panzer Division in Normandy. A third late-war action, finds the Rifles in Germany. The last scenario showcases the 12th Manitoba Dragoons, French paratroopers, and the Dutch resistance in April 1945.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Slash-accre!: A Slasher Movie Game
description:
Slash-accre!: A Slasher Movie Game is a board game tribute to 1980's slasher films, drawing inspiration from the stereotypes and conventions of the genre. A group of unsuspecting teens are throwing a party at an abandoned summer camp, not realizing they're not alone.

The game is played in a killer vs. teens fashion. The campgrounds are made of multiple 3D locations, which act as objective zones. The killer player sets up objective tokens for the teens, hiding in one of the locations. Teens must complete objectives after movement rolls to gather resistance tokens, items and parts of a victory plan while avoiding the killer. The killer uses their own deck to lure and scare the teens to gain an edge on them. During an encounter, the killer and the teens resolve fights with a dice roll and in case of an attack victory, the killer uses a kill deck card to eliminate the teens.

Teen player(s) are trying to complete parts of a victory plan to escape or defeat the killer, while the killer player aims to keep the teenagers from escaping and kill all of them.
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Race to Hollow Earth
description:
Race to Hollow Earth is a 4X type of board game based on the Hollow Earth Theory.

Game Play: All players choose one action they will take per turn;

Move/Move & Attack ~ this action allows players to move their tribe members & sea vessels to get to better resources, or to secret coordinates to Hidden Hollow Earth Tunnels. Or they can move and attack other players.
Purchase, Build or Heal the Land ~ this action allows players to buy cards, buy resource buildings or to change a wasteland back into healthy land to create more resources.
Collect Resources ~ this action allows players to collect resources for each of their tribe members and resource buildings.
Repeat Action OR GOLD ~ this action allows players to repeat any one of their USED action but with a dangerous consequence for all players OR instead of of doing the repeat action players may take a GOLD from the general supply.
END of Round ~ this action is only for the last player of each round to use...it gives the last player the power to end the round anytime on their turn.


How to Win or Lose the game...Race to Hollow Earth has 4 ways to win and 2 way that all player could lose the game.

Control 2 or 3 land masses(depends on player count) ~ If a player controls 2 or more land masses at the end of their a round, they win the game.
Control all Ports ~ If a player has a resource building on a number of ports (number depends on player count) at the end of a round, they win the game.
Hollow Earth friends ~ If a player gets to Hollow Earth twice and befriends 2 Hollow Earth residents, they win the game instantly.
Heal the Land ~ If a players color marker every gets to the #6 spot on the Heal the Land track, they win the game instantly.
Wastelands ~ If ever the Wasteland tracker gets to spot #7 the game ends for all, everyone loses.
KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE ~ Dero win ~ If ever the Dero meet their win conditions, everyone loses.


-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Reality TV
description:
Reality TV transforms a televised reality show into a family interactive game. As a part of the contest, players should please both their housemates and the viewers who watches the show. But even those players that follows an aggressive strategy may become winners in the final of Reality TV!

During the game, the players should extend the House while moving their pawns through it, making use of the unique Room benefits. Some of them are essential for any player —as the Diary Room, where they can nominate their housemates. But take care! disputes between Contestants are just around the corner, in which case a good hand management is decisive.

The critical point of each of the three rounds will come at his end with the much feared ejections. Those players that have been pleasant with the rest or have properly managed their tokens should feel safe... but the truth is that no one is out of danger!

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection, Voting

name: NHL Figures Hockey Game 3 Inch
description:
Each starter pack includes:
– 3 exclusive NHL 2.5-inch figures with their player stat cards
– 6 dice
– 3 pucks
– Playing mat
– Rule book for the game (also available to download).

A game can be played with as few as 3 action figures (1 goalie, 1 forward and 1 defenseman) for each player. However, it is highly recommended to play with a complete team of 6 action figures (1 goalie, 3 forwards, 2 defensemen). A team cannot total more than 25 points. Please refer to the skills cards of each action figure to determine the points each is valued at and consider this guideline in making up your team.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: The Murder House: One. Two. Flee.
description:
The Murder House is a survival game where you are trapped inside an evil house that constantly spawns vile creatures and horrible monsters at you. Your mission as a captive inside this house of horrors is to be the first and only survivor.

In The Murder House, you spend your turn searching the different rooms, collecting Item cards. These functions as a sort of currency in the game. Currency which can be spent on different Gear. Gears can be anything from a medpack, a helmet, goggles, that grant you new abilities. If these are combined correctly, you will have a Set. The Sets offer a huge bonus to these abilities.

The Murder House offers you free movement, based on a limited set of movement points. These points can be permanently or passively be either increased or decreased based on effects given through either Action cards or Gear and Sets.

As you plan your escape, you will be hunted by villains. Each round, a Villain card is drawn - revealing the location of the Villains. If you want to make it out alive, you'll need to make use of the many hiding places inside the house: Shower curtains, fireplaces, underneath tables and inside cryo tanks - when the Villains show up, you do NOT want to be seen.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Z War One: Damnation – Agent Z
description:
"Tactical Espionage - with Zombies!" Agent Z is a limited edition mini companion game. Different in tone to the co-operative Z War game, Agent Z is a 2 player "versus" game which pits two secret agents against each other in a variety of different scenarios. Of course it's all set to the backdrop of a world overrun with zombies and other infected, but now those zombies can be used against your enemy. Throw a pheromone grenade and see your opponent swarmed, grab a passing corpse and use it as an undead human shield or, using a director card, take direct control of a digger and give the opposition something serious to worry about.

New Agent Z missions are to be released regularly online, using assets from all the future Z War One issues. The two Agent Z characters and miniatures may also be used in the quick-play "Director" games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies

name: MP44: The Capture of Fort Eban Emael
description:
This expansion for the tactical WWII game MP44 was published in issue #2 of JagdPanther magazine. It includes a hex map representing Fort Eben-Emael (misspelled as Eban in the rules). The expansion adds rules covering bunkers, cupolas, and determining the landing location of parachutists.

The German forces consist of up to 11 squads of Para-Engineers. The number of German squads that actually arrive is randomly determined at the start of the game. Belgian units may emerge from the fortifications starting on the fourth turn of the game, although this is determined randomly on that turn and each turn thereafter.

The German player scores victory points for destroying bunkers and cupolas. The Belgian player scores victory points for destroying German squads. The game lasts 15 turns.

Balance may be a recognized issue, as the rules conclude with the statement: "Germans oughta win."

The Capture of Fort Eban Emael is currently available in PDF format as Amarillo Design Bureau has digitally rereleased all issues of JagdPanther magazine.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment
publishers: (Web published), Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., JagdPanther Publications

name: Bottom of the 9th: Rowdy Fans
description:
A promo card originally available during the Secret Cabal 2018 Kickstarter campaign.

Both players must agree on 1 of the 2 abilities to use during the game.

Swallowed Pride:
If a player loses both Pitch Tokens during the Staredown, that player takes a drink after the Staredown phase (that player drinks during the Run phase, should there be one)

Quarter the Way There:
During the Run Phase, instead of rolling dice, each player will attempt to bound a quarter into a shot glass. The first player to successfully do so calls the Runner (safe or out). The other player must take a drink
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pociąg do Zakopanego
description:
Train to Zakopane is an economic game in which players for eight rounds place their representatives on the action track and perform various action, such as taking raw materials, exchanging raw materials, investments in infrastructure construction, construction of the Zakopane railway and a court trial for Morskie Oko. The action track, which runs around the board, allows players to occupy any field, except that employees cannot go back to the fields they have missed. At the beginning of each round in order of players, they choose one of the available bonuses. After each round, players earn a profit from their investments and victory points.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Dice, Economic
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trading, Worker Placement

name: EXFIL
description:
EXFIL is a cooperative game for 4 players. You are members of Black Group, a special operations unit of military operators from around the globe. Black Group’s primary skills revolve around exfiltrating assets from difficult situations. It’s time to gear up!

EXFIL is a legacy campaign where your actions and decisions affect the course, landscape and difficulty of the game. You play as an Operator with a unique deck of cards that represent your skills. Over the course of each mission, you will need to make tough decisions involving managing your deck, managing Hostiles and fighting against the mission clock to complete objectives and reach the EXFIL point.

—description from the publisher

name: Escape: Revolution
description:
The rumor was therefore true, the LAB 4.0 exists. It is in this LAB that the ISC Source would be protected. We have to set up a small team to infiltrate this LAB and destroy this source...

—description from the universe book

Escape takes place in a post-apocalyptic world controlled by the International Scientific Council or I.S.C. in which artificial intelligence ensures the good of humanity. Some people do not agree with this vision: the resistance is born. The game stages the confrontation between humans from the Resistance and robots controlled by the I.S.C.

Escape is a light asymmetric miniatures wargame, taking place in the Eden universe. One player takes control of the I.S.C. and its robots; the other players control the humans from the Resistance. The game system is simple, accessible and fast.

Each game is played as a separate scenario but several of them may be played as a campaign. The players can win by completing a certain goal, such as escaping, destroying artifacts, or killing enemies. Players activate members of their squads on their turns, who can perform various actions such as move, attack an opponent, hack a security lock, use equipment, etc. Dice rolls determine if actions are successful or not. Each character has characteristics of combat, movement and intelligence, a gauge of life, and special abilities.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Takobake Cannon Enemy Pack
description: This pack comes with 1 miniature and all of the cards and rules needed to use the Takobake Cannon in your Shadows of Brimstone adventures.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tixel: Poka Yoke Expansion Pieces
description:
An expansion for Tixel, which consists of 2 extra pieces for each player that enables Poka Yoke to be played. Expansion pieces are different from regular pieces in that they have the shape of Regatta pieces, so besides being hollow on one side they also have one rounded corner.

The Poka Yoke expansion pieces are used to add piece promotion to the Tixel base game. Whenever you do a pickup of one of your pieces, it is promoted to a Poka Yoke expansion piece (with a maximum of 2 promotions for each player per game).

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #21 – France #2
description:
Expansion #21 MORE French Gear! Hostiles! - - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

11x France Soldier Cards (4x PS, 4x NPS, 3x SqS)
2x Mission Cards
2x Objective Cards
2x Location Cards
8x Weapon Cards
1x Equipment Cards
5x Skill Cards
3x France Service Record Cards
12x France Hostile - Elite Cards
13x France Hostile - Frontline Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #20 – France #1
description:
Expansion #20 French Gear! Hostiles! - - This expansion adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

11x France Soldier Cards (4x PS, 4x NPS, 3x SqS)
11x Weapon Cards
3x Equipment Cards
3x Skill Cards
3x France Service Record Cards
13x France Hostile - Elite Cards
12x France Hostile - Frontline Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #42 – Undead
description:
Warfighter WWII Expansion 42 - Undead - Adds 112 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This expansion adds Chaplains, Priests, Theology, Clergy powers, special Weapons, Equipment, and of course Undead Soldiers and Hostiles! Be warned, these Undead Hostiles are Evil, Fearless, and Elite!

Cards included are:

5x Clergy Soldier Cards
8x Germany Undead Soldier Cards
8x Japan Undead Soldier Cards
4x US Holy Weapon Cards
4x UK Holy Weapon Cards
3x Poland Holy Weapon Cards
4x USSR Holy Weapon Cards
5x Germany Holy Weapon Cards
4x Japan Holy Weapon Cards
2x Holy Equipment Cards
25x Japan Undead (Elite) Hostile Cards
24x Germany Undead (Elite) Hostile Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Grimm Tales of the Wood
description: A cooperative modular adventure/survival card/board game set in a stark Germanic telling of the the world of the Brother’s Grimm. Designed to circumvent counters, tokens, booklets, dice, the game uses only 150 double sided cards to craft, explore, battle and upgrade
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Captain Cap: Les Masques d'Onyx
description: Captain Cap: Les Masques d’Onyx is a combination of book and game, with players trying to color certain regions of a map in order to score points, with the rules for scoring varying based on the map you're playing.

name: Quarantine Area: Antidote
description:
"Quarantine Area: Antidote" is an escape room board game.
It is playable between 90-120 minutes with 2-6 people.
This easy-to-install game can be purchased in standard board game sizes.
It can be played anywhere you open the box.
You no longer need to leave your place to play an escape room.
Thanks to its easy-to-lock system, cabinets and drawers can be used as game objects.

- Game Scenario -

A sociopath doctor Morgan Handerson who creates a world-threatening virus is the victim of his own creation. Fortunately, his assistant, who was working alongside him, was able to report to the police station that the formula of the antidote was in the lab before the virus had spread. You will have 90 minutes to accomplish, otherwise, you will be exterminated just in case you get caught the virus.

- Game Setup -


For each game only one Game Master is a must.
The Game Master will receive the instructions clearly when the box will be opened. For this reason, the GM should read all instructions written without opening little boxes and envelopes.
The task of the Game Master is to place the game materials and puzzles in the right flow.
Locked objects containing puzzles must be locked correctly with combination locks.
The Game Master should read the story texts to the players during the game.
Also, Game Master is responsible to keep the time.


—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer 40,000: Heroes of Black Reach – Bad Moon Reinforcements
description:
An Orks Reinforcement Pack with 3 punchboards, as well as order tokens and dice in the Bad Moon colors, allowing you to play with three players (2 Orks vs. 1 Ultramarines) or Orks vs. Orks. In this product, you’ll find a Stompa (in the Goff clan colors) and reinforcements for the Bad Moons clan as well.

Contents:


Goff Stompa
Bad Moon Warboss Skarblitz
Bad Moon Meganobz
Bad Moon Grot Tanks
Bad Moon Killa Kans
Bad Moon Grot Mega Tank
Bad Moon Meka Dread
Bad Moon Trukk
Bad Moon War Buggy
Bad Moon Order Tokens and Custom Dice
1 Objective & 1 Terrain Overlay
Vehicle Gear, Command Options and Customizations
Rules & 2 Scenarios
Sticker sheet for the official storage system
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: RIG InterGalactic
description:
A tabletop space combat game played with customizable spaceship models called RIGs.

The Guild of RIG Pilots has openings for new members and has posted a challenge to all pilots with a RIG. Pilots are to battle each other in order to earn a place in their ranks. You are one of these pilots!

- Pilots battle it out by drawing from constructed decks and playing cards to activate System Discs (SD). Activated SDs can have various types of weapon and special abilities. These are then physically launched from your RIG.
- Five different RIGs (buildable spaceship models) can be customized by mounting the parts the way players want and the ships can also be mixed to build a totally new RIG.
- Configure your RIG by installing various types of Platforms into your RIG's Modules and construct your deck according to the installed Platform Systems.
- Earn points during battle to eventually be accepted into the Guild. As you earn Battle Points, you'll gain benefits in the Battlespace to aid you on your way to Victory.

Victory conditions:
The game ends when a player's RIG is destroyed or after the turn where a player's deck runs out.
- The player with the surviving RIG wins the game.
- If both players survived when the game ends, the player with the most armor wins the game.
- If the armor amounts are equal when the game ends, the Junior Guild Member wins the game.
- If both players are Junior Guild Members when the game ends, the players must place their RIGs 2 Proximity card lengths apart and load 1 SD each. The players launch simultaneously. The player who achieves the closest Proximity wins the game. A Direct or Surface Hit is an automatic loss. Relaunch if both players scored a Direct or Surface Hit.

—Neal @ CGT
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Real-time, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #34 – Canada #1!
description:
Adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier and Hostile pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

Cards included are:

11x Canada Soldier Cards
2x Mission Cards
12x Weapon Cards
2x Equipment Cards
1x Skill Cards
14x Canada Hostile - Elite Cards
14x Canada Hostile - Frontline Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Race to Planet X: Number Bond Game
description:
Race to Planet X: Number Bond Game is a board game that has fun game mechanics and helps K-3rd graders master number bonds, addition, and subtraction. Families can play a quick game in 15 minutes, and score some major parenting points for non-screen family time that also doubles as math practice for the kids.

The Game:

Take turns making Power Combos (3 cards that make a number bond) to move forward on the game board.
Make Power Combos before another player ZAPs a card from your hand. SCORE your Power Combos before another player SMASH one and make you move backwards.
First to reach Planet X wins!


—description from the publisher

name: Stribe
description:
A simple card game for kids. Cards show images of figures in different occupations (fireman, clown, diver etc) - and there are between 1 and 4 of each occupation in the deck.

Place out any card from your hand next to any others already out - in vertical or horizontal lines. If your card is the same as the card at the other end of the row or column, take the whole line.

Try to win the most cards.

—user summary

name: Top Tale: The O.G – Volume 1
description:
The card game, TOP TALE, is a new type of game that takes the process of getting to know your fellow human and makes it a fun, often insightful, experience. The game is meant to appeal to just about anyone from any background, and can be used as an ice breaker or as a tool to get people to open up.

TOP TALE is a deck of cards where each card has a topic on it. Along with each topic, there's a caption that is meant to spark ideas for responses to the topic, or in many cases the caption is just meant to get a chuckle out of the players to help lighten to mood. Topics are things like, "Your Worst Day at School", where each person is expected to recount their worst day at school story. The game has some hidden strategies, where it's not always about what stories are told, but sometimes how entertaining they are when told.

At the end of each round of game play, each player votes for their favorite response without voting on their own, and the person with the most votes wins the round. If there's a tie, then you have a tiebreaker round between those that tied, responding to a new topic card. The game continues until you hit a predetermined number of cards, or you all call it quits.

—description from the designer

name: Sabotage
description:
Sabotage was designed and illegally distributed by a group of Danish resistance fighters during the German occupation of Denmark which lasted from 1940-45. It simulates an actual act of sabotage that took place against a transformer station at the Scandia Locomotive Factory in Randers on 6 July, 1943. Erik Hagen, a medical practitioner who was also active in the resistance underground, is said to have sold the game to his patients and donated the money to illegal activities and operations. He was shot and killed on 6 June, 1944, while returning from a sabotage mission against the Globus Factory in Glostrup.

The game pits 1-2 saboteurs against 1-2 factory guards, and challenges the saboteurs to blow up as many machines and buildings as they can before they are either caught, killed, or manage to escape. The saboteurs will have to acquire the necessary equipment, such as crowbars, guns, and explosives, on the black market before entering the factory grounds and setting the charges. The factory guards, on the other hand, are trying to discover the saboteurs and raise the alarm. Once raised, the saboteurs only have a few turns to complete their operations and escape the factory grounds before the police arrives and arrests them.

The game board and pieces are printed on a single sheet of paper which players are instructed to mount on cardboard and cut out. Movement is controlled by the throw of a single 6-sided die, as are the gun fights which may occur if the guards discover the saboteurs. Considering the relative simplicity of the game, the simulational approach of the design sometimes makes for complicated situations which are only partly covered by the accompanying rules sheet. This also means that there are no hard and fast criteria for winning or losing. Rather, the game presents itself as a training simulation meant to inspire further acts of sabotage against the German occupying force.

—user summary
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Dash and Cache
description:
Dash and Cache is a fun party game for all ages. It involves collecting and managing items to get the correct number and type of items. The items in the game are anything that the players gather from around their house for the game. Items could be a plate, blanket, coin, candle, can of beans, apple, baseball, teddy bear, or anything else that players can imagine to go towards their goal of winning the game. Dash and Cache involves environmental awareness, critical thinking, resource management, and strategy. The game components are 72 cards, 1 custom game die, and 1 sand timer. The game is for 2-10 players, but ideally 4-6.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wot¿zit
description:
The silly picture guessing game where things aren't what they seem.

Can you guess Who, Where or What is shown on each mystery picture and win the game?

Wot¿zit, the zany, silly, mystifying picture guessing board game for all the family where things aren't quite what they first seem.

The pictures are a crazy mixture of places, people and things, but it doesn't matter if you don't know, because if you can convince others to choose your answer you will win moves too.

name: Zont!
description:
You and your team have just returned from an incredible adventure on the mysterious planet Zont, but there's just one problem – you don't remember any of it! Zont! is a co-op storytelling game of adventure that fosters creative thinking and teamwork.

To begin, each player chooses a role (Captain, Scientist, Explorer, Security, Diplomat or Engineer). Memory tiles that depict a color (Emotion) and a word are turned over and spread out in the center of the table. A Story Plot is chosen at random, this is the goal the team was trying to accomplish on their mission and indicates a specific word found on the Memory tiles.

On their turn a Player reveals two Memory tiles. If two matching colors are found that Player begins a "Complete Memory" using the Emotion indicated by the color and the two different words on the tiles. Each other player then contributes by "Adding To" the memory from the viewpoint of their role on the team. After all players have had a chance to "Add To" the memory, the pair of tiles are placed on the Memory Track at a point determined by the team.

After 8 Complete Memories (linked from Start of Story to End of Story) are found you will have pieced together your trip to Zont and have a unique story only your team could have had.

Winning or Losing is optional. To Win the players must find and work the Story Plot term into the story and individual players are awarded points on their participation. But for younger or more casual play the journey itself is just as rewarding.

We hope you had a wonderful time on Zont!

—description from the publisher

name: Defcon Dice
description:
It’s the Cold War. The USSR and the United States are clamoring to consolidate their power and gain a competitive edge. Defcon Dice is a strategic dice and card game where players take turns either manipulating dice on the battlefield or claiming them using one of their available cards. The player with the lowest number of cards remaining after three rounds of passive aggressive posturing is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Dogfight: A Game for Owners of Wing Leader
description: Dogfight is a set of freely available variant rules for use with the counters and data cards from the GMT WWII air combat game Wing Leader, allowing a greater focus on the fighting in the immediate vicinity of the bombers. It has evolved greatly since its first appearance in 2017, and now consists of three editions - Dogfight Lite which retains the generic simplicity of the first version, Dogfight Deluxe which is a much more sophisticated and physically accurate system which differentiates between all the many available aircraft types, and Dogfight Full Circle which uses shorter turns and replaces the 3D-enhanced side-scrolling perspective of the other two editions with a fully 3D 360 degree top-down viewpoint. All three game versions are available at https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/149562/dogfight, and the final two have YouTube videos showing complete sample games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Gloriana
description:
In the sixteenth century, Queen Elizabeth I used to travel around the grand houses of England. Her hosts would vie with one another to put on the most lavish entertainments, catering and spectacle, often almost bankrupting themselves in the process. But position at Court was all that mattered - the more impressive your show, the higher your status and perhaps you would be the new "favourite".

In Gloriana, each player represents one of these nobles. Over several rounds, they will draft Staff to help them put on Events to impress Her Majesty. Players will need both similar types and diverse types in order to create the most effective Events and score victory points.

—description from the designer

name: Soulier d'or
description:
Soulier d'or (Golden Shoe in French) is a football-themed card game sponsored by Adidas and a french radio called RTL.

With the help of cards, the players try to score goals, and counter the attacks of the opponent.

When you are four players, it's forbidden to communicate the cards in your hand. When you try a breakthrough, you hope the partner has a shot on goal, but you can not know it.

—user summary

name: Hot Fight in Mississippi: The 1862 Campaigns in Mississippi and Tennessee
description:
Confederate Generals Sterling Price and Earl Van Dorn operated separate commands in northern Mississippi, late in 1862. Union troops, in a disjointed attack, struck Price near Iuka. Price withdrew, while at that same time Van Dorn made a move toward Federal held Bolivar, but then backed off. Van Dorn eventually gained command of Confederate forces in the area and united with Price. Van Dorn believed a quick move to take Corinth was the best way to proceed. US forces under General William Rosecrans were fortified in Corinth however, and the assault, though with some initial success, was costly to the Confederates. Van Dorn then withdrew to Holly Springs.

But there were other options available to the southerners. Forcing Union forces to abandon Corinth by outmaneuvering them and blocking their supply routes was one alternative. Striking towards the important bases of Bolivar and Jackson was another option. Or attempting to take Memphis was a possibility. Then again, what if things had gone differently, and the US had been defeated at Corinth. The possibilities are now yours to explore...

—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Simic Ravnica Allegiance Guild Kit
description:
Each Guild Kit features a 60-card pre-constructed theme deck flavored after one of the featured guilds, combining cards from every Ravnica set released so far. The reprints are not Standard legal.

Contents:
1 Ready-to-play Green/Blue 60-card deck
1 Spindown life counter
1 Official guild pin
1 Guild symbol sticker
1 Insert with mission instructions
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Showdown Battle:  Marianas and Philippine Sea Jun44
description:
Operational level game of the landings and any accompanying air and naval battle(s). Individual fleet and light carriers and battleships - both Yamato and Musashi sortied in this - 2-ship cruiser and 4-ship destroyer units (mostly), Guam and Saipan invasion forces, and implicit submarines. Divebomber, torpedo bomber, and Japanese Betty medium bomber squadrons - fighters are also implicit (in the game system) for playability.
100 mile/160 kilometer hexes and 3-hour turns over a possible 6 days. As for a good Leyte Gulf game, there could be one USN player in command of Task Force 52's landings, old battleships, and taffies (baby flattop groups) and one for modern battleship and fast carrier TF58 ... with coordinating communications possibly delayed? }:)
Secret *Japanese* strategic intelligence roll, with a 17% chance of them already near the Marianas and an also un-historical 33% chance of them entering the west side of the chartboard at the same time the Americans enter the east side - or they are delayed a full day, as historically. Dummy units and detection rules for operational Fog of War. My abstract "betting" ground combat system.

Game balance victory point compensation. :)

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Nautical, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: 1863:  Trans-Continental Railroads
description: 1863: Trans-Continental Railroads is part of the 18XX train game / stock company family of games. It features the major (and private) joint-stock companies that competed to build the various trans-continental railways, and the regional companies that grew out of these railways.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: La Recta Provincia
description:
During the 18th century the Island of Chiloé in Chile was dominated and governed by a group of sorcerers who called themselves "The Majority". This group of powerful sorcerers named Chiloé as "La Recta Provincia" (The Straight Province) which was made up of seven districts and under the control of an all-powerful King.
After the King's death the most influential wizards dispute the reign of "La Recta Provincia". However, only the one who gets the support of most districts will be crowned as the next monarch.

In this game you will embody a powerful sorcerer who, using economic, political and magical influence, must take possession of most of the districts in "La Recta Provincia". But beware, a dark character known as the "Trauco" can threaten your plans, unless you are the one who can use him as an ally.

Your goal is to gain control of four of the seven districts in the "Recta Provincia". Every player stars with only one die to acquire influence cubes (Economic, political or magical), you will use your cards to play those influence cubes on districts. When you meet the influence requirements to take control of a district you will also acquire its special die which will grant the controller with new powers (more influence, cards and other abilities) to continue taking control of other districts.

The initial die will also move the "Trauco", an automata character that will help the active player to acquire more influence, but can also shift the control of a district where both players have met the influence requirements.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Napoleonic Wargaming
description:
Classic work on the subject by one of the luminaries of the hobby.

From the inside jacket -

"In this book the author considers in detail the actual tactics of Napoleonic armies, discuss weapons capabilities and troop movement rates and, using such data as a basis, provides rules, whereby the wargamer can, with minimal expense and effort, command his miniature army in battles which are correct simulations of their historical prototypes and can savour victory or defeat in emulating the exploits of a Ney or a Murat, or possibly even of a Napoleon or a Wellington!"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Minotaur
description:
Minotaur is an easy to learn, hard to master 20-minute tile laying game. In a one-player game you play Daedalus, the master builder in charge constructing and sealing shut a labyrinth while Minotaur hunts for you and the unfinished exit. A second player can take over as Minotaur in a two-player match.

On each turn select a labyrinth section from the Builders Board, and a location to build it atop a grid of randomly arranged land tiles. Your choices impact what labyrinth sections you have available on your next turn, and the direction and distance that Minotaur moves. Different types of labyrinth sections are blessed by different Greek gods, giving Daedalus an edge if used at the right time.

Earn points for building along rivers, lose points for building on vineyards, and don't let the Minotaur reach you or the exit before you finish! Earning and placing pillars will help slow Minotaur's progress and earn extra points.

In a two-player game Daedalus has less influence on Minotaur's movement, which is now controlled by the second player. Minotaur can topple and carry away pillars built by Daedalus, and steal labyrinth sections before they are set in place in order to build temples. Both players may build temples to different gods to thwart each other's progress.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Ascension: Delirium – Askara Templar Promo Card
description:
Promo card that came with pre-orders of Ascension: Delirium from the official site.

Name: Askara Templar
Cost: 6 Runes
Type: Enlightened Hero
Text: Defeat a monster with cost 5 power or less without paying its cost. Gain its reward twice.
Flavor Text: Three time the arms, three times to weaponry.
Value: 3 Honor

name: Space Infantry Resurgence Core Rules
description:
Space Infantry Resurgence is a robust gaming system that features a unique solitaire game and has been further expanded to provide both co-op and two-player modes of play. In Space Infantry Resurgence you command an elite squad of veteran Space Infantry soldiers taking on the daunting task of fighting against unknown alien foes, through challenging environments, using only the weapons and tools brought with you, or whatever can be scrounged along the way in order to achieve victory.

Space Infantry v2.0 rules are the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Blackwell Hird and, Gottardo Zancani Lead Developers of Space Infantry Resurgence Series.

These rules present the core rules for the game system. This new rule book has been designed to place all the rules in one book, making playing the game is easier and faster than ever.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pentaurus: Black Hole
description:
Pentaurus: Black Hole adds new components to Pentaurus Duel to get a completely different game. Collect the galaxy's pentanium before the black hole swallows it all, but watch out for enemy fleets.

The playable area is made up of 25 cards in a 5x5 matrix with the black hole card in the center. Players enter the area from one of its sides and travel jumping from planet to planet collecting pentanium and fighting competing factions before the 10th turn when the black hole swallows the planets and the spaceships around it.

The game is designed for 2-5 players, who will explore the galaxy Pentaurus fighting to get the required pentanium before time runs out. Each player adopts a race with its special characteristics. There are several game modes:


Pentaurus Black Hole: standard mode.
Pentaurus Star: beginner mode.
Pentaurus Black Hole solitaire mode: challenges an artificial intelligence.


Pentaurus: Black Hole is a limited edition (50 units) expansion, handmade in Amphora Games facilities, which is not sold in stores and is only available on the official website and at few festivals.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Sea Cube
description: Sea Cube is a treasure hunt game in which you seek and describe where treasures (six colored dice) lie in a box that looks like the sea. One player looks into the box through one of four periscopes and describes the locations of treasures to other players, either their team or the entire group if playing a full co-op. Teammates then mark the location and type of treasure on a map. The team with the most points wins.
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers
publishers: サラダ館白鳥店 (Salad-kan Shiratori Branch)

name: Curbside
description:
You and your fellow Taxi drivers are competing for fairs in Curbside, a relatable game of ride sharing. Compete with other players to pick up and drop off passengers phoned in by dispatch. Place tiles to create a pathway to passengers and their drop off destinations. Reroute your GPS when a path won't get you there fast enough. But watch your gas meter! With every space your Taxi moves your gas goes down. The game is finished when all the passengers arrive at their destinations or a Taxi runs out of gas!

—Danielle Reynolds
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Wars of the Blue Water
description:
Wars of the Blue Water is a tactical game of 21st-century naval warfare. Unlike similar titles which portray entire conflicts between nations, this game simulates quick and intensive engagements in hours at sea. Compare to traditional You-Go-I-Go style game sequence, players will find they have little control over the course of battles in this game. They will find themselves being forced to react to developing situations all the time. The most successful player would be the one could ride with the tide of uncertainties rather than against it with rigid plans.

—description from the designer

name: Tatorship
description:
Tatorship is a card game, where you assume the role of Tators who back stab, bluff and ultimately break down democracy. Learn the method applied historically to identify that behavior in the future!

Tators react to events to gain political influence, and can either pass laws or campaign to become the Executive! In this fast paced card game you either gain resources or back stab cards, so there will never be a dull moment!

The game ends after the first player gets 5 Tatorpoints, gained by removing Supreme Judges and eventually Basic Rights.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Coder Bunnyz
description:
A board game with fun and learning for kids, adults and families.

13 levels of kinesthetic learning, grows with age or player skills
Highly interactive way to introduce coding
Teaches all the concepts used in Java, Python, Ruby and even C.
Promotes problem-solving and social interaction


Game Play:
Easy to get started, focuses on concepts. Program your robot bunny game token smartly with your code cards to eat the carrot and reach the destination before the others do! Play with different destinations or move to the next levels.

Skills covered:
CoderBunnyz programming board game teaches you coding concepts like:

Sequencing
Conditional
Repeat Loops
Code Writing
Functions
Debugging
Branches
Inheritance
Parallelism
Stack
Queue
List


—description from the publisher

name: World Cup!
description:
World Cup! allows players to replay historic soccer tournaments, with control over a number of countries in the competition. The goal is to use strategy, power, and a bit of luck to guide one of your teams to soccer’s ultimate prize!

This reprint of The World Cup Game will shift the design to a card-only format, allowing for more portability, but will maintain the original design of the board game. The revised game will also create individual team abilities, allow players to create their own tournaments (where teams from different eras can face off), and for the first time, allow players to replay the Women’s World Cup.

Players select a number of teams to play throughout the tournament and are dealt "game cards" which add actions (goals, corner kicks, fouls, etc.) to each game. As many games are played simultaneously, players must determine which teams to support on each turn. Each team also has a special ability that gives uniqueness and flavor to the game.

The object of the game is to have one of your teams win the World Cup! Players can replay recent tournaments, or customize tournaments by mixing teams from different eras.

—description from the designer

name: Truck in the Muck
description:
Compete in this 2-player mint tin format game to deliver food aid in an under-developed country. Upgrade your truck to survive as the roads deteriorate in bad weather. Watch out for rebel road blocks, landmines and flat tires!

Event cards and changing weather influence players' decisions as they prepare and load their trucks in the HQ, then travel through their Zone to deliver aid and increase their reputation. The first player to reach the end of the reputation track and make it back to the HQ is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Vortex: Snakes #11A
description:
Expansion for Vortex, adding "snakes", lines with an arrow-shaped end for different puzzles and gameplay. For this version the snakes are red and blue

—user summary

name: Math Kings
description:
You are a savvy merchant using basic arithmetic to earn as much gold as possible. Your goal is to acquire assets in the four suits of a standard deck of cards to gain prominence in different aspects of society, and more importantly; to gain influence with the royal court.

Math Kings is a two player game that is played in 20-30 minutes with a standard deck of playing cards. Players alternate taking turns buying cards or earning gold using a 3 x 3 display of cards. Cards cost the "square" of their value, and you earn gold by multiplying the values of cards of the same suit.

Face cards offer special abilities, and are acquired by players as they collect cards of the same suit.

The rules are one page long, and are posted in the "Files" section. Try the game out for free with that crusty old deck of cards you've got lying around and post your feedback in the "Forums" section!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Agricola: Times they are a-changing
description: Thus far the only card to be released in Agricola's H-Deck is H00: Times they are a-changing, a Minor Improvement card, which obliges players to remove their previously played Occupation cards.
categories: Animals, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Pharmacology Roulette
description:
Push your luck polyhedral dice game.
—user summary

You and your friends are test subjects for Big Pharma! Will the experimental drugs cure what ails you or will send to an early grave? Pharmacology Roulette is a microgame designed by Lester Smith, where dice are drugs and you can play it safe or go for broke! Keep rolling until someone dies (in the game, relax) and see which patient is in best shape.
—description from the designer

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – M60 Patton Tank Expansion
description:
Equipped with heavy armour and a powerful 105mm gun, the veteran M60 Patton has a proven combat record in conflicts all around the globe. It may not be the premier tank in the US Army anymore but superb tank crews are able to use the M60s’ protection and firepower to more than even the playing field and best their opponents.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled M60 Patton tank
1x M60 Patton Tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Halfling Pitch & Dugout Set
description:
This set comes with a double-sided pitch to enjoy crushing opposing teams on two variations of the Halfling home turf. Also included are two double-sided dugouts to match the board.

Each Pitch and Dugout set also comes with special rules on the back for playing on that pitch board to make them truly unique.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystery at the Lux Museum
description:
Something is amiss in the Lux Museum and we need your help to crack the case! Mystery at the Lux Museum is a cooperative game for 1-6 players in which players use clues to solve puzzles and ultimately solve a perplexing mystery. Physical assets such as maps, museum guides, stamps, model statues, ciphers, pictures and more are sent with the game in order to assist the user.

This game is meant to be a family game in which kids and adults come together to solve the puzzles. The recommended age for kids is 6-12. The typical duration of the game is 1-2 hours.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Albus Dumbledore Expansion
description:
Considered to be the most powerful wizard of his time, Albus Wulfric Percival Brian Dumbledore – to give him his full name – was the headmaster of Hogwarts for a period that encompassed both of Voldemort’s attempts to take over the Wizarding World.

This finely detailed Albus Dumbledore resin model depicts the Hogwarts headmaster at the height of his powers. Wielding the Elder Wand, Dumbledore can be mounted on a regular 30mm base, or placed on an impressive centrepiece large base, representing Dumbledore using the powerful Firestorm incantation, with which he vanquished the sinister Inferi at the Crystal Cave.

The set includes two Character Cards, one for each base type, giving you more tactical options when choosing Dumbledore as part of your Group. The Albus Dumbledore box also contains a new scenario, artefact card, and complete assembly instructions.

-- From the publisher.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Starlight Stage: Expansion Card set 5
description:
A new Starlight Stage Expansion set was released in May 2019.
This expansion includes 24 cards of 4 types: 7 Idol cards, 7 Produce cards, 9 Scout Idle Cards, 1 Update card ,30 Influence Chips.

A new rule, "influence" is added in this set.

■New Rules: Notes on Influence
About Influence
Influence is the power that the agency can exert on the show business.
By paying Influence chips, you can exert various Influences.

—description from the designer
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Fistful of Lead: Galactic Heroes – Codex Galactica
description: The Codex Galactica, a compendium of Peoples, Creatures and Alien Threats from across the galaxy. This essential handbook will give you a tool kit for building forces based off your favorite sci-fi genres.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Shadows over Normandie: The Choir of Nightmares
description:
This punchboard contains a new unit for the Mythos faction, the Choir of Nightmares, an evil choir, singing ungodly canticles lead by their choral conductor. Practically, this choral conductor chants a hymn, causing an effect (harmful for the enemy, or beneficial for allies) in a small area. Nearby choristers can immediately pick up his chanting, increasing the effect.

On an individual level, the Choir of Nightmares is composed of rather weak units, but they strengthen and support their allies thanks to their blasphemous prayers.

Well used, their effects can change the tide of a battle, yet the choirmaster needs protection – without him, it’s impossible to chant. It’s best not to lose the chorists too fast either if you’d like to keep the reach and effectiveness of the prayers.

This product is accompanied by a digital booklet, downloadable from the Devil Pig Games website, containing the rules to play with the Choir of Nightmares as well as one scenario.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Stalingrad: Battleground Set #5 – The Sewers
description:
The Heroes of Stalingrad Kickstarter campaign was the opportunity to release an expansion to get you fighting in the sewers. It's now also available for Shadows over Normandie and Heroes of Normandie players.

This new environment presents a challenge and opens new, fun and original opportunities to fight on two levels (on the surface and in the sewers) or exclusively in the queasy depths of these underground tunnels.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Snow Day: The Cold War
description:
Snow Day: The Cold War is a medium-light family-friendly tactics game. Our aim is to bring players from a wide range of ages together for a nostalgic and playful snowball fight!

Players compete in teams of an equal number of characters(usually 2 per player). On a modular grid, the first team to knock over all of the opponent's snowmen win the game! All players on a team act as one turn, and each character may use 2 actions (Move, Throw, Build forts/snowballs, Break fort, Knockdown Snowman)
