Coordinate with your team to move past opponents to their side of the board to knock down the snowmen. Use snow forts to defend your characters and block movement. Slide on ice to increase your mobility. Build and throw snowballs to send players into their houses to warm up before returning to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Necromunda Rulebook
description:
The Necromunda Rulebook is your complete guide to gang warfare in the 41st Millennium. Packed with rules, lore, art and content previously only available through Gang War supplements, this book is a must-have for every player, providing an invaluable resource for everything from quick skirmishes to sprawling campaigns.

Inside, you’ll find:

A closer look at the lore of the Imperium of Man, the hive worlds that serve it and Necromunda itself, plus the timeline of this iconic world
An overview of the rules looking at the general principles of the game, how gang fighters work and everything you need to learn to get started
The full rules, exploring each phase of the game from movement to close combat
Rules for a host of different game types - from one-off skirmishes and tournament play to sprawling Dominion campaigns
A huge host of scenarios and guidelines for setting up your battlefield, with rules for both close-quarters Zone Mortalis games and using Sector Mechanicus terrain.
A set of powerful tools and rules for Arbitrators to construct their perfect campaign
The full Skills list for Necromunda
A quick reference sheet for checking out your key information at a glance.


Compiling both the previous Necromunda Rulebook, rules content from Necromunda supplements so far and the latest FAQs and Errata, this book is your essential companion to gaming- with it, and a copy of Gangs of the Underhive (available seperately), you’ll have all the rules you need to play. If you've always wanted to try Necromunda but never knew where to start, this is your gateway to gang warfare in the underhive.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Wargames Rules for the Mid 18th Century
description: A 32 page softcover book featuring a set of wargame rules designed primarily with the Seven Years War and 15mm figures in mind. An unformed march can move around nine inches getting dramatically slower as his formation changes and the offers impose the rigid discipline of the era.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ranger Trackers
description:
The first line of defense for the realms of Men, the Night’s Watch is comprised of grizzled and hardened men from a wide swath of society. Bound together by their Vows, and aided by their rangers and tracker, the men of the Night’s Watch are ready to face the threats that exist beyond the wall.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Pot po Jugoslaviji. Put kroz Jugoslaviju
description:
Pot po Jugoslaviji. Put kroz Jugoslaviju game titel translation from both Slovak and Croatian languages - "The way through Yugoslavia".

A mid 1930s Yugoslavian pan-Slavic board-game published in Ljubljana, Slovenia, circa 1935 by a famous illustrator and painter Mirko Šubic (1900-1976).

Mirko Šubic was born in a Slovenian family of artists and architects. He studied art in Munich under Franz von Stuck and Karl J. Becker – Gundhal, in Prague under Vlaho Bukovac, Jakub Obrovský and Vojtech Hynais, and in Dresden under Ferdinand Dorsch in Max Feldbauer. Before the WW II he was active as illustrator and painter. In his later life he became one of the most famous restorers and conservators of Yugoslavia.

The game shows the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in the late 1935 and traveling through the most important stops of the country, should increase the pan-Slavic feeling. All the stops on the board are described in the inner side of the box. The instructions end with a rhyme of a Slovene, Croat and Serb always being brothers.

The maps shows the most famous building of Yugoslavia. As most of them are older buildings, Ljubljana is shown with the modern Art Deco building “Nebotičnik” (Skyscaper), the tallest building on the Balkans at the time, finished by 1933. Nebotičnik was the first reinforced concrete building in Europa.

The architect of Nebotičnik, Vladimir Šubic, was a brother of the illustrator of this game, Mirko Šubic.

The map can be dated after the opening of Nebotičnik in 1933 and before 1939, when two regions (banovine) of 9 in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, merged into one. The 8 regions existed until 1941, at the beginning of the WW II.

—user summary

name: Retro Hero
description:
Retro Hero is the first of many games for the Retro Gamer Device. Players start by randomly selecting 5 level cards (this is your cartridge) and inserting them into their Retro Gamer Device. Each level has a predetermined number of turns so players must try and make the best with the options they're presented.

The goal is to collect points while navigating across levels, moving with the help of shapes chosen from the options rolled on your adventure dice. Points are mainly collected by covering as many empty spaces as possible (venture points); defeating creatures scattered across the levels; and using a key to open the lock. There are also several other ways of accumulating points such as Treasure Cards and Side Quests.

Items found in a level are collected when covered, adding to your player board or wallet. When covering creatures, players attack by drawing cubes from a bag. Successful attacks earn you points while taking hits will cost you health. Players can press their luck to earn maximum points but risk dying in the process. If a player does run out of health during an attack, they lose a point as consequence but are revived on their next turn, continuing from where they left off.

The Treasure Cards that are collected are added to the limited slots on your player board to help you along the way. Their content ranges between Spells, Companions, and Special Items.

Bombs are a vital part of the game as they enable players to take shortcuts and sometimes access items that are otherwise unavailble. If a player wishes to cover a brick with their chosen shape, they will need to spend a bomb. Bombs (like all items) are either collected or purchased.

Retro Hero is a truly unique dungeon crawling experience with up to 40 levels to choose from and 11 different shapes to dictate your every move. The player with the most points becomes the Ultimate Retro Hero!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Maze, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Temple Crush
description:
Two play modes, Co-op for 1+ players or Versus for 2+ players. Players venture into a collapsing temple to rob it of riches while trying to avoid being crushed by falling masonry blocks. Players move through the temple before pulling blocks from a bag that must be placed around the temple, moving other blocks aside to make way trying to gain a set amount of coins in Co-op or competing for the most in Versus mode.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Hieroglyphs
description:
Tableau Builder meets spatial puzzle. Position and manipulate dual purpose papyrus cards on your board for immediate rewards and long term goals.

In Hieroglyphs, players are trying to gain the most favor and points. To do this, players must play, position and move papyrus cards on their board. Cards are dual purposed. The top half have hieroglyph symbols that when placed in a specific order, will let players complete objectives from the Gods. The bottom of the card activates straight away and will either give points based on existing elements on their board, or give helpers for future turns.

On a player's turn they can do one of the following two actions:


Play a card on to their board from their hand or the central market.
Send a priest to a God to perform their game manipulating ability.


The player with the most points after the end game trigger occurs is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Variable Set-up

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Commemorative D-Day Command Group
description:
Lead your soldiers into battle by adding new officer ranks. With additional command and control capabilities, and tailored to provide leadership to your troops, adding platoon commanders offers new tactics and opportunities for your squads. Establish clear chain of command in multi-player games to help reduce the Fog of War.

US Paratrooper officer ranks include Majors, First Lieutenants and Second Lieutenants. German Light Infantry officer ranks include Hauptmen, Oberletnants and Leutnants. The 75th Commemorative Edition Command Group comes with:

2 US Paratrooper Officers carrying M1A1 Thompsons
1 US Paratrooper Officer carrying the M2 Carbine
2 German Light Infantry Officers carrying MP40s
1 German Light Infantry Officer carrying the Gw43
Commemorative Wooden case (holds 20 soldiers + 2 decks)


The Officers are uniquely generated in the same way as all other Sergeants: Miniatures Game soldiers. Each has the chance to be one of 3 different officer rankings. The lowest (and most common) is the Leutnant or Lieutenant, the next rank is the Oberleutnant/1st Lieutenant, and finally the highest possible rank (and least common) is the Hauptman/Captain. Each officer comes with a fully painted miniature and base, 1 Soldier Card, 1 Equipment Card and 14 Action cards for the Player Deck.

These officer cards add enhanced leadership abilities, tactics, and other capabilities to your squads albeit at a higher point cost.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Reise durch die Hauptstädte Europa's
description:
Reise durch die Hauptstädte Europa's. Unterhaltend und belehrend (Travel through the capitals of Europe. Entertaining and instructive)- board game published around 1910 by Heimchen Spiel
Nr. 4368.
It is typical, roll and move game about traveling through the capitals of Europe (40 stops) and following the rules, reading about the different cities.

name: DECO
description:
You and your friends take turns strategically placing randomly drawn tiles into a shared arrangement, in a race to finish the pattern goals and be the first to accumulate 16 points.

Pay attention to your opponent's goals - your strategy should include building your own patterns and slowing them down!
There are 54 pattern goal cards with varied degrees of difficulty worth 1, 3, 7 or 15 points.

The 66 unique tiles consist of colorful triangles that form the building blocks of the patterns. On the back of each tile is a symbol that indicates which of the three "Special Action" may be taken on that turn. Purple: you can draw another tile. Green: you can rotate a tile already in play. Orange: you can place the tile corner-to-corner, or move a tile stuck in the middle.

Each game is different, depending on the tactics you and your friends employ to assemble the patterns.

—description from the designer

name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Army Box
description:
The elite forces of the Luftwaffe are seasoned veterans infamous throughout the World of Dust for their courage, tactical skills, and heavy firepower. Fielding these fierce soldiers and modern equipment in battle makes the Luftwaffe one of the deadliest force on the planet, one that everyone rightfully fears.

This Army Box is a great way to expand your Luftwaffe force and is awesome with the Luftwaffe Starter Set (AX008) and the Luftwaffe Headquarters (AX433). All these combined will give you a great army! In this box you'll find:
- one Fallschirmjäger Tank-Hunter Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Fallschirmjäger Battle Squad (5 miniatures)
- one Fallschirmjäger Missile Squad (2 miniatures)
- one Geist (1 aircraft)
Even if these are Luftwaffe Units, they can be added to any Axis force, making it even deadlier!

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each Unit, for the Luftwaffe Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, these come already assembled and primed. They are ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Aleksei/Nadya
description:
Armed with two Gatling guns, the Aleksey (Tsh) is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. The Nadya (Tsh) is deadly at close range thanks to its powerful flamethrowers. This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: IS-48 A/B Super Heavy Tank Karl/Lavrentiy
description:
The IS-48 A “Karl” is a specialized close assault version of the new SSU heavy tank chassis. It mounts the biggest Tesla Gun available in the whole Bloc's arsenal, capable of tremendous damage to any ground target. The IS-48 B “Lavrentiy” is the all-around version of the new heavy tank chassis. It houses a powerful 152 mm gun which has proven to be a reliable and deadly weapon on many others SSU vehicles. Both variants of this tank bristle with extra weaponry and are amazing gun platforms capable of dealing with a huge range of targets.
This reference allows you to field one of these two tanks.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rally Point 9
description: A special study ASL Mapboards 7a/b, 8a/b and 9a/b. It includes 10 new scenarios from the Tampa ASL Group.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Robotech: Force of Arms – Grand Cannon Promo Expansion
description:
This is a 5-card promo expansion (including 1new "Ship" Card -ThevGrand Cannon. 1new Hero and Command Card for each Player

To use The Grand Cannon, replace the "Empty Space" Card from the main game and place The Grand Cannon Card in the center of the space sector during the Sey Up.

When the players move ships during the tactical phase of the game, the Grand canyon can be selected only as the second card to be moved. The Grand canyon can only switch places with a ship if it is orthodontically adjacent (Above, Below, Left, or Right)

Found in the back of Game Time Magazine handed out during Origins 2019.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Take That

name: Dust 1947: USMC Heavy Machine Gun Squad and Heavy Mortar Squad
description:
When the Allies Bloc was formed, all armed forces joined the grand Allied Army. Well except the United States Marine Corps who said thanks but no thanks. We're going to keep our name and our traditions and we'll welcome anyone who wants to join but we're going to remain the USMC.
This reference allows you to field one USMC Heavy Mortar Squad and one USMC Heavy Machinegun Squad.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, all for the USMC Faction of the Allies Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Operation Hellgate
description:
Nothing will be the same! Operation Hellgate, the aftermath of Operation Kondor, has started and concludes the Babylon cycle. A new force appears in the World of Dust, one that will change it forever! But new heroes rise, along with new technologies, to counterattack and defend maybe more than just their own Bloc now.

This new expansion for Dust 1947 describes the Mythos and Desert Scorpion forces, with new characters, vehicles, Platoons, etc. With the Operation itself come several short stories and great art by Daniel Zrom!

We also included a few things like missing unit cards and game tokens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Spetsnaz Natasha (TSH) / Anatoly (TSH)
description:
Armed with two Howitzers, the Natasha is a staple of SSU forces around the planet. This tropicalized variant is used by the dreaded Spetsnaz, who enjoy the firepower and versatility of this walker. With its Tesla guns, the Anatoly can engage even the heaviest targets. Such punch for such a light package make this walker a favorite of the Spetsnaz forces, who always need more of this rightly feared vehicle.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Spetsnaz Faction of the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Sturmluther/Stummel/Prinzluther
description:
The SturmLuther is a walker troop transport, with dedicated antiaircraft firepower. One of the safest ways to get to the battlefield! The Stummel also transport troops, but with firepower designed to attack enemy infantry and light vehicles. Finally the PrinzLuther is the command version build on this chassis. It is armed with a very versatile rapid firing gun.
This reference allows you to field one of these three variants.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, all for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Magda & Pink Flamingo
description:
A recovering pyromaniac, who also loves guns, Magda was a perfect match for the Mercenaries who sometimes have to go through crazy missions to get paid. And when crazy is on, Magda is on top of things. She has fought all over the World, on the hottest spots, making them even hotter every time, and she has no plans to stop. Her state of the art walker, the “Pink Flamingo”, is a one of a kind but its design his growing ever more popular within the Mercenary Companies.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, for the Mercenaries. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Wotan II / FlammLuther II / PanzerKampfLäufer III B/E
description:
Axis forces are facing more armor and heavy vehicles than ever before. Their enemies have surely caught up! These two up-gunned walkers are among the most powerful on the planet. They will tip the balance and make the Axis Army an unbeatable force once again.

This reference allows you to field one of three different walkers: the Wotan II and its AR variant, and the FlammLuther II. All are available for the Axis Bloc and the BlutKreuz Korps.
The Wotan II, and AR variant, mounts the heaviest Laser weapons available on the planet. It can engage enemy vehicles at great range and reduce them to smoldering heaps of metal in seconds. It also has two machineguns now, one dedicated to anti-infantry fire, the other also able to hit anything that flies.
An unusual weapon pattern for the Axis, the FlammLuther II excel at attacking entrenched enemies. With two flamethrowers, it is deadly to soldiers and can hurt any vehicle it might cross path with. It is also equipped with the same machineguns as the first two variants.

This reference comes with six Dust 1947 unit cards: two for the Wotan II (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction), two for the Wotan II AR (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction) and two for the FlammLuther II (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction). Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: PT-47B Plavayushchiy Tank-47
description:
Developed initially for special operations use, this amphibious troop transport ready vehicle is slowly becoming a staple of SSU forces around the planet. At the moment it can be mostly found with Spetsnaz and PLA forces, which make the most of its capabilities: the PT-47B can go nearly everywhere with a small group of soldiers. This version is equipped with powerful turret weapons that provide great fire support.

This vehicle comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards: one for the SSU Bloc, one for the Spetsnaz Faction and one for the PLA Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Awesome Monster Cuddle Party
description:
Super Awesome Monster Cuddle Party is a throwing card game with physical challenges for 2-6 players.

You’re all awesome monsters who just want to cuddle with the baby monsters! And why wouldn’t you, they’re so cute! So just when you see a baby cuddly monster you all just jump and end up making an amazing monster cuddle pile! The closest monsters get the most baby monster super cuteness and that’s really what everyone wants!

Each round players will throw one of their cards in an attempt to get it closest to the baby card. They will stand behind a marker card which shows an action all players must do as they throw their cards. If a players card lands action-side up the action on the card replaces previous actions and becomes the only action each player must do as they throw their card. If a player's card lands monster-side up they have a chance to win the game! After all players have finished throwing their cards, the player with the closest monster-side up card to the baby monster card wins!

-description from designer

name: Roll to the Rim
description:
A complete, fast-paced basketball experience with one standard d6 die. Features offensive layups, jump shots, three-point shots, and fouls. Defense is played on all shots other than free throws. A fun game with variable play length based on the time available—simply set the final score higher or lower for longer or shorter games. View instructions in the Files section below.

This game was created with the help of my 3-point shooting niece during a family vacation in Coronado, CA during the week of June 24, 2019.

—description from the designer

name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Roughnecks Army Book
description: Featured on recruitment adverts throughout the Federation, the Roughnecks have grown into a legend. From their first encounter with the Arachnids on Pluto to the Klendathu Invasion and beyond, the men and women of the Roughnecks have defended the Federation with their lives. Always at the centre of a campaign, the Roughnecks are a veteran unit of the Mobile Infantry. Adept at fighting Arachnids, they are capable of taking on dangerous missions and emerging victorious. The command squad, including Rico, Dizzy, Jenkins and their allies, contains some of the toughest and most experienced troopers found in the Mobile Infantry The Roughnecks has the following sections, detailing this new Mobile Infantry force. Using the Roughnecks: Complete rules for using the Roughnecks in a Mobile Infantry force, allowing you to use these veteran troopers in games of Starship Troopers as either a complete army or part of a much larger force. The Painting Guide: A section packed with photographs of painted Roughnecks bravely battling the enemies of Mankind. Includes a complete painting guide designed to get your own group of Roughnecks onto the table as quickly as possible. Characters: Details the most famous men and women to have served in the Roughnecks. The Roughnecks in Action: Two missions to try your hand at with this elite squad.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Renegade: Safe House Mission Promo
description:
A single promotional card for Renegade. The promo card introduces the MISSION mechanism, which dictates the setup and countermeasures faced by the Renegades, as well as some special instructions which affect gameplay between cycles. The back of the card also contains a story to give the mission some thematic context within the world of the Renegades.

This is a solo mission played by Monty Quantum only, against SMC Viking.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Orion's Spur
description:
Orion’s Spur is a starship battle game where you take command of a species’ fleet and show off your tactical superiority on the battlefield by defeating your opponents in combat.

Using your species's tactics and innate abilities, target your opponents ships to earn their worth in victory points. But be careful. Every species has their own tricks to minimize your damage or even counterattack! There are reinforcements on the way, but will they make it in time when you're low on energy and down to your last ship?

Stay strong and score the most victory points to prove your tactical skills are the best!

—description from the designer

name: Flower Garden
description:
Developed to be played with the Green Box of Games game system.

In Flower Garden you compete to create the most beautiful garden. Play your cards in the shop to acquire flowers, or use them to create beds to plant you flowers in. And make sure you get all your flowers planted, or they will dry out and reduce your score.

—description from the designer

name: Paper Against The Office (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
This is an Unofficial Expansion for a similar game. based on the much loved TV series, the Office. I made these cards in photoshop as a birthday gift for my wife and decided to share them with the world! Thousands of people have since enjoyed them!

It contains 180 original cards based on The Office TV show. (144 white, 36 black)

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Paper Against The Office 2 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
It's back! We have released PART 2 to our popular game Paper Against The Office!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

8 if the white cards are blank on the front so that you can add your own favorite office parts to your set!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Parks Against Recreation (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A brand new game from the creators of Paper Against The Office! Parks Against Recreation is the next great game you should have on your shelf at home!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Dryads VS Riches
description:
For generations humanity has ripped up and sawn down the forests of the world. The woodland elders always tell the saplings that patience is the way of the dryads and that their roots will cover the human's graves, but the sap is running high and some of the more hotheaded sprigs have decided to take matters into their own roots.

Players take the part of dryads trying to rob a bank with the roots by busting through the vault floor. Game play is based on drafting dice results to draw roots into the game board, seeking out the bank's money sacks. In competitive mode the dryads compete to gain the most money, or a co-op and solo mode sees them trying to claim the sacks before the humans remove them all.

It was created for and entered into the 2019 one page BGG design contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Environmental, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Vilar de Mouros 2019
description:
Vilar de Mouros 2019 is the 2nd expansion for Vilar de Mouros with 8 new cards (7 game cards and 1 bonus card).
One of the new game cards (Skunk Anansie) is an upgrade, so we recommend that you play without the original one.
With the 2 expansions, we have now 99 game cards and 20 bonus cards, so we recommend that all players begin with 2 more game cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Music
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: 18OR
description:
18OR is game about railroad investing in Oregon. Players invest in and operate railroad companies for profit or peril. Companies will lay railroad track, build routes, and run trains on while attempting to block rival companies from doing so. The player with the greatest wealth at the end of the game is the winner.

18OR is designed to be scalable and configurable. It comes with several different map sizes to support 2-8 players. Maps can be rearranged to create any scenario.

18OR is rather different from other games in the genera. Many of the components are the same but play differently.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Toofrippa's Krew: Orks Kill Team
description:
Even amongst the vainglorious ranks of the Flash Gitz, Kaptin Rezgil Toofrippa is renowned for his arrogant posturing. Yet the Ork’s cocksure self-confidence is well earned, because his krew of veteran mercenaries have fought their way across the galaxy, leaving blood and broken bones in their wake.

An expansion for Kill Team: Elites, this box includes 5 miniatures, a scenery set, a background booklet, as well as brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- 8-page Toofrippa’s Krew booklet
- 14 Orks Tactics cards (1 of which is exclusive to this set)
- 2 Mission cards designed for use with an Orks kill team
- 1 Orks Kill Team tokens sheet
- 5 Flash Gitz datacards
- 5 multipart plastic Flash Gitz miniatures armed with a variety of enormous snazzguns
- 1 set of Sector Sanctoris Ruins

This expansion requires a copy of the Kill Team Core Rules Manual and Kill Team: Elites to use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Battles for the Pacific
description:
The Pacific War, sometimes called the Asia-Pacific War, was the theatre of World War II fought in the Pacific and East Asia. It was fought over a vast area, which included the Pacific Ocean and islands, the South West Pacific, South-East Asia, and in China.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_War.

Battles for the Pacific is a low complexity, two player, turn-based war game, which is designed to reflect the key strategic and tactical aspects of naval and land warfare in the Pacific Theatre of Operations. The main combatants in the game are the military forces of Japan, and the United States of America and their allies.

This game is an entry in the 2019 Wargame Print and Play contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Middara: Trail of a Princess – An Opportune Tip
description:
An Opportune Tip is an Adventure Pack for 1-2 players. It's the first of a short series of adventures following Shayliss Arsen. To play Opportune Tip, players must already own both Unintentional Malum Act I and Pirates of Elenia Adventure Pack.

TIME IS OF THE ESSENCE
The situation in Hyde escalates as trusted allies become hideous new foes. As the rumors of death and treachery make their way to the capital, Shayliss takes matters into her own hand. A timely tip from Kajax sends Shayliss on a quest to find her missing sister and investigate what role Nightingale had during the events at Hyde.

WHAT ARE MICRO ADVENTURES?
Micro Adventures are shorter tales that fill in the gaps of the stories from the Core Games and Adventure Expansions. They represent all the stories happening behind the scenes. Each one plays a small part in the overall pictures of our narrative and world. They help to explain not only possible holes in the plot, but also to tie up events that transpire in other products. Unlike Adventure Packs, their larger counterpart, Micro Adventures contain only a single booklet of narrative and Encounters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: WWII Z Expansion #51 – R'lyeh
description:
There have always been disturbing tales of R’lyeh, what with one thing and another, and the war, they haven’t been investigated until now. I want you to take your men and find out what it’s all about. You and your soldiers of the Papuan Infantry Battalion land on the Island of R’lyeh off the New Guinea coast, little knowing what horrors and mind destroying terrors awaited you. Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn….

Your WWII Australian soldiers face the Japanese and the unknown. Some of the Hostiles are the scattered remnants of a Japanese force that is starving, diseased, and possibly going insane. Some of the hostiles are “Shadows” – these may be human or not, the player will only know at the end. The last of the hostiles are “Finds” that may give a clue to what is happening. Find enough clues, eliminate enough Shadows and the tales of R’lyeh may be explained in rational terms even if horrible. Fail and no amount of human firepower will defeat the Ancient Old Ones.

Warfighter WWII - Z Expansion - #51 R'yleh adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Soldier pack with new Hostiles, Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives, Weapons, Equipment, and Skills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Middara: The Cave Sickle Queen
description:
The Cave Sickle Queen Bounty Pack contains a Bounty Book, multiple new Initiative cards, new Combatants, a new Boss Monster, new Monster Loot, and hidden Item cards for you to uncover.

Whether you end up living triumphantly as heroes, or rotting away as dead memories written on the pages of history books. One way or another, Bounties will earn your party fame in Middara.

PERFECTION THROUGH ADVERSITY
Bounty Packs expand the Adventure Mode with insanely hard and uniquely diverse side quests. These Side Quests can be attempted at lower levels than the intended difficulty recommends for an even hard challenge.

Each Bounty Pack adds a side quest that can be attempted during specific moments of the Adventure Mode. The Bounties of Elenia line of Bounty Packs represent all of the horrible monstrosities that threaten the realms of Elenia.

Each Bounty Pack contains a plethora of new content. New tokens, a new Bounty Book, new miniatures, new tiles that expand old sets, new unique loot, new upgrades, as well as optional content to change the possible combatants that might spawn in the Unintentional Malum Core Game and Adventure Expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Drako Duell
description:
Promotional game for Kalev Candy Factory.

Collect the 10 Drako-figures per player from candy-packs, print out the cards and play.
Choose 5 cards for each game where each different type of Drako is connected with 2 other types, one is better and another is worse than the current type.
Players have 10 Drakos in duel. Each round players choose simultaneously one Drako-figure. The winning Drako continues the game. Losing Drako goes out.
The game continues until one player runs out of his/her Drakos.
Other player wins.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Print & Play

name: Even More! Trivial Pursuit Questions
description:
A book containing 1200 questions for use with Trivial Pursuit in the following categories:

Geography
Entertainment
History
Art & Literature
Science & Nature
Sport & Leisure
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Mondrain
description:
Object of the game: To capture the most pebbles.

Starting: Cards are shuffled and each player draws three cards. A card is drawn from the pile and placed in the middle face up. This will be the card that the first player builds on. Group chooses who will go first and players take turns going clockwise. Figure 1 below shows an example of a card being played on from the deck. Noticed that a pebble is placed on two overlapping red squares.

Cards: There are 80 cards made up of three colored squares per card. Cards are placed on top of each other so that at least one of the three squares on the card lays on top of another square of a card with the same color. Red squares can only go on top of red squares, blue squares can only go on top of blue squares, etc. More than one square can go on top of other squares if the squares laid on top of other squares matches the same color. If a player is unable to lay a card on top of another card then they are skipped to the next player. Figure 2 below shows how a card can be placed on top of two other cards.

Cards must also be able to match colors when adjacent sides are touching other adjacent sides. Figure 3 shows an examples of a card that is not acceptable because the yellow square does not match the red square.

Pebbles: Players draw from the pile of black pebbles when placing a pebble on a square. Only black pebbles are played on cards, white and red pebbles are used to reduce the number of black pebbles needed in a game. Black pebbles have a value of one point. Every time a player collects 5 black pebbles they turn them into the pile to replenish it and take one white pebble which is worth the 5 black pebbles. A red pebble is worth 10 black pebbles.

Pebble Placement: Where ever a card square overlaps another card square a pebble is placed on that square. Up to three pebbles can be placed in one turn if a card is placed that overlaps three squares of the same colors. Figure 4 shows an example of one card being placed on top of three other squares. Three black pebbles are placed on top of each square that matches.

Capturing Pebbles: Capturing is done by jumping pebbles. A pebble can jump another pebble as long as there is a space (square from a card) to jump into over a pebble. Pebbles can jump in any direction. Multiple jumps can be made in one turn as long as there is a pebble next to another pebble and a space to space to jump into. Figure 5 shows an example of jumps that can be made in one turn. There are other combinations to jumping than what is shown in Figure 5.

End of Game: The game ends when all the cards are used up from the deck and the player’s hands. Who ever has the most points in their pile wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: Plot Points
description:
You're a director and you've forgotten the names of your movies. You give the other players plot elements and they must guess what movie they’re referring to. You get more points if you can guess the movie with fewer clues.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Dragonfire: Character Pack – Heroes of the Underdark
description:
Character Expansion to Dragonfire
Contains Character Screens including new races and class combinations unique to the Underdark setting of Dungeons & Dragons.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Night's Watch Heroes I
description:
From Castle Black, the Night’s Watch guards the formidable Wall, which is used to protect all of Westeros from the horrors that lurk in the cold, dark, and foreboding northlands. Taken from the dregs and leftovers of society, there are those that rise through the ranks and achieve places of power within the team. These special men have some of their own power struggles, but in the end, they are all dedicated to making Westeros a (relatively) safe place to live.

The Night’s Watch Heroes I box gives Night’s Watch Commanders all manner of new options when creating their forces. With an array of Unit Attachments, a Non-Combat Unit, and options for new Commanders, the box can really change up the way a Night’s Watch army performs out on the battlefield.

-- description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: Afrika Army Korps
description:
Afrika Army Korps covers part of the battle for North Africa using the DAMOS rule-set and provides a solid way to experience the game under conditions radically changed from the Barbarossa series. Without having to worry about bogs, swamps and unreliable steppe, the desert becomes a tankers paradise.

Exclusive rules for movement, sea transport, logistics and more allow players to combine the Afrika Army Korps games with any other games in the DAMOS series in order to create either a mini-monster or linked campaign game. Using the classic AH Afrika Korps as inspiration, AFRIKA ARMY KORPS series offers a brand new take on the campaign at the strategic scale hex-size of 25 miles per hex. Combat is in hex and opportunities for encirclement abound for both sides.

Players can combine AAK, AAK II TORCH, and AAK III TUNISIA to simulate the entire North African campaign.

—description from the publisher

name: Beasts: Edge of Extinction – Argentavis Scavenge Promo
description:
Promo card given out at BGG con 2018 and with the Kickstarter.

Card reads: draw any two resource cards from the discard pile
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Moonstone: Blood Magic Troupe Box
description:
This troupe box includes 3 new fairy heroes of Dominion fraction.
This miniatures are made in fine quality resin. Every miniature requires assembly.

Diana, Queen of the Fae is a wizard fairy, that can drain life energy from allied fairy units to heal herself.
Foxglove is a wizard fairy that could protect allied forces and affects atrophy in enemy units.
Belladonna is alchemist and rogue fairy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Kampen om Stavanger
description:
Kampen om Stavanger is a card game where players are politicians trying to get political issues approved. First player to gain issues worth 10 swords is the winner. Each player starts with four political issue cards and one support card.

The game consists of 48 political issues cards worth 1-3 swords, and 21 support cards. The political issues come in four colors; red (collective issues), blue (market issues), green (environmental isues) and yellow (value issues). Each issue card comes with a price market at the top; in trying to get a political issue approved, the player has to sacrifice a number of red, blue, green and/or yellow cards from her hand.

In addition, the support cards represent different organisations who can give your proposal a supporting boost; media, taxi drivers, environmentalists, pub owners, the bishop etc. Support cards has a support value and a blocking value. Support cards can substitute a number of sacrificed issue cards.

On a player's turn, the player takes two actions, and chooses from

i) Draw three issue cards
ii) Look at opponent's hand and steal one issue
iii) Discard two issue cards and draw one support card
iv) Propose an issue and sacrifice the right number of cards (possibly with support).

In order to stop one player's proposal/issue, the other players can block it by

- collectively sacrificing the same number of issue cards sacrified by the proposer (support can replace issues, using the blocking value) AND
- using at least the same number of support cards.

Stavanger is the fourth largest city in Norway, and three vertical viking swords standing in stone is a commonly used city symbol. The first edition was printed in a total of 100 copies, as part of mayor candidate Eirik Faret Sakariassens (SV) campaign for municipal office in 2019.

The game can be purchased at thegamecrafter.com (Norwegian language only).

—description from the designer

name: Diwan
description:
Diwan is the first Persian adaptation of Mafia/Werewolves (Party Game), localized and redesigned by Bahamzi team.
It's been in the local market since 2016.
It includes 15 roles reconfigured based on Persian literature.
The graphics are also coming from traditional illustrations.
In Diwan, Div's are the informed minority and Pedestrians are uninformed majority.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Cypher Lords
description:
Rulers of the city-state of Nochseed, the Cypher Lords are masters of illusion and deception. They have gazed into the dark heart of Chaos and embraced its infinite madness.

Unleash madness, mayhem and utter anarchy on the battlefields of Warcry with the Cypher Lords! This warband set allows you to field these mysterious saboteurs in your games, containing:

8 multi-part plastic Cypher Lords miniatures - 1 Thrallmaster, 1 Luminate, 3 Mirrorblades and 3 Mindbound.
A Cypher Lords abilities card, allowing you to master the strange and deadly tricks of the Cypher Lords in your battles.
6 fighter cards for keeping track of your rules at a glance in games.


What’s more, these warriors of Hysh are available for use in your Warhammer Age of Sigmar army thanks to a free warscroll available in the Downloads tab.

This set is supplied with 1x 32mm round base, 4x 28mm rounds bases, and 3x 25mm round bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Idoneth Deepkin
description:
The mysterious aelves of the deeps emerge from the waves only to raid the lands of surface-dwellers. They seek not treasure nor coin, but the very souls of the living.

Unleash the sinister powers of the Idoneth Deepkin in Warcry with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to bring the mysterious reavers of the Mortal Realms’ oceans to your skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Namarti Thralls, Namarti Reavers, Ishlaen Guard and Morrsarr Guard.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Daughters of Khaine
description:
The Daughters of Khaine seek power through bloodshed. With every butchered foe they worship their murderous deity Khaine, and as gore splatters across their flesh they are driven into a rapturous killing frenzy.

Slaughter your way across the battlefields of Warcry in the name of Khaine with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set lets you bring the bloodthirsty Daughters of Khaine to your skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you unleash deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Khinerai Lifetakers, Khinerai Heartrenders, Witch Aelves, Sisters of Slaughter, Blood Stalkers and Blood Sisters.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Wordmaster
description:
Increase vocabulary and word skills with WORDMASTER, a board game for players from early school age through adult.

Players earn points by correctly spelling, defining, identifying the part of speech and using the word on each card. Six degrees of challenge and achievement are built into color-coded cards. For individual or team play. (Play may be limited by time or number of turns.)

The Home Version of WORDMASTER is designed to allow participation by all family members, with three separate words on each card. These three groupings are for: children under 12, teens and adults.

School versions of WORDMASTER are designed for use in all grade levels.

Additional Word Card sets are available for different occupational specialities and special interests. The unique magnetic game board and magnetic playing pieces facilitate play and may be utilized with any Word Card set.

WORDMASTER has been developed from appropriate curriculum sources to provide a game that is both fun and exciting to play, as well as educationally rewarding.

name: L'Ombre de l'Aigle: The Shadow of the Eagle – Volume 4: The Franco-Prussian War
description:
Strategic game on the 1870 war, using the same game system that the Flight of the Eagle series.

Focused on the first phase of the war. Also includes a "fast system" that can be used in face to face or via an umpire.

Units for all divisions are provided as counters for the strategic part, and as units per corps for the umpire-mediated game.

—description from the designer

name: Luftwaffe: RAF Bomber Command Expansion
description:
Adding the RAF Bomber Command campaign to Luftwaffe.

Rules and unmounted counters inside the magazine.

Mounted counters are separately available.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: 數數小貓 (Count Cats)
description:
數數小貓 (Count Cats)

The second game in its series on fun math boardgames. A educational math game for 2-4 players of aged 4 or above. It is a ladder climbing card game with cards of 1 to 4 cats. The objective is to get rid of all hand cards. Young players can learn simple additions of card combinations through playing this game. It is a family friend game with 50 cards in a tin case.

—user summary

■商品簡介

一玩再玩，提高反應力，訓練好腦力
加法運算 x 快速反應 x 邏輯思考 x 趣味分享

透過遊戲方式，讓孩子自然而然建立數學中「近似值」的概念、練習數數、訓練加法；在比賽的過程中，思考如何讓自己獲勝！

遊戲人數：2～4人
遊戲時間：15分鐘

★訓練加法，培養數學基礎運算能力。
★遊戲規則簡單易懂，四歲以上都會玩。
★遊戲中啟發孩子的互動力、專注力。
★鐵盒收納方便攜帶，隨時隨地都能玩。

—description from the publisher

name: RAMO
description:
Ramo is a game that has the best parts from Contract Rummy, Mahjong and Uno combined, hence the name RAMO.

The object of the game is to have the least amount of points after playing the 8th level.

For each hand, each player's object is to complete and lay down his/her current level’s requirement, and then rid their hand of remaining cards by discarding them on laid-down levels, called "expanding". The player who does this first wins the hand and scores minus fifty; all other players earn penalty points according to the value of cards remaining in their hand.

In each round the players reduce the value of the cards held in their hands by laying on the table those cards that fit the requirement of his/her own level which consists of Sets and Runs.


A Set consists of three or four cards, all different colored
A Run consists of three or more cards in sequence, all same colored
The 13th card can be used in the middle when making Runs (eg: 12-13-1)


There are 60 cards in one deck, and two decks are used in a 3 or 5-player game, three decks for more players:

52 numbered cards: each valued from 1 to 13, in four different colors.
two Wild cards
one Skip card
one -1 card
two x2 cards
one +3 card
one ? card


The Deal

The first player (dealer) shuffles the deck and before dealing, the next player “cuts” the deck, the dealer then deals 13 cards to the next player, and 12 cards to the rest of the players, the remaining cards are placed face down in the center of the table to form the Draw Deck, the player with the 13 cards in hand discards one card from his/her hand to start a Discard Pile, then the game continues counter-clockwise.

Gameplay

On each turn, a player:

Draws either the face-up top card of the Discard Pile or one card from the deck.
May lay down their completed round-appropriate collection of Sets and Runs.
May play off other players who have laid down once they have laid down themselves.
May discard one card from their hand onto the discard pile. When a player discards a card that could have been played off on their own or another player's laid cards is a "Ramo". Only players that are LAID DOWN may call out Ramo. The FIRST player to call Ramo must take the discarded one card to make a new Set or Run, or expand any laid down cards in the game even if it’s not his/her turn. The regular counter-clockwise order of turns may be interrupted for Ramo if the player who calls Ramo is not directly after the discarder (in order of play), one or two players will essentially miss their turn as play continues counter-clockwise from the player who calls Ramo. If multiple players call Ramo for a discarded card, priority for the discard goes to the player who calls out Ramo first.


Play continues, in alternating turns, until one player goes out, or has no cards left in their hand. A player goes out when he successfully discards the only remaining card in hand, marking the conclusion of the step for all players.

It is customary to announce other players when there is only one card left in your hand. This alerts other players of closeness to going out. Points are tallied and recorded by a score-keeper. All of the cards are shuffled and the next round of play commences. Whoever has the most amount of scores (penalties), deals the next round (Level).

Level requirements:

two sets
one set and one run
two runs
three sets
two sets and one run
one set and two runs
three runs
four sets or four runs


Scoring:
Five points for each card remaining in hand with value 1-9
Ten points for each card remaining in hand with value 10-13
Twenty points for each Special Card remaining in hand

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Spy Code: Hackathon
description:
A game where players must work together to decode the console.

One player acts as the hacker, or operator, who directly interacts with the top-secret console. The other players are the advisors, who must decipher the challenges on the advisor cards, then tell the hacker how to break into the different modules. The advisors can look at the cards, but not the Hackathon console. The hacker can look at the console, but not the cards.

There are eight advisor cards, and each card has a series of puzzles and brainteasers on it. The advisor cards are divided among the advisors at random. The advisors must complete the challenges on the cards, and then will get a set of instructions to read out loud to the hacker. Since the hacker cannot see the card with his or her own eyes, the hacker must rely solely on verbal instructions from the rest of the squad as to which buttons to press and which switches to turn to open the console.

The console has a timer on it, and the team must break through successfully before the alarm goes off. Players can set the timer to whatever amount of time they’d like, with a minimum of 1 minute and a maximum of 20 minutes.

If the team is able to decode all the modules successfully in the set time, the team wins.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Puzzle, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Empire (Second Edition)
description:
A complete rulesbook and reference source to the Napoleonic Wars 1796-1815. Written by Scotty Bowden

Second Edition Printings

First - May 1977
Second - July 1977
Third - January 1978

name: Gravity Falls Sugoroku
description: This is a simple Japanese board game called “SUGOROKU”, which is similar to Candyland, in that players move their piece from start to finish, collecting cards as they go. The goal of the game is to collect Journals 1, 2, and 3 while reliving key events from the television series before reaching the end-of-summer 13th birthday party for Mabel and Dipper.

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Fisher King Promo
description:
This promotional expansion adds the Fisher King to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes a miniature of the Fisher King and a link to his card to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Jurassic Snack: Kangoudocus Promo Card
description:
A new card that allows you to play with a new rule and a different tiles setup.
New rule: Before or after a standard move, your diplodocus can jump above any other diplodocus (the target space must be empty).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Jurassic Snack: 4-in-a-Rex Promo Card
description:
A new card that allows you to play with new rules and a different tiles setup.
New rule: A third way to win the game. If you align your 4 diplodocus in a horizontal or vertical straight line of 4 contiguous space, you immediately win!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: For the Kingdom
description:
We write the second age in the year 160.
It all began with a prophecy interpreted by the oracle in the capital, Skjellsburg.
The village Dorntal was the center of the action. Unfortunately, the idiom was the prophecy
unclear and therefore difficult to interpret.
The King therefore gave magician Ilidor the order to speak a spell wards of protection to the Village to protect the kingdom from possible dangers.
Dorntal was a small village where everyone knew each other. There was a nice market around the playhouse with delicacies from the entire kingdom. Down by the river lived the fishermen, carpenters, blacksmith and several other artisans. During the day, people in the village went to work and in the evening they met at the inn to dine and play together. The fire crackled in the fireplace of the tavern and the people told each other Candlelight stories, genuine and invented, exciting and funny. And everyone listened. It was a nice feeling to be a part of this village community

Unfortunately, this inner and outer peace did not last long.

Due to a failed magic experiment Ilidors in the black tower, this protective magic weakened. The magician Illidor could do nothing more. He turned away from Dorntal and left the black tower at dawn the next day. A note on the wooden door with the words "Portals, Chaos, II-260, Save Yourselves !!!" was the only one what he left behind. What did Ilidor want to say with that? Had Illidor been able to decode the prophecy? Would the protective magic completely collapse in the second age in 260?
Even the dwarfs, elves, and other races now spoke in fear of the imminent end.

In For the Kingdom, players assume the role of one of the backward houses in the village of Dorntal. By inserting the individual workers, different actions are played out. The mining of raw materials, the procurement of money, the improvement of the workers or the hiring of Heroes are dedicated solely to defending Dorntal and protecting the kingdom. In Farek's Forge, magnificent items can be forged to fight within and outside Dorntal. Face different Quests. Some Quests can be done alone, but others can be done together. The player with the most points wins. However, if the village is damaged / loses morality too much, you lose the game together. But beware: Humans, Orcs, Dragons or Goblins lurk dangerously around Dorntal. The sun sinks on the horizon with increasing speed, so hurry up! It is time: for the people, for the king, FOR THE KINGDOM!

—description from the designer

name: Monster's Den
description:
The players are trapped in the monster's den, and need to find the exit...but the monster is hunting for them, and the cave is dark. Will they find the exit?

Monster's Den is a single card game made by Marco Caloi for a single card game design contest. It is a dexterity party game for 4+ players where teams of 2 players, run from the monster player trying to reach the position of the exit card.
One card and one minute of hectic action and screaming.

—description from the publisher

name: Ace of Math
description:
Ace of Math is a competitive card game that uses the manipulation of numbers and math equations which are addition, subtraction, multiplication and division as to construct simple and complex math expression to complete certain objectives. The card game enables the players to compete with each other as to fulfill objectives, such that in the end to become the winner. The implementation of game-based learning helps to motivate players to practice solving simple to complex math problem in a non-threatening and engaging environment. The card game helps to cultivate players’ potential in exploring the knowledge in math as well as their soft skills while completing the objectives of the game. The card game can be played from two to four players and suitable for 7 years of age and above through the engaging, non-threatening, playful, and competitive environment created by the card game itself. The biggest part of the gameplay requires the players to play the game which involve the elements of discussions, decision making and information.

—description from the designer

name: Dziewięć światów
description: A cooperative quiz game which helps teach children about the Nordic mythology. Players have to work together, travelling through the titular Nine Worlds, and answering the questions correctly in order to put the terrifying wyrm Nidhögg back to sleep, before the monster topples the World Tree Yggdrasil and everyone loses.

name: MeepFrog
description:
MeepFrog is a fast, artisanal microgame of leaping Meeples on a pond, featuring all cloth and hardwood components.

It's a leapfrog match between red and blue! Use your side’s standing Meeples on the shore to jump over Meeples floating on the pond to score. Place yours in rows to score big, and place your opponents' in disadvantageous positions! Wild Meeples will block your path until returned to the bag, and Refresh Meeples will cause you to return any others to the bag. Score 5 Meeples of your color first to win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Building

name: And Time Passes
description:
In this game for 1 to 2 players, you have to manage your time to be the most productive player without exhausting yourself. Both players share opposite sides of the same timeline causing your actions to affect the other player and vice versa. Each card has 4 productive activities and 4 resting activities; placing these cards beside, on top of, and underneath each other will allow you to bump up your productive score while keeping the other player as unproductive as possible. Will you master time management or will you exhaust yourself trying?

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Manicure Hero
description:
All's fair in love and nails...

Have you ever wanted to dip a well painted toe into the seedy underbelly of the nail salon business?

In Manicure Hero, you and up to 5 friends take on the role of nail stylists competing for the most tips! Beware rip-off artists and your fellow stylists.
In this light card, players take turns planning v cards from their hand face down into rows which represent different nail salons that the players are freelancing at. Cards that they can place include tip cards, action cards, rip-off cards, and their unique character card. One all cards are laid down, cards are turned face up and scored. The more tip cards in your character's row the higher your score. If two or more players share a row, tips are divided evenly. The player with the most tops after three rounds in the winner!

—description from the designer

name: Sweet Piety!
description: In Sweet Pietyyy, players are residents of a small village and are trying to prevent "vamPIEre" from eating their desserts. Each player will have a different eating pattern according to their identity, and the goal of the game is to hold pie parties around the clock to deduct which team each player belongs to. If his eating times line up in a cross on the clock, then he might be a vamPIEre! A light and innovative social deduction game for 4-8 players that can be played within 20 minutes.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Negotiation, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Brainbox: Science
description:
Science is cool, and this brilliant BrainBox Science covers important topics taught to children aged seven to eleven, from life cycles to light, healthy plants to the human body, magnets to materials. This game has been developed by an experienced primary school science teacher, is suitable for all ability levels and is great fun!

Brainbox is an innovative Memory Recall game. It consists of picture cards, with questions on the reverse. Players are given 10 seconds to look at the picture, and then try and answer questions on the reverse of the card.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Brainbox Science is ideally suited to kids aged 8 and up. It makes a fantastic family game, and can be easily taken on evenings out, or family holidays!
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Vanguard of War: Heroes Vs Zombies
description:
Heroes vs Zombies is a 1-6 player variant ruleset for the Vanguard of War (VoW) tower defense miniatures game. A brave group of heroes must take up arms yet again to face a new threat, as armies of the living dead march toward Fateera. Players will place turrets, explore the terrain to find deadly weapons, and use an array of skills and abilities to hold the line against the Zombie Queen, Morrigan, and prevent her undead legion from reaching the city.

—description from the designer

name: Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game
description:
The Korowai are a real ancient tribe that has lived in West Papua for centuries. Isolated from modern world, they live their life using primitive tools and method. Hunting wild boars, fishing and eat sago as their main food source. They build their house at the top of the trees to avoid wild beasts in the night. Korowai also believe in spirits and God, so they have festival, myths, and folktales that honor around their Gods.

Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game is a game about survival and adventure of Korowai tribesman. Player will become a tribesman that will hunt, farm, and logging for the live of their tribe. While they must avoid any danger, wild beast, hazards, or any catastrophic event they encounter.

Korowai is a push your luck game in its essence. While adventuring, players will open a card in adventure deck. Then, simultaneously player must decide to play their top card deck, their hand, or pass. There is some good cards and bad cards in their deck depending on the adventure card they encounter in that round. After 9 to 12 adventure cards, player will be back to their village. In the village player must eat their hunts, build their house, gain a new skill, and participate in the festival.

Player who have the most Experience Points, will become the next chieftain of the village and wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Socianimals
description:
Socianimals is a card game about animals and families. The main goal of the game is to collect as many animals of the same family as you can. The more animals in the same family you collect the more points you score.
Every player starts with 5 cards in its hand. Every turn a player takes a card from a covered common deck (thus reaching 6 cards in hand) and then must play a card.

Once a card (an animal) is on the table another player can take it only if he has an animal of the same family. Once a player take a couple of animals from the same family those 2 cards must be put covered near the player who took them and they are part of his/her deck points.

Special cards can be played to steal/block/protect animals family(a couple or more couple of the same family).

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Doomseeker: Gotrek Gurnisson Promo
description:
Included in White Dwarf magazine.

Adds popular character Gotrek Gurnisson as a slayer card. His ability states 'When you fight a doom, if its strength is more than double your own strength, you win the fight if you roll a 5 or 6, regardless of total strengths.'
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Wilah!: Waste Sorting Educational Card Game
description:
Wilah is an educational card with environment theme. Suitable for children, lecturer, environmentalist, or parent who want to teach about how to sort the waste. Wilah can be played by 2-6 player with age 7 and above for 5-15 minutes per game. Wilah involve player's cognitive aspect to sort the waste based on the material and involve player's motoric aspect.

To play, deal the deck out as evenly as possible to every player. Make sure the card remain unrevealed. One by one, each player take the topmost card and stack it to the place that reachable for every player. Under certain condition, player will slap the card and shout "Wilah!". These conditions are :


If three cards show the same color or waste category
If two cards show the identical image
If one card show waste processing or trashbin


The first player that succeed to slap and shout "Wilah!" can keep all the card with the same category or color as that player slap can. Those card counted as coin. Player with the most coin win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Les Rois Francs: Roncevaux
description:
A la charge is a an introductory level tactical medieval wargame.

A la charge: Roncevaux offers 3 scenarii for Les Rois Francs
Roncevaux 778 - the Death of Roland
Roncevaux 812 - the last submission of Pampelune
Roncevaux 824 - independence of the Basque country

It includes a map(A4) and 18 counters

Ownership of Les Rois Francs(VV 100) is needed to play this scenario and it is recommended to use the rules from Furor Barbarus (VV109)

As with other A la Charge wargames, Zone of Control, hex to hex moves, command, long range fire and close combat (melee), morale checks and retreats are used.

A battle lasts between 30-60 mins
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Fate of Battle: Look, Sarge, No Charts – Napoleonic Wars
description:
Buck’s first real wargaming love was the Napoleonic Wars. This is his third set of published Napoleonic rules. Battles for Empire was designed for those Empire-sized games. Wellington Rules was designed for much smaller games, in which players commanded brigade. Fate of Battle is designed for larger games in which which players command one or more divisions. Like all the Look, Sarge family of rules, this game moves!

Fate of Battle is the most complex of the Look, Sarge family. We’ve worked hard to remain true to the fell of the series, but we’ve incorporated formations, skirmishing, and other period feel. You’ll get the paper, scissors, rock of infantry, cavalry, and artillery in columns, lines, and squares.

Many gamers are turned off by the Napoleonic Wars. Years of pedantic, plodding, overly complex rules and the angry rules lawyers those systems seem to attract have convinced many gamers we know that the Napoleonic Wars cannot be fun to game. Members of our gaming club who have sworn off the period enjoy these rules and play them regularly.

—description from the publisher

name: Super Computer
description: A card-drafting and tableau-building game. Players receive a hand of cards, each turn they select one, play it face up in front of themselves, and pass the remaining ones to the player on their left. Cards must be connected in a grid to build a super computer. Black connections are wild, all other connections on the cards must match an identical connection. Cards that cannot be connected are placed in a personal discard pile, and generate negative point. Each player's computer is scored at the end of each round. The game lasts 3 rounds.

name: Isle of Skye: Peças Promocionais
description:
These promos were offered for preordering the Brazilian version of the game. There were later distributed by the publisher at conventions.
It contains promos published earlier – the Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 Promo Tiles (2015) and the Kennerspiel des Jahres Promo Tile (2016) – along with a new accessory: an alternative first player marker, alluding to the Kennerspiel des Jahres prize, created as a way to honor the game and its awards.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Catch the Leader, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Road to Riches
description:
Road To Riches is an updated and enhanced version of the award-winning Bulls & Bears board game. It has been developed in collaboration between Mario Fischel, Ph.D., a former senior economist at the World Bank, and Krishan Puvvada, Project Lead, Education at Financial Times. Road To Riches has been successfully tested with students in the UK.

Road To Riches is not only a fun and challenging game – it’s a full-fledged ‘Managing Money 101’ course! Our program also includes quick and easy-to-digest instructional videos, a guidebook on personal finance, and lesson plans for classroom use. Together, they form a crash course in personal finance that turns newcomers into masters, helping them win the game and at life!

Players start out with $100,000 cash, roll the dice, and proceed around the board. Spaces on the board correspond to different life events such as getting paid a salary, going on vacation, or picking from the three decks of cards that sit at the center of the board. The three decks of cards are: news flashes, knowledge cards, and wild cards. Newsflashes provide a news story, and players must buy and sell investments accordingly in order to win or lose money. Users may accept advice from other players for a shared win or loss in the investment. Knowledge cards are multiple choice cards that teach users key finance information that will be used in the game and life. Wild cards are life events that will cause the loser to win or lose money depending on whether or not they own the right assets. To win, a user must double their money.

—description from the publisher

name: ArcWorlde: Battle For Troll Bridge
description:
"News of a Bayourk warband plaguing the Hobbleshire town of Milwood summon a garrisoned Albionnican warband accompanied by the local Halfling Militia. They find the villainous Bayourk tribe taking residence upon the infamous Troll Bridge, spoiling for a fight.

However, on hearing a mighty roar, the local Halflings shake with fear, for they know how the bridge earned it’s name. Old Grogg, the largest River Troll ever seen, emerges from beneath, and he is not happy that his slumber has been disturbed..."

'Battle for Troll Bridge' is a four player starter box for the 32mm fantasy Skirmish game 'ArcWorlde'.
