In the third phase you use your dice and place them on the relevant areas of the Mars hub. You can explore the Martian environment, Research samples you’ve collected, develop components you need to upgrade your hub, heal your astronaut or attempt to keep the hub functioning properly.

In the fourth phase, if you haven’t managed to focus on keep the hub functioning you will have to resolve any issues that have developed by rolling on the relevant tables.

Finally, there is a refresh phase where you prepare for the next day on Mars.

Most Missions last between 10-15 rounds and if you complete the Mission objectives in the timeframe you win! However, beware, if your astronaut dies, or the hub is damaged beyond repair you will lose.

An entry into the 2020 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Character Pack 3: Animal Companions – A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderlands
description:
This third character pack adds new characters to your Five Leagues campaign, namely Animal Companions.

Your heroes can now bring along a fierce lizard, a trusty hunting dog, a trained bird of prey...or maybe a disinterested cat?

Both dogs and lizards can advance in experience and new skills are provided to help get the most out of these critters.

Suitable for any Five Leagues campaign and module, you do not need anything but the core game rules to use this content.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: SP WATERPOLO
description:
It's a game of statistical professional waterpolo, one of the oldest olympic games.

The game recreates an entire waterpolo match, divided in quarters. Each player in water has individual statistics of shot, defence, foul, steal, block, save.

Each team is deployed in three lines: 5-meter line, 2-meter line and goal line using two special half pool boards split up in boxes.

In an attacking action a team can restart, pass or shot on goal: defender team apply their malus on shot.

The entire game is driven by 136 FAC (Fast Action Cards - two decks of 68 cards each). No dice requested.

Current set of teams available:
Olympic Games Rio 2016 - Men

The game is free to print and play. In English

name: Dive Master Card Game
description:
The Dive Master Card Game allows you and your buddies to experience the world of Scuba Diving. The first player to complete their dive safely wins and earns the title of Dive Master! Each player needs to descend to 30 metres and then resurface using the specific cards. You must try to distract your opponents and attempt not to get slowed down by obstacles / attack cards thrown by the opposing players.

There are 8 types of cards - Start Descent, descending down number cards (1/2/3/5/10), Start Ascent, Ascending up number cards (1/2/3/5/10), Safety Stop, Skip a turn cards, Attacks and Immunity. The deck has 210 game cards and 2 extra blank cards.

—description from the designer

name: World of Motor Racing: 24 Hours at Le Mans
description: Sold as a stand-alone game, and also as the 5th chapter of “The World of Motor Racing” game system. The game allows players to recreate historic races at Le Mans since 1964 through 2006. Players will use statistical ratings of historic drivers and historic automobiles that actually competed in the real-life races.

name: Slaughterville II: The Cult Invades 2
description: An 18 card expansion bringing the darkness of a hidden cult into Slaughterville. These cards are added to their location decks for an increased challenge.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Desolate: Knuckles Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Desolate that came in the game box for StoneFire, from the same publisher. It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

Card name: KNUCKLES
Card picture: Brass Knuckles
Card text: "Whenever you are attacking with your bare hands, you deal 2 damage instead of 1."
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction

name: Flipway
description:
Flipway is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white.



PlayTo start, Black places a black stone on an empty point. From then on, starting with White, the players take turns. On your turn, you must perform exactly one of the following actions:


Drop: Select a 2x2 area including one or more empty points, such that no other 2x2 areas include all those empty points as well as at least another empty point. Then place a stone of your color on each empty point in the selected area.



Flip: Replace the two enemy stones in a crosscut with stones of your color. A crosscut is a 2x2 area of the board containing two diagonally adjacent black stones and two diagonally adjacent white stones.


You win by completing a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color. Draws are not possible.



Variants
Pie: To start, Black places between one and four black stones on different points of a 2x2 area of the board. The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means White will have the option, on their first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.



Checkered: The game starts with the board fully covered with black and white pieces in a checkered pattern. On odd-sized boards, the two possible checkered setups may be used. If the pie rule is used, Black starts by replacing one or two white stones in a single crosscut with black stones. Otherwise, Black starts by replacing any white stone with a black stone.



2x2 checkered: Same as checkered, but the initial checkered pattern is made of 2x2 blocks of same-color stones.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Planet 28: Death Machines
description:
Death machines is an expansion for Planet 28 that lets you add vehicles to your miniature conflicts.

In this book you’ll find all the rules you need to build,

arm and battle with mechanical monstrosities,
gargantuan battle tanks,
ramshackle jetbikes
and everything in-between!


Will you build a technological terror that grows more powerful from game to game, or will your creations go up in smoke?

There’s only one way to find out...

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Slaughterville: The Cult Invades
description:
The Cult Invades is an expansion based on the single-player, choose your own adventure game District-Z: The Cult. This expansion brings the dangers of the Cult into Slaughterville showing how they have been in the background working this whole time.

Adding these cards to your Location decks will increase their difficulty and variety.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Ultracombat Modern: Skirmish Combat Rules
description:
Bring the frantic action, the individual heroics and the weapons of modern-day combat to your tabletop with Ultracombat Modern.

These rules are an easy to play, fast-paced. A set of wargames rules for depicting the harsh realities of conflict as it occurs in modern warfare.

As a player, you can choose to play at the Platoon level, Squad level or Fireteam level. The system allows players to select the scale of the conflict they wish to represent. This means the rules work for small tactical Special Forces style games up to more substantial Platoon based combat.

Players are rewarded for using modern tactics, can call in off-table assets and field vehicles up to and including even the most effective Main Battle Tanks (MBT).

Ultracombat Modern provides players with everything they need to recreate 20th and 21st-century conventional warfare conflicts, whether real or imagined.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Highway 375
description:
Highway 375 is a competitive car racing game for 2-6 players. Take on the role of vintage Hot Rod enthusiasts in a race around the infamous Area 51 in Nevada, along the stretch of road known as The Extraterrestrial Highway. The game features hand management, movement cards and checkpoints along with a challenge stage in the form of a drag racing strip. Players must balance their inventory of Food, Fuel and Money as they travel the circuit and compete for the prize. Featuring licensed brands such as STP, Moroso and Crane Cams, with a vintage styling to give the game a classic feel.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Race

name: The TimeKeeper
description:
The TimeKeeper is a hand management card based game for 2-5 players, featuring a unique two-piece rotational board. Players collect crystal cards of different values to power their TimeKeeper device. Wisdom scrolls can be used as variable player powers to alter gameplay. Time Keys are used to move the TimeKeeper device forward or backwards in time, altering the relationship of the crystal cards values to the board. The game ends when the first person completes their device, but the winner is the player with the highest value cards for each of the different crystal types.

-description from designer

name: Staatsgreep
description:
In Staatsgreep ("Coup") players battle for control of five countries (Russia, USA, UK, France and China). Players start with 3 country cards each, and gain a new one each round or attack another player to gain their cards. Attacking can be done by showing another player 1 or 2 cards from a single country and 'attack' a different country, or the same. Once a player gets all five country cards they take control of that country. Once you control 2 countries you win the game (3 if you play with 2 players).

—description from the designer

name: United States v. Aaron Burr
description:
Many events in American history have been labeled "trials of the century", but for a young nation, it would have been impossible to top United States v. Aaron Burr. Unlike Washington, Jefferson, Madison or Hamilton, Aaron Burr came from American royalty — a founding father descended from the original puritanical stock that arrived in Plymouth. His father was the second president of Princeton. His grandfather was Jonathan Edwards, the philosopher-theologian who wrote "Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God," perhaps the most important American literary work of its time.

So in 1776, if you were going to identify any of the Founders who would later stand trial for treason to his country, Aaron Burr would be the least likely — yet Burr's journey as an enormous talent born under a dark star is now well known. Less well understood is that when he shot Alexander Hamilton in the early morning hours of July 11, 1804, it would set in motion a chain of events much more bizarre than anything depicted on Broadway.

Aaron Burr never stood trial for killing Alexander Hamilton in a duel. His trial was for treason, three years later, at the insistence of the Thomas Jefferson, the man Burr had narrowly lost to in the contested election of 1800. An embittered and politically ruined Burr seemed to have developed a scheme to separate the new Louisiana Purchase territories from the United States and declare himself king over the new entity. When Jefferson learned of the plot, he ordered Burr's arrest and publicly declared him guilty of treason.

United States v. Aaron Burr: The Treason Trial of America's Third Vice President, a card-driven game for two players, recreates the treason trial of Aaron Burr in Richmond in 1807. But by accident of recent judicial reforms, Thomas Jefferson's detested cousin, Chief Justice John Marshall, would be riding circuit and would preside over the case. The resulting legal contest would read like a list of who's who of America's Founding Fathers.

United States vs. Aaron Burr is a fast-playing card-driven game in which players seek to use events, evidence, and witnesses of Burr's activities to convince a jury to return a guilty verdict — or if playing for the defense, persuade at least one juror to find Aaron Burr not guilty. Each round, players have the opportunity to question witnesses, persuade jurors, and make points of law to the Chief Justice which will aid them in their cause. The game highlights all the events and participants surrounding one of the most important trials in American Constitutional Law — setting the precedent that the President of the United States is NOT immune from legal court orders, a precedent very much cited by the Supreme Court today.

So try your hand as a great litigator in a great trial. Perhaps you will even find yourself smiling more and talking less!

name: Flames of War: Ghost Panzers – German Forces on the Eastern Front 1942-43
description:
Ghost Panzers centres on the action around Operation Citadel, also known as the Battle of Kursk.

It was here in July 1943, that one of the war’s largest tank battles took place, with over 2450 German tanks and assault guns.

As the ground hardened after the muddy Russian Spring, the German army prepared to launch their Summer offensive, codenamed Operation Citadel. The target was Kursk, a city in the center of a huge bulge in the front line, where several Soviet armies could be cut off and destroyed.

To ensure success, new weapons were rushed to the front, including Ferdinand heavy tank-hunters and Panther medium tanks. These were combined with several panzer and panzergrenadier divisions, totaling an impressive 2,450 tanks and assault guns. Over 3,600 Soviet tanks were waiting for them, setting the scene for the largest tank battle on the Eastern Front...

Inside this book, you'll find:

• Background on the German Army in 1943, the Third Battle of Kharkov, and the great summer offensive at Kursk.

• Instructions on how to build a Panther Company, Mixed Panther Company, Armoured Panzergrenadier Company, Tiger Heavy Tank Company, and a StuG Assault Gun Company.

• A detailed painting guide.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: カッパたん (Kappa tan)
description:
カッパたん (Kappa tan) is a Japanese game with water.

In Japanese folklore, there is a Yokai called Kappa. Kappa is small humanoid that lives in rivers and waterways. The top of its head is formed like a crown or a dish, and the Kappa must keep water in it to stay healthy. If the Kappa spills or dries out, it suffers and dies.

In this game, the Kappa is an inverted paper cut with the base cut into the crown. Players take turns to add water to the crown using straws. A player dips the straw into a glass of water, puts their finger on the open end, and draws the straw out. Then they put the straw to the crown and release the water. The next player does the same and so forth.

Gradually the crown fills, until only surface tension is holding the water in. Eventually, a player adds enough water to break the surface and the water spills, and that player loses.

The crown design means that it takes a surprising amount of water to break. Players start taking up less and less water, and the other players mock their lack of nerve.

The game was originally hand-made and as well as a full sized Kappa, the game also has a mini Kappa for a quicker result. The game can be played by young children and adults alike.

In 2019, a professional version was made by itten, Kappa Bros!.
user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Real-Time, Single Loser Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: The Manipulator: Five Parsecs Character Pack 3
description:
The Manipulator is Character Pack 3 for Five Parsecs From Home and introduces a new character type to your campaigns.

The tentacled Manipulators offer a character with interesting quirks in combat and the potential to earn additional Story Points, but vulnerable to those close combat brutes that fringe space tends to be filled with.

This new character type can be fitted into any campaign, whether you are starting out or already engaged.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ange Vierge
description:
Ange Vierge is a Japanese trading card game jointly launched by Fujimi Shobo and Kadokawa MEDIA FACTORY, and is gradually expanding into the fields of light novels, comics, and smart phone games.
AngeVierge is a collection of the best illustrators under the Kadokawa Group in Japan. It focuses on popular light novel illustrators such as Supervisor, Dog God Huang, Fukasaki Mujin, etc., and is assisted by the "Sword Art Online" illustrator abec.
Players fight with characters called "Evolutioner",and they can use special ability called "link",the player who makes the opponent has 8 card in the damage area wins the game.

name: Dossier 1936: Berlin
description:
We are in 1936, in the heart of Berlin. Renovation work on Charlottenburg Palace has revealed a secret tunnel leading to an Egyptian death chamber! A worker, then an agent of Hitler are found dead. This is too much for the Gestapo, who want a culprit! A closed-door session that is crucial for your survival begins: investigate, question, exploit the clues you obtain and above all, doubt! This is how, guilty or innocent, you will save your skin at the end of the evening!

Dossier 1936: Berlin, is the first of four episodes in a series of murder parties, or investigative evenings by studio Deadcrows! These four parts are playable independently, but together they piece together an even darker case than the four crimes each of them has you investigating! Try to find out what is going on in the different scenarios.

—description from the publisher

name: Beyond the Saale: A Fictional Seven Years War Campaign
description:
Beyond The Saale is a fictional Seven Years War campaign that depicts a drive into Prussia by Austrian and French forces in an effort to keep Prussia off balance after they knocked Russia out of the war.

While fictional in nature, the commanders and force strengths represent what would have been available for a possible campaign.

Although designed to use the campaign system in the Warfare in the Age of Reason supplements, gamers could basically use any campaign system that they want.

The forces are given in terms of strength points, which could be used to represent units for the set of rules that players choose to use.

For those familiar with the Age of Reason army lists you simply convert the forces (given in strength points or SPs) into the percentages shown in the army lists.

This is a unique campaign in that both sides will know where the French and Austrian forces are entering from.

At this time in the Seven Years War both of these armies were not exactly know for their rapid movements, but once on the campaign map they could strike in several different directions.

The French and Austrian armies will have the advantage in numbers during the early stages of the campaign, which is offset by the Prussian movement and tactical ratings of the commanders.
With multiple paths to victory the campaign has pretty good replay value and our gaming group has already played it twice over the years.

In the end, it tries to do what most miniatures campaigns do and that is to provide unique and interesting battles that you would not ordinarily see on your regular gaming night.

- Description from the ruleset
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Blue Moon City: Hospital & Meeting Hall Promo Tiles
description:
The Hospital and Meeting Hall Promo tiles were originally available in "Der Knizia Almanach I".

They, along with the Theater and Golden Shrine promo tiles, were later made available by Fantasy Flight Games as free download.

Hospital - A player who finishes their turn on the hospital draws two additional cards.

Meeting Hall - A player who finishes their turn on the meeting hall may immediately jump to any other building tile but cannot execute any further actions or use special abilities there.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Diskwars: Legions – Nightmare in Nharwood
description:
Each Legions set is a complete game, ready to be played by both beginning and experienced DiskWars players. Legions contains everything you need for a two-player game of DiskWars.

There are 4 Legions 2-player Boxes: Dark Wings Over Nochaim (Dragon vs. Mahkim), Last Stand at Dunwarr (Dwarves vs. Orc), Massacre at Godstone Keep (Knight vs. Uthuk), and Nightmare in Nharwood (Elf vs. Undead).


Complete two-player game for Diskwars. Contains:

Pre-constructed Elf army
Pre-constructed Undead army
Complete game rules
Introductory quick-start sheet
Full-color map of Mennara
Several brand-new Disks unavailable elsewhere
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Five Parsecs: Officer Down
description:
Welcome to Officer Down, a scenario for Five Parsecs campaigns.

Take your existing crew from any of the campaign games and try your luck against hardened criminals.

Or if you prefer, use the quick generation methods in this scenario pack to generate a fierce squad of Enforcers.

The scenario includes tools for determining the opposition, campaign notes and random tables to generate variant scenarios, allowing no two games to play exactly the same.

Officer Down can be used with of the Five Parsecs campaigns.

Please note that this is NOT a stand-alone title. You MUST own a copy of one of the following games to use this except as inspiration:

Five Parsecs From Home: 2nd Edition
Five Parsecs: Gang Warfare
Five Parsecs: Bug Hunt
Five Parsecs: Salvage Crew


—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Patrol Missions: a Five Parsecs Mission Type
description:
With Patrol Missions you can add a new mission type to your games of Five Parsecs From Home.

Patrol missions can be incorporated into any on-going campaign, giving you a new way to play out battles.

Any Opportunity Mission, Quest and many Patron jobs can turn out to be a Patrol mission.

During Patrol missions you will sweep the area for possible enemy contacts and intercept them before they can leave the area. Contacts can result in fighting opposition or you might have an easy day without any shooting.

Occasionally, you will contend with enemy reinforcements as well.

The purpose of this mission pack is that it gives you an easy way to spice up the variety on your gaming table. It is intended for use with Five Parsecs From Home 1.13 or onwards (if you have purchased the rules legally, make sure to download the most recent version).

—description from the designer

name: Brain Heist: A Five Parsecs Scenario
description:
Brain Heist is a fun and quick scenario for the Five Parsecs miniatures rules.

Storm a shipping facility, secure a bunch of military-grade robot brains and make it out before the enemy onslaught gets too serious!

Playable as a solo scenario with random enemy reinforcements, this scenario can be dropped into any Five Parsecs From Home campaign.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ChaOS Trading Card Game
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





ChaOS (character operating system) is a trading card game published by bushiroad. Like weiss schwarz, you can use characters in popular animes or galgames.Your Main Deck is built from 50 cards, including characters, events, set cards, and the like. You may have up to 4 copies of cards with the same name. Extra cards can't go in your Main Deck; you may have an Extra Deck with up to 10 cards. If your Extra Deck has under 10 cards (for instance, 0) you can still play the game.

In Chaos TCG, your Main Deck is your Life. Each player's goal is to reduce their opponent's Main Deck to 0 through attacks and card effects.

name: Chlorination
description:
Chlorination is the name of the game and you get to be a professional swimmer. To categorize it, Chlorination is a strategic, card-based board game that consists of a number of competitions. During the game, you’ll need to choose your actions carefully. You’ll also need to plan your economy and most importantly you’ll need to practice enough to win the competitions throughout the game. The recommended age is from 12 years old and the game is for 2-5 players.

The game consists of eight competitions in total, two in each swimstyle; backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle. Before and between every competition, every player get five actions. The actions can be found on the game board and you can either work to earn coins, you'll need coins to pay competition fees and for other things. But you can also practice using skill cards. Whenever you work you earn a certain number of coins and skill cards depending on where you choose to work. Whenever you practice you move your cube on the score table the number that skill card shows. The player with the highest skill level in the the swimstyle of a competition wins and the player with the most medals wins the game in the end. A gold, a silver and a bronze medal are handed out every competition.

Watch the tutorial to learn more about the game of Chloriantion.

-description from designer

name: Northern Expedition of Wuhou
description: A mini wargame. Simulated Zhuge Liang(诸葛亮)'s several attacks on the Wei state during the Three Kingdoms period (220-280).

name: Marvel Battlebooks: Witchblade
description:
Two cards were bound into the comic book. One listed the rules and identified the features of the game. The second card was the character's Maneuver Card which listed the actions the character could take in combat.

Gameplay was similar to Lost Worlds. Each player picks a character and game books are exchanged so each player has a book that depicts POV illustrations of the opponent attacking. Maneuvers are simultaneously selected and the matrix encoded into the books determines the results of each exchange.

Witchblade was #17 in the series.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Player's Play
description:
Player's Play is a card game in which players can choose to participate ("play") each round or not, and the number of players that participate will determine what type of game is played.

Each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards, and 4 participation cubes. Two cards form the deck are turned face up and will determine the trump suits for the game. In turn order, the players decide if they wish to participate, spending a participation cube if they choose to do so.

If one player participates, it will be a solitaire game. If two players participate, it is a blackjack style game. If three players participate, it is a poker style game. If four participate, it is a trick-taking game. If a player wins one of these mini-games, they receive a victory point, and the first person to three victory points wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Every Journey Begins on a Road: A Five Leagues From the Borderlands Expansion pack
description:
This expansion pack for Five Leagues From the Borderlands is usable with any campaign and adds a new "roadside" encounter table.

This can be integrated into any campaign to add more variety, offering some low-intensity encounters against spiders, bandits and wandering fanatics.

This also means not every encounter you have is intrinsically tied to a Threat, making the game feel more alive and organic.

Additionally the pack also gives you a new tutorial sequence for starting a campaign, letting a new warband gain some experience and ease into the game before facing the full might of the Borderlands.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Starter Set
description:
Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition Box Set was a starter set for the 3rd Edition of Warhammer 40,000 released in 1998.

The box set contained the rulebook but the rulebook was also available on its own.

Contents:
- Black Templars: 9 Space Marines, 1 Space Marine Sergeant, 1 Landspeeder
- Dark Eldar: 20 Kabalite Warriors
- Other: Scenery, 6 Dice, templates, Rulebook. Reference Sheets
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Alpha Steel
description:
Out on the planet of Ibun, the Bots have created an advanced station. Here, the Bots must show their strength at the Alpha Steel Arena and decide who is the Last Bot Standing. The winner becomes the leader of the Elite Bot Army. The Age of the Human is over, the Age of the Bot begins! Go Droid!

In Alpha Steel, players control futuristic bots on the planet of Ibun. The goal is to defeat all other bots and remain the last player standing, inside the arena.

Everyone starts outside the arena with 1 rookie bot, 70,000 Azol (Azol- the currency in the game), 10 energy tokens, and 2 power cards. Each player starts with a rookie bot but can purchase a master bot during the game. On your turn, you will roll both dice.

From each dice you can: gain energy or 30,000 azol or attack other players’ bots. If you roll the same on both dice, you get double! For each attack you roll, your bot deals damage to other bots. The amount of damage you cause is written on your bot card. If you’re inside the arena, you attack everyone else. But if you’re outside the arena, you will only attack whoever is inside.

At the start, everyone is outside and the first player to roll an attack, enters the arena. All the other bots suffer damage. If you wish to leave the arena, you must wait till someone attacks you. Then, you pay the damage and exit. The player who had attacked you, must enter the arena.

If you stay in the arena for one whole round, you get 30,000 Azol after your dice roll. When you are inside, you can never gain health.

Power cards give your bots special strengths. you can play only one power card on your turn and must give it up after use. Some power cards can be played anytime. At no point can you have more than 2 power cards with you. Each power card has cost price and a profit or loss percentage mentioned in them. So, when you sell a card you do so either at a profit or a loss. All power cards sell at 50% loss, while all rookie bots sell at 50% profit. You can buy only one power card or a bot at the end of your turn. But, if you are inside the arena, you can buy a power card or bot anytime. If another player attacks you and you cannot pay Azol, you can sell your power card to get azol, otherwise you are eliminated. If you ever run out of energy tokens, you are eliminated!

When only two players remain in the game, it is the final duel. Both their bots enter the arena. You cannot buy any power cards or bots. you also cannot get energy or azol from dice.However, you can use the power cards you already have. The duel continues till a player is eliminated.

A round of play:
Your turn begins by rolling both dice. Then, you can play your power card. Other players cannot play a power card unless it is a play anytime card. Now, resolve the dice roll. remember if you are inside, you attack everyone. if you are outside, you only attack the person inside. Next, you can buy a power card or a bot. the player inside can buy anytime, other players can buy only on their turn. If the player inside wants to exit, they must do it now. If they exit, you must enter the arena. A player cannot exit if you did not roll an attack. Your turn ends.

Alpha Steel is a strategy based board game that is perfect for all ages. Whether it’s game night with friends, weekends with family or to combine the power of learning and play for kids, the board game provides an awesome experience for all. Enjoy as you use your robot’s special powers and tactics to vanquish other bots and lead the entire bot army.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Market, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Angels of Death
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


From the back cover:

The Dark Angles and the Blood Angels Space Marine Chapters are both dedicated guardians of the Imperium and loyal servants of the Emperor. To mankind, they are awe-inspiring figures that bring hope and salvation. To the enemies of mankind they are creatures of terri and dread. Yet each harbours a sinister millennia-old secret that sets them apart from their brother Space Marines and may yet bring them both eternal damnation.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin: Playmat – Flower's Kitten Caboodle
description: Munchkin Playmat: Flower's Kitten Caboodle is a 28"×14" playmat that includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear. And since you’ve been nice this year, you get an in-game gift just for using this mat! Once per game, you may discard a Level 1 monster from your hand for a free escape from a monster, and you get its Treasure!

name: Plunderbund: Supply & Conquer
description:
In Supply & Conquer the rival guilds in Plunderbund gain asymmetric abilities. These abilities give more ways for guilds to enhance their reputation while also encouraging novel game play strategies.

The expansion includes 13 Supply & Conquer cards. Each guild gains two new abilities. The cards can be assigned to specific guilds or drafted during a new Winter draft.

Supply & Conquer is a fan driven and fan named expansion published by HutChu Games.

-description from publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mafia
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Worker Placement

name: Naval War: The World War II Naval Miniatures Game
description:
Naval War is a Tabletop Naval Miniatures Game designed to be played on a table-sized battle area with World War Two ship miniatures. The rules and any gaming aids needed for play are free and available for download on the site. The game is not tied to a specific miniatures line and is suited for many different game scales (1:1800 - 1:6000)

Naval War is a game, not a simulation. The aim of the game is to recreate the feeling and immersion you get when reading the battle reports of famous sea battle like the Battle of the Coral Sea or the battle of the Java Sea. The focus lies on the action and on the ships on the table, so a lot of the technical details have been worked into easy to read datacards and quick game mechanics.

The heart and soul of the game is your fleet's Command Station which is used to issue order to your fleet and activate the different squadrons of ships, planes and subs. Let your fleet perform actions like maneuvering, attacking and launching carrier aircraft but also special Command station actions that will allow your fleet to perform above and beyond the call of duty: Perform evasive maneuvers as a response to enemy fire or appeal to the British sense of duty to keep your ship in the fight when others would have broken off. Try to place that one critical hit or lay down smoke to shield your carriers from enemy fire.

You are however not the only hero in this game; your opponent may (and will) try to disrupt your actions which may result in your attempt at flank speed backfiring because of an engine malfunction! This dynamic, in combination with the activation-based game sequence makes sure both players stay continually involved in the game. It also allows the players to have just that little bit of extra influence on Lady Luck. Underlying all this are solid game mechanics for modeling surface combat, air attacks and submarine actions with a balance between simplicity, gaming comfort and realistic outcomes.

Naval War is a so-called ‘living rule-set’ so any suggestions, feedback and additions are taken very seriously resulting in regular updates and expansions. Crowd-sourcing is also one of the strategies employed to generate content, so if you got this special ship, scenario, campaign or other contribution to the system, join the community and make it part of the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Order Counters, Simulation

name: PanzerBlitz Minigame
description: This is a minigame of tactical armor and infantry combat in Russia during WWII. Essentially a one-scenario demo, PanzerBlitz Minigame uses the game system developed in SPI's TAC Game 3 and refined for PanzerBlitz (a design sold to and published by Avalon Hill). PanzerBlitz Minigame was published in Strategy & Tactics 22 and uses the mapsheet for the main game published in that issue, Renaissance of Infantry: Tactical Warfare, 1250 A.D-1550 A.D (which dealt with tactical warfare between 1250 A.D. and 1550 A.D.). In addition to the rules folder and mapsheet, there were 60 counters (30 German, 30 Russian).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour – Update
description:
Continuing Forge World's series of Imperial Armour books, here is an exhaustive listing of a wide variety of vehicles for use in your Warhammer 40,000 games.

This guide to armoured warfare in the 41st Millennium is packed with rules and background on a wide variety of Space Marine, Imperial Guard, Sisters of Battle, Ork, Tau, Chaos and Eldar vehicle variants, as well as monstrous Tyranid creatures. From the awesome power of the Thunderhawk gunship to mighty Ork fighters or Chaos Dreadclaw assault boats. You will also find full details of the Imperial Guards greatest tank aces, new rules and errata from the first two Imperial Armour books and advice on fielding mighty Titans on your tabletop.

This is a complete update for all the models available from Forge World. Here are all the rules you need to include Imperial Armour models in your games of Warhammer 40,000.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Imperial Armour II
description: Imperial Armour II - Ork, Eldar and Dark Eldar Vehicles for Warhammer 40,000 is a gaming supplement released by Forge World. The book has 50 pages and was second in the original soft cover Imperial Armour series until replaced by the larger, re-numbered hard covered editions. This volume focuses on Eldar, Dark Eldar, and Orks.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Loot Doodles
description:
Loot Doodles is a print & play game in which you sail to various islands and collect treasures. At the beginning of the game, you draw your ship on the map. In each of the four rounds, you sail to up to four islands and take one resource (decided by which port you sail to, by drawing a line onto the map). After each round, you return to your ship and deliver the treasure.
However, the lines you draw may not cross each other, so you will have to plan ahead carefully. Also, ports on each island are numbered I to III, and you cannot go to the same number or to a different port on the same island twice in a row. For each resource you grab you get points. The goal is to score as many points as possible during the four rounds.

In the multiplayer game, players keep their maps hidden. They take turns being the captain and announcing the number of the port everyone has to sail to.

Players can use one of the maps included in the game, or draw their own at the beginning of the game.

name: Flames of War: Soviet Starter Force – Heavy Assault Group
description:
The Soviet 11th Guards Army (11ya Gvardeyskiy Armiya) and 31st Army (31ya Armiya) fell upon Orsha on 26 June 1944.
A solitary Soviet tank brigade from the 2nd Tank Corps swept around to the west of the city, completing the encirclement.
The German remnants of General Volkers' 27th Army Corps were now trapped inside the city and prepared for a tenacious defense of the city centre.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
